loans.name: Remelie

texts.en:
Remelie is 25 years old, single, and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. 

To make a living, she manages a fishing business, catching fish for sale. In 2010, Remelie joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and is now requesting a loan of PHP 18,200 to purchase a new set of fishing nets to be used for the business. 

She hopes to own a fishing boat, to be used to expand the business, for the better future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of fishng nets.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 52 years old. Lucita is married and has 7 children. To make a living, she manages a business planting and harvesting seaweed for sale. In 2011, Lucita joined GDMPC. Lucita is requesting a loan of 8,400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy seedlings and twine to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and twine to expand the business.

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Cham province, Im is married and blessed with two dependent kids. She and her husband strive for a living via rice farming on two hectares area as the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for ages and is able to earn about 11,800 KHR per day. With this first loan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner), she and her joint member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy potash for her farmland. She highly hopes that she can plant her rice fruitfully and gain back a good yield with good profit to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy potash for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin is 50 years old and married.  She and the rest of her family are living in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She has six children, three of whom still rely on her. To earn a living, she grows rubber trees, which she has been doing for a long time. Sarin, who has never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before, leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rubber tree plantation. She hopes that she can grow her rubber trees healthily so that she can collect more latex for resale; thereby she can earn more income to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rubber tree plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 35-year-old, married man, from Qalqilia city. 

Mustafa works as a worker with a low wage. This wage is barely enough to cover the family needs. 

He is looking to improve his home, especially the bedroom, the bathroom, and the kitchen. He does not have enough money for this, so he needs a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). His home will be improved and be ready, so Mustafa and his wife will live in it. 

Mustafa is pictured in front of his home.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing his home.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-year-old, young man, from Jabalia. He is a very hard worker, but the income he gets is very low. Alaa wants to complete his home and buy all the necessary home appliances and furniture, so he will be ready to get married. 

Alaa took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Alaa to improve his home by buying some furniture, especially for the bedroom. 

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Santa Lucia está conformado por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Son madres y padres responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Y luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  Petrona es la coordinadora del banco comunal Santa Lucia y tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y  venta de cerdos en pie que se lo ofrecen a buen precio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Santa Lucia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas d escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Santa Lucia is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. They are from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the country. They are the responsible parents of 20 children. Each of the group's members is hardworking, responsible, and looking to excel. Unfortunately, none of the members were able to finish school because of financial hardship. Each one fights every day in order to offer their children a better future. 

Thanks to her hard work and the desire to move forward, Petrona became the coordinator of the Santa Lucia communal bank group. She makes a living raising and selling pigs from her home. She is requesting this loan in order to have working capital to invest in the purchase of pigs to raise and later sell at a good price. In this way, she hopes to increase her profits. 

The Santa Lucia communal bank group is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders offer to people in developing countries like Nicaragua where financial resources are scarce, so that the people can find dignified work.

loans.use: invest working capital in raising and selling pigs.

loans.name: Antonio De Jesús

texts.es:
Antonio es un humilde campesino, dedicado al oficio de la ebanistería desde hace más de 10 años, como medio de sostenimiento para su hogar. Siempre ha laborado como empleado, pero asegura que el pago no ha sido mejor. Hoy tiene un gran sueño, abrir su propio negocio y crear nuevas fuentes de empleo para el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida no sólo de su familia sino de otras personas de su vereda. 
Asegura que su trabajo es bastante apreciado y reconocido, por lo cual no le será difícil iniciar en el mercado laboral.
Para dar inicio a su gran proyecto, Antonio se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de herramientas y materia prima-madera- con el fin de iniciar a trabajar. Sueña con salir adelante y ofrecerle a su familia una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Antonio is a humble resident of the countryside who has supported his family by working as a cabinetmaker for more than 10 years now. He has always worked as an employee, but his wages have not been the best. 

Today, his dream is to open his own business to create a new source of employment and to improve not only his own family's quality of life but also the lives of other individuals who cross his path. He assures that his work is well-appreciated and recognized and, thus, it will not be difficult for him to enter the market. 

In order to begin his great project, Antonio is asking for a loan that he will use to purchase tools and raw materials such as wood. The aim is to begin working. 

He dreams of being successful and providing his family with economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase tools and raw materials such as wood.

loans.name: Raíces Chilotas Group

texts.es: Raíces Chilotas es un Banco Comunal ubicado en Castro, X región de Chile, en donde las socios tienen rubros de venta de ropa, peluquería, venta de empanadas milcao y comidas varias, costuras y María, quien está al costado izquierdo de la fotografía con un abrigo negro y sweater verde junto a una socia de polerón rosado, tiene un negocio en donde vende empanadas, completos y almuerzos, tiene un puesto en la feria y además le vende a sus vecinos. Comenzó su negocio hace tres años, y lo hizo para poder ayudar a su hijo para pagar sus estudios. Los problemas que ha tenido han sido más que nada por lograr un lugar en la feria para poder vender sus almuerzos y empanadas. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado podrá comprar más mercadería para poder hacer sus empanadas, completos y almuerzos, además de tener la esperanza de poder comprar una máquina para estirar masa para empanadas. Le gusta mucho trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza, además de que para ella ha sido favorable el poder compartir con personas que piensan igual a ella, con ganas de superarse y todas con un mismo propósito.
texts.en:
'Raíces Chilotas' is a community bank located in Castro, the tenth region of Chile.  The members of this group sell clothing, do hairdressing, sell potato empanadas and other food, sew and María, who is on the left of the photo wearing a black coat and green sweater standing next to a member wearing a pink sweatshirt, has a business selling empanadas, 'completos' (a type of hot dog) and lunches.  She has a stall in the street market and also sells to her neighbors.  She started her business three years ago so that she could help her son and pay for his education.  The problem that she has faced has been trying to acquire a spot in the market from which to sell her lunches and empanadas.

María will use the loan she has requested to buy more merchandise so that she can make her empanadas, hot dogs and lunches.  She also hopes to be able to buy a machine to knead the dough for her empanadas.  She very much enjoys working together with Fondo Esperanza and it has been good for her to share with people who think like she does, who want to improve themselves and who all have the same goal.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a kneading machine

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Fausta who is in her mid 30s is married. She has been running a beauty salon for three years now.  She works from 8.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Fausta's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a dryer, sewing equipment, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to start selling cosmetics. Her dream is to one day be able to become an international businesswoman. 

Fausta will share this loan with her loan group "Saranga" with fourteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling cosmetics

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Boldbaatar, 34 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2005 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them quickly and shortening routes. His wife has been working as a saleswoman for seven years and is quite experienced at her job. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. So Boldbaatar is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he can repair and insulate his house thus creating comfortable and warm accommodations for his family. Also the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and thus contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 41-year-old widow who has four children and lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has a farm planting and harvesting bananas for sale. In 2009, she joined GDMPC and gained access to microfinance services; she is now requesting 7,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to cultivate the farm like under cropping in order to gather additional income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Selling coconut wine is what Evelyn does for a living. She is from Capucao, Ozamiz City, is married, and has 7 children. At 44 years old, Evelyn hopes to venture into her business of corn production. She is applying for a loan of 7,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to finance this farming activity. She is hopeful that this will bring additional income to the family.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for her corn production .

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta is married and has 10 children. She works hard to support her family.  She sells tobacco in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Perfecta is requesting her sixteenth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional bundles of tobacco to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Arame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe constitué de vingt huit femmes existe depuis le 9 avril 2011; les femmes habitent le même village et leurs activités dominantes sont le commerce et l'élevage.

Ndéye Mariame la représentante est la secrétaire du Banc Villageois, elle est mariée mère de deux filles.Elle mène un petit commerce de ( sucre,savon, habits, chaussures....); elle gère une petite boutique, mais également fait de l'embouche ovine.Elle est à droite sur la photo habillée en pagne carrelé bleu blanc et a levé la main gauche.



Avec son prêt elle envisage d'investir 30000 F pour les différents produits qu'elle vend et 20000 F pour l'achat d'un mouton pour l'embouche ovine.Ainsi elle espère se faire plus de revenus.


Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne pour finaliser la construction de ses 2 chambres. A noter qu'elle a fait un retrait sur son épargne pour la construction.
texts.en:
This group, consisting of 28 women, has been in existence since April 9, 2011 ; its membres live in the same village and work mainly as vendors and animal farmers.

Ndéye Mariame, the group’s representative, is the secretary of the Banc Villageois. She is married and has two daughters. She manages a small shop selling sugar, soap, clothing, shoes etc; she also raises sheep. In the photo, she stands on the right wearing a blue and white checkered outfit and raising her left hand.

With this loan, she plans to invest 30,000 West African francs in miscellaneous merchandise for resale, and 20,000 francs to buy a sheep for fattening and resale. She hopes to earn more revenues in this way. Thanks to this income, she plans to bolster her savings in order to finish the construction of two rooms in her home. She had to withdraw some of her savings for the construction work.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Edlene

texts.en: Edlene is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm harvesting coconuts for copra production to sell to earn a living. In 2010, she joined GDMPC and she gained access to micro finance service and is now requesting an amount of 19,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to maintain the farm in order to have an abundant harvests in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin, 49, is married with five children residing in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province. Three of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the big family, she and her husband have been growing rice for fifteen years. Together, they can earn about 20,000 Riels (KHR) per day and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Chin's group consists of two members who are both women, and they both have had four loans from VisionFund. Chin completely paid back the loans with VisionFund and successfully used the loans to better support her family. Chin will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family's income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Aged 32 years old, Vit is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. Both of her two children are still in school. To support her family, Vit has been farming rice and her husband works as a paid worker for seven years in the village. The current business earns her about $7 per day.

Vit has had three loans from VisionFund already and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihoods. Now she is applying for another loan to buy more plots of farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to have more farmland to grow her rice on to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more plots of farmland

loans.name: Tompor

texts.en:
Tompor is 30 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  She lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. For the last six years, Tompor and her husband have been farming rice on four-hectare farmland as the main source of family’s income. Together, they earn about 60,000 KHR per day.

Tompor is requesting her second loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will improve her crop yield so as to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is 31 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She is a person who always tries to find a source of income. She has some experience in animal husbandry as she grew up in the country. She decided to organize her own business with animal husbandry. With this aim she studied at a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization. She learnt how to compile a business plan. Her child will help her with managing the business. 

Nigora is asking for a loan to buy cattle. In this way she will provide her family with high quality living conditions. Moreover, she will enter her child in good schools. She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start up a new business

loans.name: Luis Abraham

texts.es: Luis, tiene 39 años y es padre de tres hijos menores de edad, desde hace cinco años se dedica al comercio mayorista. Compra condimentos al por mayor y los distribuye en tiendas y supermercados de su localidad y zonas aledañas. Gracias a su labor su familia goza de una vivienda y sus hijos de educación. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capital de trabajo con el fin de aumentar sus ganancias y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Sueña con crecer dentro del mercado local y garantizarle a sus hijos mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 39 years old and the father of 3 minor children. For the last 5 years, he has been involved in wholesale commerce. He buys condiments at wholesale and distributes them to stores and supermarkets in his locality and adjacent zones. Thanks to his labor, his family enjoys a home and his children an education.

At present, Luis is requesting a loan to increase his working capital, in order to augment his earnings and satisfying customer needs. Luis dreams of expanding his business in the local market and guaranteeing better opportunities in life for his children.

loans.use: buy condiments at wholesale to distribute.

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sakhorn is 53 years old and widowed. To make a living, she has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for fifteen years. From the current business, she can earn about 23,000 KHR per day and can save about 14,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sakhorn has been with VisionFund for five cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group of four members are applying for a loan. Sakhorn is the leader, and she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow rice well so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
Chamroen is aged 54 years, living with his family members in a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. He is married with two children. He has been working as an electrician in the local area to support his family for 20 years. The current business earns him about 22,000 KHR per day and he manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Chamroen has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Chamroen successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve his family’s living conditions and now he is confident of making a living better. Requesting a loan with VisionFund, Chamroen, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy more spare parts for his business. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from the current business so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for his business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is married and the mother of four children. She is from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol and, with her husband, has been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. This is their only source of income. Liza is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other gear. Through this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Liza hopes to make their fishing business a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other gear

loans.name: Ror's Group

texts.en:
Ror, 45 years old, is a married mother of four children living in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. One of her four children is still in school. She is a rice farmer and supplements her income by selling sugarcane juice in a village. She has been in the business for 20 years and she can earn about 67,000 KHR per day, saving about 8,000 KHR each day. 
This is the second loan for Ror’s group of two and she completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice production to increase her family’s income and she hopes to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Blue-S Group

texts.en:
Blue-S is a group composed of five Filipino ladies who joined hands in order to help each other out, thus seeking to acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua. Dorina is the group leader and featured member of Blue-S, standing the second from the left in the picture, wearing an orange jacket. She is a 62-year-old widow and mother of two children who live in the Philippines; she works as a housekeeper. Her situation as the only financial resource of the family forced her to leave her children, because it was the only way for her to be able to provide for their necessary expenses. Her highest degree at school is elementary, which was an obstacle for her to be able to work in any other domain. The Al Majmoua loan would enable her to cover the enrollment fees of her children's universities. 

Aylin is a 49-year-old married mother of three children, who works as a housekeeper for a Lebanese family. She is the lady standing second to the right in the picture. Her husband and children live back in the Philippines. She wished to acquire the Al Majmoua loan in order to help her husband with the enrollment fees of their children.

Evangelyn is a 29-year-old single lady, standing on the far right of the picture and working as a housekeeper for a Lebanese family. She joined the Blue-S group in order to help her family back in the Philippines with the high university tuition fees of her niece. 

Percy is a 39-year-old married mother, standing in the middle of the picture. She works in a retail store and sells clothes. Her husband and two children are Lebanese. Her husband is a low-income employee. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to help with the heavy expenses of her family.

Angelie is a 40-year-old single lady, standing on the far left of the picture. She works as a housekeeper for a Lebanese family as well. Just like Evangelyn, Angelie wished to acquire the Al Majmoua loan in order to help her family back in the Philippines with the university tuition fees of her niece.

loans.use: to cover the enrollment fees of her children's universities.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en: Teofilo is 37 years of age and married with two children. To support his family, he engages in his farming business. Besides himself, his wife also helps him in doing some farm activities such as planting. With their harvested rice, they are able to finance their daily expenditures. Aside from that, some of their yield serves as their daily food intake. Wanting to harvest more yield, Teofilo wants to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000. He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides. According to Teofilo, that requested amount will surely assist him in improving his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Lomer

texts.en: Lomer is a farmer who raises crops to sell as his business. He patiently involved himself in planting and harvesting rice to sell in order to sustain his family's needs. Lomer is now 56 years old and has three children. He wanted to improve his crop production but had insufficient funds for fertilizer and insecticides. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 37,000 to buy 1 liter of insecticides, fertilizer and pesticides needed in farming. This will be very helpful in achieving a healthy growth of crops and someday will lead him to a healthy income as well.

loans.use: to buy 1 liter of insecticides, fertilizer and pesticides needed in farming

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sok is a 40-year-old mother of two dependent children who are still in school. To support her children, Sok has been farming rice for five years while her husband has been working as a paid construction worker in the local area. Together, they can earn about 37,000 KHR per day.
Sok received her first loan and she completely repaid the loan with VisionFund. She has used the loan to better support her living. Now she is applying for another loan. As the leader, Sok is going to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her rice paddy so as to make a living better and to fulfill her dream to renovate her old house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Phorn is 38 years old and married with five children, one of whom is a dependent and still in school. For the last 10 years, she and her husband have been farming rice on six-hectares of farmland. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs. 
This is the fifth loan for Phorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She fully repaid the loans. Now Phorn is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, Phorn is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice successfully and make more rice so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer a la que le ha tocado guerrearse la vida incansablemente a fin de generar lo necesario para vivir. Por su carencia educativa, el mundo laboral le cerró las puertas, razón por la que recurrió al subempleo con el fin de sobrevivir. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de fritos en la esquina de su residencia, en donde ya es reconocida por su trabajo. Diariamente comienza muy temprano su faena hasta el anochecer. 
Con el fin de seguir desarrollando su actividad, Adriana se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, con el fin de reponer el anterior que se encuentra en mal estado. Sueña con mejorar su condición económica y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriana has had to fight all her life to earn enough to live. The labor market doors were closed to her because she lack an education; therefore, she has resorted to low-wage jobs to survive. For more than 10 years, she has sold fried food from a corner in her house, and her business is well known. She works every day from early morning until dusk. 

Adriana has applied for a loan so that she can grow her business by buying a fast-food cart to replace the one she has now, which is in poor condition. She dreams of improving her financial situation and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fast-food cart.

loans.name: Byambachimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambachimeg, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been selling computers and their spare parts to local people, renting stall at a trade center for a long time. Her husband has been rendering taxi service to local people using his own automobile. 

Mrs. Byambachimeg is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts from China in large volume, so that she can continue to run her sales business without worrying about inventory shortages, and generate more income for her family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase spare computer  parts from China in large volume

loans.name: Houch's Group

texts.en:
Houch, 42, is a married mother living in a rural village of Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who grow rice on five hectares of farmland and sometimes work for others for a fee. Together, with hard work, they can earn about 26,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for their future needs.
Houch has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She successfully used the past loans to gradually improve her family’s living. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing and labor. She hopes to make more rice and increase yields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 25 years old. He is a married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is the breadwinner of his family. He is an employee getting a low salary, who tries to work hard every day to be able to offer the best to his family. He feels embarrassed when guests come to visit and he does not have furniture for his home. 

Mohammed is requesting a youth loan in order to purchase furniture for his house. His dream is to keep on acquiring the things he lacks; the challenge he faces is fighting any problems that arise.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo is 49 years old, married, and has six children.  He is  from Ubay, Bohol. He is engaged in the motorcycle transport business, which he has been doing for more than 18 years. 

Lorenzo is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy spare parts for his motorcycle such as wheel tire, chain, nuts, and bolts. With the loan, he will be able to improve his business and makes it a success and a stable source of income. He wants to save money for the schooling of his children and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle such as wheel tire, chain, nuts, and bolts.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
María Fernanda tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo provincia  Bolívar. 

María se dedica a la venta de dulces artesanos. 

 Solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para estar informado. La compra la realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda.

El sueño es seguir luchando contra cualquier problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse con los hermanos.
texts.en:
María Fernanda, age 22, is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in Chimbo in the Bolívar province.

María sells homemade baked goods.

She is requesting the loan to buy a television.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs in order to be informed.  She will make the purchase in the city of Guaranda.

Her dream is to continue struggling against any problem.  In her free time she likes to get together with her siblings.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha de 48 años de edad, es una mujer que se ha caracterizado por buscar mejores oportunidades de vida para sus dos hijos. Aprendió el oficio de confección desde su juventud, por lo cual ha trabajado en este sector la mayor parte de su vida. Hace algún tiempo decidió abrir una miscelánea con el fin de complementar su actividad económica y generar mayores ingresos que le permitieran satisfacer las necesidades en su hogar. En la actualidad se siente satisfecha por los logros alcanzados, asegura que tener la oportunidad de brindarles educación a sus hijos es su mayor motivo de felicidad. Con el fin de seguir ejerciendo el oficio de la confección Martha se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina recubridora con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Martha, 48, looks for the best opportunities to support her two children. As a youngster, she learned tailoring and has spent most of her life in this trade. Some time ago, she decided to open a small shop to compliment her trade and to earn more income to meet household expenses. 

She is satisfied with the goals she has achieved. She says that the chance to offer her children an education is the main reason she is happy. Martha has applied for a loan to buy a coverstitch machine so that she can keep working as a seamstress and improve both customer service and her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine.

loans.name: Mrd Group

texts.en:
MRD is a group composed of three Filipino women who work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They decided to form the group because they realized that they could rely on each other and acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua. Escarilla is the group leader and featured member of the group. She is the lady standing on the far left of the picture. Escarilla is a 44-year-old married mother of two children. She decided to establish the group because the loan would enable her to help her husband pay the schooling expenses of her children who live in the Philippines. Her family has a very low revenue per month, which is a great burden because she cannot provide a good and healthy type of life for her children.
Ruberlita is a 28-year-old single mother of two. She is standing in the middle of the picture. Her house back in the Philippines needs renovation and maintenance, which is why she needs the Al Majmoua loan.
Finally, Mary Ann is a 31-year-old mother, standing on the right of the picture. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to help her retired parents back in the Philippines.

loans.use: to help her husband pay for the schooling expenses of her children

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
At the age of 59, Man is a married woman with seven children, three of whom decided to work in a casino to get monthly payments because they want to help their parents earn their living. Man lives in a rural area of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. 

Man has owned and run a grocery from her home for almost ten years, generating a net profit of USD 5 per day to meet the basic needs of her family and pay allowances for her school-aged children. Likewise, her husband provides bicycle-repair services from their home to increase the household income.

Man just started her first loan through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), a long-standing Kiva partner. Now she is asking for a loan of USD 500 (US dollars). Man will utilize it to construct a bathroom, which will contain a bath and a toilet. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a healthy bathroom, so as to improve their hygienic standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a bathroom, which will contain a bath and a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Bo is 39 years old and married. She has eight children, four of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice on four hectares of farmland to make a living and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to earn extra income. The current business earns her about KHR 23,000 per day and she can save about KHR 17,000 each day for future needs.

Bo’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully used the past loans to gradually improve her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for another loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it on gasoline. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en: Mauricia is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children, from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store, selling various goods  to the people in her neighborhood. This is the source of her income. Mauricia is applying for a loan to buy more stocks of goods to sell, such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries. In this way, she will be able to expand her store and attract more customers, thus augmenting her sales and her income. In the future, Mauricia hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store, such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Leang is 47 years old and has seven children. Currently, two of her kids are in school. To cover her family’s expenses, Leang and her husband farm rice on three hectares of farmland. Leang has been in this business for 23 years and she can earn about 39,600 KHR per day. 

Leang has never applied for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before. Now, she forms a group of two to apply for their first loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Leang is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides to protect her rice. She hopes that she can acquire enough capital to do her business and to expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to protect her rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng, a rural villager from Kandal province's Ponhea Leur district, is 56 years old. She has five children. Cheng has earned a living through farming rice on one hectare of farmland while her husband is a paid worker in the local area to make more income for the family. Having been engaged in this business for 10 years, Cheng is able to save up to five US dollars per day from her current business after deducting expenses. 

This is the fourth cycle loan for Cheng with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past business loans, which she successfully paid back, have helped her to improve her living conditions as well as her business in a gradual manner. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan in amount of 200 U.S. Dollars to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter, a 24-year-old freshman in a local university specializing in agriculture. She sincerely hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university and also help her son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: A rural villager in Battambang province, Sarin is a farmer who grows rice locally on two hectares of farmland, while her husband helps with farming and works for others for pay, to supplement the family’s income. She has three children, two of whom are still in school. She has been in her current business  for 10 years, and she is able to earn about 18,900 KHR per day. Her previous loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was her first loan. After repaying it successfully, she feels confident that she can improve her living conditions at a good pace. Now she is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is applying for 800,000 KHR, while her co-member is applying for 100,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing rice in the rainy season. She hopes that she can get a high crop yield from her farming, to achieve better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to grow rice in the rainy season.

loans.name: Rokiyas' Group

texts.en:
Rokiyas lives in a rural area of  Kampong Cham province, Dambae district. She has five children. Three of them are still in school and the remaining two have their own occupations as paid-workers. Rokiyas earns a living by farming one hectare of cassava and a half hectare of rubber trees. To help her to earn extra income, her husband purchases cows for resale. 

This is Rokiyas's first time applying for a loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Rokiyas’s group consists of two female members including her. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, plow her farmland, and pay for labor. She hopes to earn more income so as she can have better living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, plow her farmland, and pay for labor

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Living in the Sangke district’s Battambang province, Ny is 33 years old and a married mother of three dependent children. The source of her family’s income is cassava farming. To help the family, her husband also works for others for a fee during his spare time. Ny's current business, which she has been involved with for 10 years, has earned her about 30,800 KHR per day and she manages to save 9,500 KHR after daily expenses. 

Ny has never applied for a loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before. Now she and her fellow group member are requesting a new loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Ny will use her loan portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing. She hopes to improve her business and to make a good living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for plowing

loans.name: Damnak's Group

texts.en:
A local villager from Kampong Cham province’s Thbaung Khmum district, Damnak is 34 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are still her dependents because they are still in school. Damnak manages one and a half hectares of land for cassava farming, which she has engaged in for 13 years and is able to earn about 19,000 KHR per day. 

Damnak is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and managed to use it to support her family, especially to keep her children in school. Now, Damnak forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to by cassava seedlings and to pay for labor, which she hires to plant her cassava and to plow her farmland. Damnak hopes that she can double the yield from her business and earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and to pay for labor, which she hires to plant her cassava and to plow her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ever De Jesús

texts.es:
Ever es un campesino del municipio de Sonsón, Antioquia, Colombia. Dedicado a labrar el campo desde su juventud. Hoy se le ha abierto una oportunidad de tener su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas en su municipio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de activos e insumos para la preparación de alimentos. Asegura que es una gran oportunidad de iniciar con su actividad comercial, debido a que el lugar se encuentra estratégicamente ubicado y es de acceso concurrido. 
Su mayor deseo es mejorar su condición económica y garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de  vida.
texts.en:
Ever is a small farmer from the town of Sonsón, Antioquia, Colombia. He has done farm labor since he was a child. He now has an opportunity to run his own business selling fast food in Sonsón. 

Ever is therefore seeking a loan that he will use to purchase ingredients and supplies for food preparation. He is confident that this is a great opportunity to open his business as it is in an excellent location with a high volume of traffic.  

Ever's most fervent wish is to improve his financial situation and ensure a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and staple food items.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru:
Одил   мужчина в возрасте 52 лет. Он женат и  имеет троих чудесных  детей. Его жена  домохозяйка,занимается домашними делами.  Старший сын Одила находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, он каждый месяц по возможности присылает родителям денежные средства.  Так как в молодости у Одила были проблемы по финансовой части, он не смог учится в ВУЗ-е и получить образование. Теперь он вынужден заниматься только откормом скота.
Но этот бизнес спасает их и дает очень хорошую прибыль.  Дополнительно Одил по ночам подрабатывает охранником. Он старается делать все чтобы его дети не нуждались не в чем.  
От своих знакомых Одил узнал,что в организации Арванд дают кредиты и он решил подать заявку.  Он хочет купить скот  и увеличить поголовье скота.  Очень надеется,что в Арванде ему помогут и поддержать финансово.
texts.en: Odil is married and 52 years old. He has a wife and three wonderful children. His wife is a homemaker who takes care of household chores. Their older son lives and works in the Russian Federation. Every month if possible, he sends money home to his parents. Since Odil had financial difficulties in his youth, he was not able to go to university and get an education. Now he can only engage in raising cattle. But this business has saved his family and provides a very good profit. Additionally, Odil moonlights as a security guard. He tries to do everything so that his children lack for nothing. From his friends Odil knew that the organization Arvand makes loans and he wrote to apply. He wants to buy cattle and increase his herd. He very much hopes that Arvand will help him and provide financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
An industrious mother of three children, aged 51, Khen is villager residing in Kampong Cham province where cassava is the one of the most popular cash-crops in the area among the local farmers. For Khen and the rest of her family, two hectares of cassava farming and one hectare of rice cropping are the main source of her income for daily food consumption. She has been in this business since she was 21 years old. Currently, this business earns 22,000 KHR per day. 

Khen has joined VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles and has successfully repaid back her loan already. This loan has empowered her to carry on the good living conditions of her family. Additionally, she can afford to provide three decent meals a day for her kids. With this new loan, she joins a group of two as the leader to apply for a new loan with VisionFund again. She and her co-borrower are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Khen will spend her loan portion to buy cassava seedlings for replanting and to pay for the ploughing fees for her cassava field. She hopes that she can grow healthy seedlings so that she can gain high yield with a good price.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedling for replanting and to pay the ploughing fee for her cassava field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Kofi is an entrepreneur. He specializes as a taxi driver in Abura Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Kofi is married and has one child. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their child’s school fees. Kofi wants to use his loan to purchase new parts and fuel. In the long term, Kofi plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase new parts and fuel.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in Likoni south of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married with two school-going children. She is a businesswoman dealing with the supply of building materials like gravel for five years now.

She found out about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase working tools. She wants to have her own truck to aid the transportation of products to their destination.

The biggest challenge she faces is the expensive means of transport. She wants to raise income through this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy working tools.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a proud farmer who works in the small village of Villa Domingo. She is 46 years old and is married to Ruben. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. To raise them, Evangeline and her husband are busy managing their farm. They have been in this business for almost 10 years. 

To this end, Evangeline is seeking a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings for her farm. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 57 years old and lives in Kapan city.  He is married and has two sons and a daughter.  His elder son and daughter are married and they live separately with their families.  Samvel’s wife works at Kapan copper company as a senior assistant.  Samvel works as a driver/distributor and is also engaged in agriculture.  He has a piece of his own land where he cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, and peppers.  Although his land is not big, it needs care and takes much time.  Samvel has watering problems since all irrigation pipes have become outdated with the passage of time. 

Samvel requests a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams to buy new pipes for irrigation and to repair the fences around his house.  He is sure that Kiva will support him and help him to overcome these problems.

loans.use: to buy new irrigation pipes and to repair the fences around his house.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Luis tiene 22 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo de 2 años vive con la esposa y con el hijos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la albañeria en construcciones de casas, el credito lo solicita para la compra de material para hacer unos arreglos en la casa de el. El credito le va ayudar a a realizar los arreglos en la casa para vivir mejor.

El sueño de luis es comprar un carro para salir a pasear con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis is 22 years old, married, and has a child aged two. He lives with his wife and their child in Guaranda in the Bolívar Province. He works as a bricklayer in the construction of houses. 

He is applying for this loan in order to buy building materials so that he can make some adjustments on his own house. The loan will help him to carry out the adjustments in order to improve his living conditions.

Luis' dream is to buy a car so that he can go on excursions with his family. In his spare time he likes to practice sports.

loans.use: to buy building materials to make some adjustments on his house

loans.name: Soeung's Group

texts.en:
Soeung is a 47-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are still in school. She is a farmer from Kandal province, Sa Ang district, where her residential area is. To assist her in earning extra income, her husband spends his spare time catching fish to sell. Soeung has worked in farming for 27 years. She is able to earn up to 26,400 KHR per day and she can save 9,700 KHR each day after deducting necessary expenses. 

This is Soeung's second loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan with success and it helped improve her living conditions and keep her kids in school. Soeung now leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash and to pay for plowing. She hopes that she will get a higher yield than last year so that she can earn more income for her kids and keep them in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum is a 47-year-old married woman who has four children.  She lives with her husband and two dependent children in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham.

Chhum’s last loan just ended.  She decided to request this loan for the development of a farming business and a recycling business.  If the loan will be approved she will be able to buy farming inputs such as seeds to spread on her paddy fields at the right time and in a suitable manner in the early coming raining season.  Another portion of the loan will be used as capital to purchase recycled materials from the surrounding people in her neighborhood.  Chhum is a really hardworking mother involving in three businesses at the same time (farming, recycling, and raising hogs).  In years to come, she wants to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs and to purchase recycled materials.

loans.name: Elmer Adolfo

texts.es: Elmer de 36 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y cacahuate tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable,  Elmer  se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizante, etc. Elmer  tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Elmer, 36, lives with his life partner and their two children. He grows corn, beans, and peanuts and has garnered much experience in the many years he has been farming. He is well known in the area and has many customers because his harvest is the best, and he offers quality merchandise at accessible prices and with unparalleled service.

Elmer is friendly, enterprising, and anxious to succeed. He wants to increase production, but he lacks working capital. He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seed, manure, weed killer, fertilizer, etc. Elmer references say he is honorable, responsible, and a reliable payer. He is confident he can make his payments while giving his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, weed killer, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Francia Ines

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Francia, quien con su credikiva compró mercancías como cuadernos, lapiceros, collares, relojes. Ella pudo comprar mas mercancía de la acostumbrada, le resultó muy provechosa, pues se incrementaron sus ventas.  Por eso dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “ Muchas gracias por su oportuna Colaboración. “ En la actualidad se encuentra aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el cual comprará artículos domésticos, de bisutería, de papelería y otras mercancías, con las que piensa hacer el deleite de su clientela y por su puesto para Francia es:  “ganar un poco mas”.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Francia, who bought merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, necklaces, and watches with her previous Kiva loan.  She was able to buy more merchandise than usual and it was really to her benefit as it helped increase sales.  That’s why she has this to say to her Kiva funders: “Thank you so much for your timely collaboration.”

Currently, she is applying for a new loan, with which she plans to buy household items, costume jewelry, stationery, and other merchandise. With these she plans to attract more customers and of course for Francia it helps her “earn some more”.

loans.use: to buy household items, costume jewelry, stationery, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Qufe

texts.en:
Qufe is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Qufe has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than 10 years now together with her husband.

Qufe is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. Moreover, Qufe wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
This is Lovella. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children. She has been in this business for only two years but it is growing fast. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan for 50,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lovella dreams of a continuous success in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 28-year-old single man who has been selling and repairing mobile phones, sim cards, and electronics (DVDs and CDs) for nine years.  He opened his own business in 2004 and is very proud that he took this step forward.

Today, Bilal is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the fourth time.  It will be used to increase his mobile phones, prepaid cards, and recharges, as they are highly requested by his customers.

He is a borrower in good standing and a man with a good reputation.  He is responsible for five members of his family, so he has to make sure that his business is good enough to cover their needs.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Elle est  âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle, c’est madame Fatou, qui fait du commerce de produits divers où elle a acquise une expérience de 15 ans. Elle vend du poisson fumé et séché, elle vend aussi  des fruits selon la période : oranges, mad, pastèques, mangues…
Madame Fatou a toujours su bien organiser son foyer  avec les revenus qu’il tire de son activité, elle donne une participation active dans la gestion de la maison.
Elle a comme désire de diversifier son activité commerciale.
texts.en: Ms. Fatou is 51 years old, married, and a mother of six. She is the one who does commerce in a variety of goods where she has acquired fifteen years of experience. She sells smoked and dried fish. She also sells fruit according to the season: oranges, 'mad' (a kind of eggplant), watermelons, mangoes, … Ms. Fatou always knew how to organize her home with the income earned from her business. She actively plays a role in managing the house. Her wish is to diversify her business.

loans.use: to purchase smoked and dried fish and seasonal fruits (oranges, mangoes, 'mad') to resell

loans.name: Milady

texts.es: Doña milady de 50 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica  a la venta y elaboración de recuerdos para fiestas rosas, bodas, bautizos, cumpleaños, etc. tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a precios realmente accesibles, doña milady solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales como: listones, pegamento adornos, etc. para seguir con su negocio y poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Milady is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two children in her own house. She is engaged in the sale and production of party favors for quinceañeras, weddings, baptisms, birthdays, etc. She has many customers, as she sells her products at truly affordable prices. 

Doña Milady is applying for a loan to purchase materials such as ribbons, glue, ornaments, etc., to continue her business and be able to earn better profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as ribbons, ornaments, glue, etc.

loans.name: Amigo Group

texts.en:
The group Amigo is composed of three Filipino men who have been friends ever since they came to Lebanon. They all work as housekeepers in Lebanese hotels. Richard is the group leader and the featured member standing on the far left of the picture. He is a 39-year-old married father, whose family is still living in the Philippines. His wife is unemployed, which makes him the main and only financial provider of the family. He established the Amigo group to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua, which would enable him to settle the school tuition fees of his children back in his home country. 

Doroteo is the man sitting in the middle of the picture. He is a 51-year-old married father as well. He wished to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua in order to send the money to his family back in the Philippines. 

Emiego Jr is the man sitting at the right of the picture. He is a 35-year-old man, married and has children who live in the Philippines. He also wished to acquire the Al Majmoua loan because his wife is unemployed and cannot provide enough financial resources for the family.

loans.use: to settle the school tuition fees of his children back in his home country.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel Berenise forma parte del grupo "Los Claveles" que está formado por siete socios, residentes del distrito de Carabayllo.
La Sra Isabel Berenise, se dedica desde hace aproximadamente dos años a la venta de salchipapas, es un negocio de forma ambulatoria, no tiene un lugar propio. Con su trabajo ella puede mantener a su familia. Paralelamente a su negocio, presta servicio de limpieza en casas, la llaman por la confianza que le tienen y sobretodo porque es una mujer trabajadora y realiza bien su trabajo.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en al compra de suministros como papa, hot dog,artículos descartables como platos, tenedores, vasos y bolsas.
texts.en: Isabel Berenise is a member of the communal bank "Los Claveles," which comprises seven members who live in the Carabayllo district. Isabel Berenise has been selling salchipapas, a dish of sliced pan-fried beef sausages and French fries, as a street vendor for two years. She doesn't have her own stall. Her business allows her to support her family. She also cleans houses, and her clients call on her because they trust her and, above all, because she works hard and does a good job. She will use the loan to buy supplies: potatoes, hot dogs, and disposable plates, forks, glasses, and bags.

loans.use: to buy supplies and disposable items to sell salchipapas.

loans.name: And Suxali Sine Saloum 1 Group

texts.fr:
And Suxali Sine Saloum 1 est un groupe de crédit qui rassemble 5 membres qui s’activent toute dans le commerce.
Pour la présidente, la dame Senaba, elle possède une table devant chez elle où elle vend des céréales : mil, mais, en y associant la vente de chaussures et d’habits qu’elle fait que sur commande. Elles ont connu la mutuelle à travers une sensibilisation et viennent pour la 1ère fois pour solliciter son appui.
Senaba appuie son époux dans la gestion des dépenses  de la maison. Elle a comme vœux d’avoir une maison à elle.
texts.en: "And Suxali Sine Saloum 1" is a loan group which comprises five members who are all active in commerce. The president, Ms. Senaba, owns a table in front of her home where she sells grains: millet and corn. She includes the sale of shoes and clothing, which she makes by special order. The group members knew about the 'mutuelle' through awareness efforts and are here for the first time to request support. Senaba supports her husband in managing household expenses. Her wish is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase grains (millet, corn) to sell, as well as shoes and clothing

loans.name: Vaghtang

texts.en:
Vaghtang is 44 years old and lives with his wife and son in Kapan.  Although Vaghtang has a higher education, graduating from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute, he has never worked.  His wife works as a teacher at the school.  In the village where Vaghtang and his family live he has a private piece of land.  They also keep a hundred chickens.  Vaghtang cultivates vegetables and fruits and sells the gathered harvest at the Kapan wholesale market.  Besides agriculture and farming, Vaghatang is engaged in carpentry works, making wooden parquetry, boxes, etc.  

Vaghtang plans to repair the barn for his chickens and needs a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams.  It is the first, but hopefully not the last, time that he wishes to have a deal with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his barn for chickens.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy.  She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education as well as their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in a better profit.  Her profits from this business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nancy dreams that her business will grow bigger and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Jannina es presidenta del grupo “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” tiene 33 años es conviviente con 2 hijos dependientes hace 11 años implemento su bodega en su vivienda. Dicha actividad le ha permitido darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Jannina tiene un nuevo objetivo que es ampliar su bodega con productos de perfumería y demás productos de belleza. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos. Su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jannina es la segunda persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Jannina is president of the Santa Rose de Lima group. She is 33 years old and is in a civil union with two dependent children. 

Eleven years ago, she started her small grocery store in her house. This business has allowed her to provide a good quality of life for her family. Jannina has a new goal, which is to expand her store with perfume and other beauty products. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a display to showcase her products. Her greatest wish is to finish building her home. 

The group thanks Kiva investors for providing the loan. Jannina is the second person on the left side.

loans.use: purchase a display case.

loans.name: Rubiel De Jesús

texts.es:
Rubiel de 48 años de edad, es un campesino, esmerado y pujante. Su familia es su eje central y la razón por la que lucha diariamente a fin de garantizarle mejores condiciones de vida. Se dedica al cultivo de tomate árbol, papa criolla y fríjol, productos que comercializa en la plaza de mercado de su localidad. Hoy se encuentra recurriendo a un crédito con el fin de comprar insumos para el abono de sus cultivos  y químicos como fungicidas e insecticidas para sacar una producción de mejor calidad.
Asegura que su gran reto es que sus productos permanezcan en el mercado a pesar de las fluctuaciones de los precios, lo que lo ha conllevado a tener pérdidas. Espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y garantizarles a sus cuatro hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
48-year-old Rubiel is a strong, conscientious farmer.  His family are his main focus in life and the reason why he works hard every day, so that he can provide them with better living conditions.  Rubiel grows tree tomatoes, creole potatoes and beans.  He sells these crops in the market square in his town.  He is requesting this loan to buy inputs for his crops: natural fertilizers and also chemicals such as fungicides and insecticides, to ensure a better quality harvest.

Rubiel says that his biggest challenge is keeping his produce in the market in spite of price fluctuations.  This has led to him making some losses.  He hopes to improve his family's quality of life and to guarantee his four children a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides and insectides

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y fríjol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, fríjol, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc. María  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María, who is 42 years old, lives with her life partner and their three children in a house they own. She earns her living growing corn and beans. She has been working in agriculture for several years and has gained a lot of experience that allows her to obtain better harvests. She sells her harvests in the areas surrounding her community; she already has a many customers who prefer her for her quality, good prices, and above all, good service. 

María needs to invest, so she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizers, etc. María has good credit references from her acquaintances, and she is very responsible. She maintains that she will be able to pay off the debt in the established timeframe, and at the same time, she trusts that she will bring economic security to her household.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 39 years old and married with three children.  Olivia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods like soap, canned goods, sugar, milk, and shampoo to sell.

Olivia has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.  Olivia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store (soap, canned goods, sugar, milk, and shampoo).

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Delia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.  She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet previously requested a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she used to buy more quantities of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help with her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Janet is requesting another loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain their daily needs. She hopes to expand her business and that her grandchildren will finish their studies. 

Janet meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a hardworking 43-year-old woman who wisely manages her daily tasks and assists her husband in the farming activities.  She wants to makes sure that she can sustain the daily needs of her five dependent children.  She has been doing farming for 20 years, making a decent income.

To help her and her family in their transportation needs, Chea has requested a loan of 600,000 KHR to buy a motorbike.  She always prays that in the future she can improve the general living conditions of her family, educate her children, and renovate their house so that they may live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to fulfill the needs of the family.

loans.name: Aseel Group

texts.en: The Aseel Group consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.  They have applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.  Fatima is a 36-year-old married woman.  She is a hardworking woman who loves her family.  She is a housewife and she intends to apply for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her house.  She hopes that this will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Ubay, Bohol.  Rena is engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband, for more than 10 years.  Rena is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks.  Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  In the future, Rena dreams of making their fishing business a more profitable success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 25 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé le  22 Juillet 2009. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants  (01 garçon et 03 filles).
Elle achète et vend des produits alimentaires comme l’ognon, le riz et des épices …, dans sa cantine au village, une activité qu’elle fait depuis 05 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires environnants pour revendre en détaille dans sa cantine.
-	Pour 02 sacs de riz de 13 000F Cfa 
-	Pour un sac d’oignon à 10 000F Cfa 
-	Des épices pour 15 000 F Cfa
Apres vente et déduction des frais de transport elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net de 7 000F Cfa tous les trois jours d’activité. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 25 women who are very active in this 'banc villageois', which was created on July 22, 2009. The women are all from the same district and get along well with one another. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.
