Even though Yaw grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for himself and his family. Currently, Yaw is an entrepreneur. He works as a taxi driver in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). His business enterprise has grown substantially since he began 24 years ago. He uses the income from his business to help his wife raise their 6 children. 

Yaw has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for his service. Nevertheless, he is unable to meet their requests due to his need for car repairs. Thus he aims to use his loan to purchase spare parts for his car. With the new profits from his expanded business, Yaw wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 29 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy foods and household goods like canned goods, soap, noodles, cream, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and from buying and selling rice.

Rosalyn aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy foods and household goods like canned goods, soap, noodles, cream, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Sarah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for 4 years. 

Sarah is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Sarah wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Sarah plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize.

loans.name: Albert Antonio

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Albert quien con su credikiva compró icopor, globos, gorras bolsos y otros articulos infantiles. Su negocio está mas surtido y pude vender mucho mas con sus nuevos inventarios. Ella pide a  los financiadores de Kiva que la "sigan apoyando porque le hace falta hacer crecer mucho mas a su negocio." En la actualidad está palicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará sueteres, globos, bolsos etc y planea tener mucho éxito porque estos son los productos que mas vende y la rotación es inmediata, lo que hace de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Albert who, with his last Kiva loan, bought polystyrene, balloons, party bags and other children's items.  His business is better stocked and, with more inventory, he has been able to sell much more.  Albert is asking Kiva lenders to "continue supporting [him] because he needs to expand his business much more". He is currently applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy sweaters, balloons, bags and more and he plans to have a lot of success as these are the products he sells most and turnaround on such stock is very quick.  This will make his Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, balloons, bags and more.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшану 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Ее муж трудовой мигрант и поэтому ей приходится справляться с расходами самой. Она более 7 лет занимается изготовлением и продажей пирожков. Она умеет большой опыт по изготовлению пирожков. Она изготавливает очень вкусные пирожки. Ее дочь помогает ей введение бизнеса. Она имеет лавку на улице и поэтому она хочет построить мини кафе для изготовления и продажи пирожков. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для постройки мини кафе. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulshan is 44 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Her children are not yet grown up. Her husband is a migrant worker, so she must cope to support her own expenses. For over 7 years, she has been baking and selling pies. She has a lot of experience in making pies. She makes very delicious pies. Her daughter helps her run the business. She has a shop on the street and wants to build a mini cafe to make and sell her pies. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistani somoni to buy building materials to build her mini cafe. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build mini cafe for her business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Doña Graciela es una mujer de 54 años de edad soltera y madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven bajo el mismo techo y son su único apoyo para las diferentes actividades en el campo. Ella es agricultora hace más de 20 años y quien le enseño a trabajar fue su pareja en ese entonces la cual le enseño el cultivo de café, arroz y maíz. Su único medio de ingreso ha sido y es hoy en día el cultivo de maíz y frijol y las tierras que en familia trabajan son alquiladas en donde sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona donde ella habita en compañía de sus hijos. Los desafíos que ella y su familia encuentran son la baja de los precios, las plagas y las fuertes temporadas de lluvias ya que lavan la tierra y arrastran el producto.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono y semilla mejorada para su cultivo y mantenimiento ya que es más seguro y eficaz de sembrar.

Sus sueños y sus planes son los de poder comprar un pedazo de tierra para poder cultivar y trabajar lo propio y obtener las ganancias netas para re-invertir y de esa manera ir asegurando más sus siembras. Como madre ella sueña con ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con un patrimonio fortalecido para poder enfrentar los problemas de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Graciela is 54 years old, single and a mother of two children, both of whom live under her roof.  They are her only support for her work in the countryside.  Graciela has been in farming for over twenty years, having been taught by her then partner.  He taught her to grow coffee, rice and corn.  Graciela's only source of income has been and still is from growing corn and beans.  The family works on rented land and their customers are buyers who come to the area.  Graciela and her family are facing challenges, including low prices, pest problems and heavy rains during the wet season.  The rains wash away the ground and sweep away the products.

Graciela is now applying for a loan in order to buy fertilisers, manure and better seeds for her crops and for maintenance.  With this done, sowing will be more secure and more effective.

Graciela dreams of buying a piece of land to grow crops on.  She could work on her own and earn profits to reinvest and have a guaranteed harvest.  As a mother, Graciela dreams of seeing her children have better living conditions with a good inheritance that they can use to face problems well.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure and better seeds for her crops.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells cooked rice  in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a mechanic, and together they have two children. 

Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that both her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of rice

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Artemia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, wood, paint, nails, etc. for repair of her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Artemia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and wood, paint, nails, etc. for repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Mena Esi

texts.en:
Even though Mena Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Mena Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells clothing and fried fish in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Mena Esi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her products. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more clothing and fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and fish to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support her family. Jesusa is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Jesusa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Ma. Jenilda

texts.en:
Ma. Jenilda is 50 years old, a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jenilda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ingredients for her business.

Ma. Jenilda has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Ma. Jenilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling pots in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Elizabeth is married and has nine children. Her husband works as a police officer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of pots, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of pots

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marilyn  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is single and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Mercy is a successful businesswoman. She works as a hairdresser in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mercy uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Mercy will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of hair products, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair products

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Albertha is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Effutuakwa, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Albertha is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Albertha wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Albertha plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus, helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is a 40-year-old woman who operates a cook shop selling rice, fufu (mashed manioc) and soup in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  This is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

Mamie is divorced and has four children, between 25 and 14.  One is currently attending school and lives at home.  Mamie completed grade 10 before starting her business.  She describes herself as good businesswoman.

Mamie has had a cook shop business for the past twenty years.  She works 13 hours, six days a week at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is stock shortages since she has a lot of customers. She intends to use the loan to buy food ingredient such as rice, charcoal, peppers, fish, meat, Vita, oil, onions etc. She started her business with help from her parent.  She likes her business because she has a lot of customers.  In the future, she wants to own a house.
  
Mamie wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy food ingredient such as rice, charcoal, peppers, fish, meat, Vita, oil, onions, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 20 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. 

Jocelyn requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to buy more vegetables to sell. Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам жизнерадостный и добродушный мужчина в возрасте 41 года. Он был женат, но уже давно разведён со своей женой. Уктам имеет двоих детей, которые при разводе остались жить с ним. С тех пор ему приходится самому растить и ухаживать за своими детьми. Он очень любит их и делает всё для того, чтобы они жили достойно. Чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь, он занимается своим бизнесом. Так как он живёт в сельской местности, в основном он занимается животноводством. Уктам откармливает скот и продаёт на базаре, а также продаёт молоко, полученное от этого скота. Этот бизнес приносит ему нормальный стабильный доход. Также Уктам работает на стройке, но это сезонная работа, особенно весной и летом эта работа приносит дополнительный заработок. Но сейчас Уктам хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, чтобы иметь больше дохода от дальнейшей их продажи. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит для покупки скота. Уктам заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Uktam is a cheerful and good-natured 41-year-old man. He was married, but has been divorced from his wife for a long time. Uktam has two children that stayed to live with him after the divorce. Since then, he has had to raise and care for his children on his own. He loves them very much and does everything  so that they live in dignity. 

To earn a living, he operates his own business. Because he lives in the countryside, he is mostly involved in animal husbandry. Uktam raises cattle and sells them in the market, and also sells milk from his cattle. This business provides him with a normal, stable income. Uktam also works in construction, but it is seasonal work that provides him additional income in the spring and the summer. Now, Uktam wants to increase his stock of cattle to earn more income from their subsequent sale. He applied to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to buy a cow. Uktam thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita, a 35-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a buy-and-sell pearl business in the Philippines for 10 years, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Having borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF, Perlita has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of pearls to make finished products such as necklaces and bracelets to sell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of pearls to make finished products like necklaces, bracelets, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 49-year-old woman who is engaged in selling street foods (barbecue) and wishes to continue sending her two younger children to school. 

Elsie is happily married to Remy and blessed with four children. Her two older children are already married, while the younger two are temporarily no longer in school due to insufficient funds.

Elsie is borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients and raw materials for her barbecue business. She will do her best to gain profit and have savings for her children's education. Elsie hopes that someday she is able to send her children to school and finish their tertiary level of education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and raw materials for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Mame Diarra Bousso

texts.fr:
Mame Diarra Bousso, célibataire, âgée de 37 ans, est sociétaire depuis trois ans dans un guichet de l’IMCEC qui se trouve dans la région centre du Sénégal. Elle a déjà obtenu un 1er crédit et revient afin de renouveler. Elle fait du commerce de divers produits alimentaires : arachides, haricots, pain de singe. Elle vend aussi du poisson fumé et séché. 
Mame Diarra Bousso adore son métier et lui réserve pratiquement la majeure partie de son temps. Elle est célibataire sans enfant, elle a largement le temps de s’occuper  de ses activités. Elle se gère elle-même et aide ses parents dans les charges domestiques.
Elle aimerait devenir une grande commerçante de renommée.
texts.en:
Mame Diarra Bousso is 37 years old and single. For three years she has been a member of a branch of the IMCEC in the central region of Senegal. She has already taken out one loan and this is her second. 

Mame Diarra Bousso runs a business selling various food products: groundnuts, beans and baobab fruit, as well as smoked and dried fish.
 
Mame Diarra Bousso enjoys her work and spends most of her time running her business. She is single and has no children, so she has plenty of time to dedicate to her business. She manages her own affairs and helps her parents with their household costs.

Mame Diarra Bousso would like to become a great and well-known businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy various goods to resell: groundnuts, beans and baobab fruit; she also sells smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Abil

texts.en:
Abil moved from the Absherone region and now lives in the Baku region. Abil is 24 years old. He opened his new cafe business seven months ago. Now Abil needs a 2,000 Azerbaijani manat loan to buy tables and chairs for his cafe. He wants to use the money for the future of his family. His sister got into a university of art in this year. In the future, Abil wants to repair his cafe. This will be more profitable for his business.

Abil is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. Abel's mother sends you their thanks for every loan.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his cafe

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rhea has been in this business for five years now.

Rhea requested a 19,500 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net, wood, paint, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat. In the future, Rhea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net, wood, paint, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of cloth trading for one year. She has built trust in her community by providing good quality cloth at reasonable prices. 

Now she wants to expand her business as her customer list is increasing day by day. For this reason she has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy a variety of summer season cloth in various colors and designs. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment schedule. With this loan she would be able to generate more revenue to meet with the daily demands of life and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of summer season cloth in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Masood

texts.en:
Masood, age 56, is a married woman and a mother of three children. One of her sons is shown in the photo. 

One year ago her son started a business of clothes selling. He buys clothes from Faisalabad and supplies them in the markets of Lahore at higher rates. He wants to increase his business to fulfill the requirements of life, to support his parents and to make his life comfortable. For this reason, Masood contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy variety of clothes of summer season in various fabrics such as lawn, chiffon and some fancy dresses. 

Masood is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy variety of summer season clothes in various fabrics such as lawn, chiffon and some fancy dresses.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata, 48 ans, mariée, est mère de 5 enfants, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle vient pour la première fois, solliciter un crédit de 100000FCFA auprès de l’IMCEC pour l’achat d’huile de palme destiné à la revente. Elle compte une fidèle clientèle parmi son voisinage. Elle appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison et règle aussi ses propres besoins. Elle désire augmenter ses marchandises, diversifier son activité avec l’appui financier de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Aminata is 48 years old and married. She has five children and has been working in trade for more than ten years. 

For the first time, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs from the IMCEC, with which she will purchase palm oil to resell. She has a loyal customer base among her neighbours. 

Aminata supports her husband with the household expenses as well as meeting her own needs. She would like to increase the number of products she sells and diversify her business with financial support from the IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Mukhtiarn

texts.en:
Mukhtiarn is a 45-year-old married mother of six who needs to meet the basic needs of her children. A tailor for many years, her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community; the business is sufficiently profitable to ensure a decent life as she receives many orders on a daily basis. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Mukhtiarn has requested a loan of Rs. 35000/- to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces in various colors. These purchases will enable her to complete the orders of her customers on time. Mukhtiarn hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Fatou, elle est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle évolue dans la vente de divers produits. Fatou s’active dans tout ce qui est susceptible de générer un profit, parmi quoi : la vente d’encens, de chaussures et d’habillements pour enfants. C’est depuis toute  jeune qu’elle a démarré ce métier et  pratiquement avec un capital très minime. Elle espère pouvoir augmenter ses fonds grâce aux bénéfices générés par l’activité et le soutien de l’IMCEC.
Fatou participe à la dépense quotidienne et s’occupe la plupart du temps de ces enfants surtout de ceux qui vont à l’école : elle veille à leur bien-être pour qu’ils puissent réussir et prendre leur relève dans la gestion de la maison.
texts.en:
Our borrower is called Fatou. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of six.

Fatou is developing her trading business. She is involved in anything that can generate a profit, including selling incense, and shoes and clothing for children. She has been running this business since she was young, on a very limited capital. She is hoping to be able to increase her funds thanks to the profits generated by her business and support from the IMCEC.

Fatou contributes to daily expenses and spends much of her time looking after her children, especially those who are in school: she looks after their well-being so that they can succeed and grow up to help manage the household.

loans.use: to buy incense and children's shoes and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Lahore with her husband and two children. 

Recently, she opened her own beauty parlor for the people of her community. Her customers are satisfied with her services and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. To provide quality education to her children, she works day and night. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is not able to buy more products for her customers. For this reason she is applying for a loan of PKR 20,000 through Kashf foundation to buy more beauty products such as cleansers, polishers and some packs of makeup kits and lipsticks. By this loan she will be able earn profit and provide a healthy life to her family.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as cleansers, polishers and some packs of makeup kits and lipsticks.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She is motivated to provide all the facilities of life to her family. For this reason she has been running a small general store in her community for a period of about six years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 

In the beginning of her business, she faced many problems, but now she is able to manage the stock of goods according to her customers’ demands with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her sixth loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is 50 years old. He lives in the village of Verin Ptghni, which is in the Kotayk region of Armenia. Stepan is married and he has two sons and a daughter. For many years, Stepan has had his own production business. He is a shoemaker. He works in their house in a small and comfortable workshop where he has all the needed tools and materials for shoe repairing. Stepan has many loyal customers who, from all the large variety of shoemakers in their district, prefer and trust exactly Stepan. He is also engaged in agriculture; he cultivates some vegetables but not for sale – it is for his family’s needs.

Nor Horizon knows Stepan as a very responsible and serious person since he has taken out loans several times and he has paid them back successfully. This time, Stepan wants to cooperate with Kiva lenders and he asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to buy raw materials for his shoe production.

loans.use: To buy materials for his shoe production

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis, age 53, is a married woman involved in a business of hand embroidery. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

She is passionate about her work and has been doing it for many years. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Nargis’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000, to buy materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 66 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Leonida requested a 21,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, soap, spices, etc., to sell. In the future, Leonida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, soap, spices, etc., to sell

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, all of whom are at school. For the past 10 years, she has been stitching clothes for the people of her community and she is considered to be an expert tailor there. Now she has also started receiving orders from a nearby boutique, which will help her to generate more revenue to meet the basic necessities of life. That is why she needs to purchase more sewing materials such as spools of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. Thus, she has applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to Kashf Foundation. She hopes to make enough income by completing the orders of her customers on time. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials such as spools of threads with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira, age 34, is a married woman. She is involved in a business of milk sales since her husband works as a private employee and his income is not enough to meet his family's basic needs. 

She has been doing her business for about three years and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. It will help her to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Eyea

texts.en:
Eyea is 42 years old and lives at the Paynesville south area, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has six children between 26 and 12 years old. Only one of her children is in school and lives at home. She described herself as a hardworking person.

For the past 20 years she has been running a shop where she sells rice, soap, charcoal, pepper, etc., in the local market. She likes her business because customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by husband. She walks every day to buy her goods since her shop is close to  the local wholesale market.

She is requesting a loan to purchase some goods for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small-business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase some goods for her business.

loans.name: Violeta De Fatima

texts.es:
Violeta, de 47 años de edad, es originaria de Managua, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales se hace cargo solo de su hijo menor de 16 años que está estudiando la secundaria. Ella anteriormente vendía comidas pero el humo de la leña le produjo daños a su salud así que dejo de vender comida y se dedicó a vender ropa tiene 8 años de realizar esta actividad. Su esposo se dedica a dar clases y con lo que gana le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. 
Está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar  zapatos, brasiers, blusas, perfumes etc. Pues es parte de la mercadería que más vende y le solicitan sus clientes. Poco a poco desea ir formando su mini tienda de mercadería variada en su casa de habitación además que le gustaría agregar la venta de artesanías.
texts.en:
Violetta, 47 years old, is a native of Managua. She has five children, however only the youngest is still dependent on her. He is 16 years old and attends high school.  Formerly she sold cooked food, however the smoke from the firewood affected her health and she had to stop selling food. For the past eight years she has been selling clothing. Her husband makes a living by giving classes and she helps him with household expenses from her earnings.

Violetta needs funding to purchase shoes, brassieres, blouses, perfume, etc. This is the best selling merchandise and these are the items most requested by her customers. She wants to establish  a mini store in her home offering a variety of merchandise. In addition, she would also like to sell handicrafts.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, brassieres, blouses, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia, age 39, is a married woman and a mother of four children. She is running a general store in her community to contribute to the family income. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to buy more stock of grocery items such as grains, pulses and flour, along with packs of cleaning products including soaps and detergents. In this way she will able to meet customers’ demands time after time. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Doña Gladys de 61 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 35 a 41 años de edad, en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, uno de los sitios turísticos mas hermosos de Colombia y muy reconocido, pues tiene una de las principales bases navales del país y por su patrimonio histórico-artístico, que abarca de vestigios de época cartaginesa, romana, bizantina, edificaciones de carácter militar de época moderna y contemporánea, así como también edificios neoclásicos y modernistas. Allí en este fantástico lugar y de manera modesta se dedica a la actividad comercial; ella tiene una excelente cartera de clientes que le compran a crédito y le pagan puntualmente, su clientela la ha ido construyendo poco a poco y con mucho estudio de sus potencialidades y capacidad de pago. Entre sus mercancías más comunes, está la ropa femenina el calzado y accesorios femeninos, que promociona mediante guías especializadas de productos a las cuales se encuentra afiliada y compra ocasionalmente a proveedores varios, cuando le ofrecen precios de oportunidad. Doña Gladys siempre está atenta a como se mueve el mercado, para ofrecer los mejores productos a los mas bajos precios. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio almacén, con una gran diversidad de artículos para que sus clientes se impacten, mientras ella les sirve y genera ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ropa y calzado, entre otras mercancías que están a la moda, porque a sus clientes les gusta el cambio y ella da a su clientela lo que ellos piden, para poder lograr la sostenibilidad financiera de su negocio y generar cada vez mas ingresos, que beneficien el bienestar personal y el de su familia..
texts.en:
61-year old Gladys lives with her husband and four children aged between 35 and 41 in the town of Cartagena, located on the Caribbean. It's one of the most beautiful tourist sites in Colombia, and also very well known because one of the most important naval bases in the country is located there. Cartagena is well known too for its historic and artistic heritage which spans many eras: Carthage, Roman, and Byzantine. It has modern and contemporary military buildings as well those dating from neoclassic times. 

It is in this wonderful place that Gladys runs her modest business. She has an excellent client base who buy from her on credit and make their repayments punctually. She has built up this client base gradually, carefully working out their prospects and ability to make the repayments.

Most popular among the products she sells is women's clothing, footwear, and accessories which she promotes through specialist catalogs and from whom she buys on occasion when they have special offers. Gladys always knows what is selling well so she can offer the best products at the lowest prices. Her goal in the future is to own a bigger store with a wide range of merchandise to attract her customers while she serves them and generates income.

Now Gladys is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy up to date clothing and footwear as her customers like to see change, and she likes to give them what they are asking for. Her business will become financially sustainable generating more income for the benefit of her and her family.

loans.use: Buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat had a difficult time after her husband's business failed. She decided to work with her husband in order to support her family for a better future. Since ten years ago, she began her business of sewing uppers of shoes in her house. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. Ishrat has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase a new sewing machine with some reels of threads and leather material in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some reels of threads and leather material in various colors

loans.name: Aamna

texts.en:
Aamna is a 46-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and six children. 

She has been in the work of hand embroidery for many years. She is expert in making beautiful patterns for the occasions of weddings and parties. She has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time. 

She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. Aamna dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past 12 years. She knows well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns enough to live a prosperous life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 56 year old married woman who lives with her husband and six children. She has been running a business trading cloth for several years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. Now she needs to purchase a variety of fancy cloths by taking into account the demands of her customers. For this reason she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 through Kashf foundation. She hopes to increase her earnings and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fancy cloths

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Sally works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport as well as buying and selling charcoal. Sally is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase foods and household goods like canned goods, soap, noodles, spices, etc to sell in her general store business. Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase foods and household goods like can goods, soap, noodles, spices, etc to sell

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira, age 33, lives with his husband and five children in Lahore. She started her general store business a year ago at the corner of her house. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she needs more variety of products to attract more customers. For this reason, she is requesting for a loan of Rs 20, 000 to buy stocks of rice, flour, gram and spices from the market at wholesale rates. This will help her to meet customers’ demand time after time, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, flour, gram and spices from the market at wholesale rates.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en: At the age of 30, Musrat is a vigorous, married woman who deals in the business of cloth trading to provide for her family. She purchases a variety of ladies’ cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. By this time she has become renowned for selling good quality cloth in different colors and has a good client list. To buy stock of different cloths for the summer season according to her customers’ demands, she has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation, a Kiva partner. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy stock of different cloths for the summer season

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 48 year old married woman. She lives with her 6 children and wants to provide them with a healthy life. She has been running her own embroidery business for the past 2 years. Quickly she has become famous in her community by doing her work expertly. She has applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy more spools of threads along with packs of pearls and glittering material in various colors. This loan will help her to earn extra profit, which she plans to spend on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads along with packs of pearls and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has been running a clothes shop and is a street vendor who sells women's, men's, and children's clothing and shoes. Through her business, she contributes toward household expenses in her effort to get ahead. 

Riziki is requesting a loan to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, and shoes for women, men, and children. This will allow her to have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, and shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 50-year-old married woman who has been running a crockery sales business with the help of her husband (shown with her in the photo) for about 10 years. The couple offer various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets and bowls. Her husband assists her in dealing with customers and by purchasing stock of goods from the market at wholesale rates. They make sufficient income to meet their household expenses. In order to improve her business, Shamim contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR). With this, she will be able to purchase a greater variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is a 37-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is single and has three children between the ages of 20 and 4. Two of her children are currently attending school and live at home. She did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

She lives and works in the St Paul Area. The St Paul Area is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in substandard housing. 

Musu has a table business, from which she has sold palm oil, rice, etc., for the past 10 years. She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in the business is small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en: Vachagan lives in Ijevan with his wife and two sons. His wife works in the Ijevan chemical cloths cleaning store as a storekeeper. For twenty years, Vachagan has been engaged in vegetables and fruits trading, but in recent years, he has decided to devote himself to swine breeding and now he is busy only with this. He says that he already has a good income and new plans connected with his new business. This helps him very much to take care of his family’s living conditions. Vachagan has taken a loan from NOR Horizon twice and this time he wants to have a deal with Kiva. He needs 400.000 Armenian drams to buy fodder for his piglets.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his piglets

loans.name: Aashi

texts.en: Aashi, age 33, is a married woman.  She is a mother of three: one son and two daughters.  She is providing for her family by running a small general store in her community. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. To make her store fully stocked Aashi has requested a loan of PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy packs of oil, spices and sugar. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, spices and sugar.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been involved in the business of selling clothes for the past three years. She buys a variety of ladies’ clothes from the main city, and then sells them to the people in her local community. She started her business because it was very difficult for her to meet her household expenses with the small income of her husband. She makes enough to contribute to the family income and plays an important role in supporting her family. She has been in association with Kashf for the past two years. At present, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000, which will help her to purchase a greater selection of clothes in a variety of colors and designs. She is hopeful to increase her earnings, which will then allow her to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of clothes in a variety of colors and designs.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a mason and she uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Efua currently works as a hairdresser in Ankaful (near Cape Coast). With over five years of experience in this trade, Efua has seen an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. However, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus she will use her loan to buy more haircare products, helping her to boost her overall sales. Efua wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more haircare products

loans.name: Babies

texts.en:
Please meet 42-year-old Babies from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Babies completed second grade and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has two children between the ages of 8 and 5. Her two children are in school and they all live at home. 

Babies owns her own table business selling pepper, oil, okra, etc. She has had this business for the past four years. She will use the loan to purchase goods for resale.  

On average, she works seven hours at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit. In the future, she would like to build a shop. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen, age 50, deals in the business of hand-embroidery. She has expertise in this area and has been using her skills to provide for her family for over 8 years now.  She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 21-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to meet their needs including food, health, clothing, and education. Two years ago, she started her own general store to contribute to the family income. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. It’s her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with their support. She has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stock of rice, flour and grains. Kalsoom wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory of cloth

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Thanks to her efforts, Asha's business has been able to grow and now she is a great micro-entrepreneur. In the future she would like to expand her business. She has her own premises and a good number of customers. She works very hard and always puts all of herself into her work.

She is asking for this loan to invest in items for her workshop, such as thread, needles, fabric, and more. She is very thankful for the opportunity she is being given because it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, and other items for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana, age 36,has been in the business of stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds she is unable to meet the demands of her customers, which are increasing day by day.  So she has applied a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her fourth loan cycle. She wants to use this loan to buy raw material including cloth and threads in different colors, as well as packs of ribbons, laces and zippers. In this way she will be able to meet her orders on time. She aspires to save money to provide a better standard of living for her six children.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth and threads in different colors, as well as packs of ribbons, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is married to Salim. They have five children who attend school. Salome has had a home-based grocery store for about 3 years. Aside from the usual grocery items she also sells beverages and has a pool table that generates extra income, especially on the weekend. She’s requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles at wholesale. She will also buy beverages like soft-drinks.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles at wholesale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 38 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She and her fiancee are living together with their six children, five of whom are in school. Unfortunately Rebecca’s parents did not send her to school, but she is good at managing her business. Her fiancée is in construction, and builds houses. For the past 15 years Rebecca has been selling dried and fresh fish in the local market. At the moment she faces no problems, but she spends six days a week working at her business from 7 AM to 5 PM. She started this business with a little money she received from her fiancee.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Mwajumaa

texts.en: Mwajumaa is a recurrent client of Yehu Microfinance. She operates a charcoal selling business. She has repaid several loans to date and is asking for this one to buy 20 sacks of charcoal to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. With a great variety of products to offer her customers, she will earn a larger profit margin which will help her improve her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Isai Francisco

texts.es:
Isai, es un joven de 25 años de edad, padre de 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad , habitante de la ciudad de Managua. Él  es sastre, el aprendió este oficio por medio de su padre quien también se dedicaba a la costura el desde los 10 años ayudaba a su padre. Al cumplir 18 años se independizo de su padre y comenzó su propio taller. Actualmente tiene 4 máquinas de coser y una cortadora también tiene varios clientes los cuales lo reconocen como un buen sastre por la trayectoria que ha tenido su padre y el. 
Hoy esta requiriendo financiamiento para comprar tela, hilos, elásticos, botones.  Esto le permitirá adquirir a un mejor precio la materia prima que necesita para elaborar los pedidos que tiene. En lo futuro quiere ampliar su taller de costura donde pueda dar empleos y le ayuden a sacar mas rápido los pedidos. Su meta próxima es comprar una maquina industrial doble aguja para agilizar las entregas.
texts.en:
Isai is a young man, 25 years of age, and the father of 2 children, ages 5 and 2. They all reside in the city of Managua. He is a tailor, having learned from his father who is also dedicated to the trade. Isai began helping his father at the age of 10. Upon reaching 18, he became independent and began his own shop.

Presently, Isai has 4 sewing machines and a cutter, and has various customers who recognize him as a good tailor, based on the trajectory that he and his father have taken.

Today, Isai requires financing to purchase cloth, thread, elastics, and buttons. This will permit him to acquire better prices and the primary materials he needs to fulfill his present orders. 

In the future, Isai wants to expand his tailor shop so that he can add employees who will assist him in completing orders faster. His immediate goal is to buy a double-needle industrial sewing machine to facilitate job completion.

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, elastics, and buttons for his tailor shop.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yessenia es una joven de 21 años, emprendedora y con deseos de salir adelante. Aprendió el arte de la bisutería gracias a un curso gratuito subsidiado por una entidad pública. Con el fin de dedicarse a esta actividad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima. Sueña con seguir estudiando y perfeccionar su actividad a fin de contar en un futuro con su propia marca de accesorios. 
Asegura que este será su primer paso de una gran cima por escalar. Su madre se ha constituido en su principal motor por lo cual desea retribuirle con su amor y ayuda económica años de sacrificio y dedicación.
texts.en: Yesenia is a 21 year old young woman who is an entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead in life. She learned the art of jewelry making thanks to a free course subsidized by the government. She is seeking a loan that she will invest in the purchase of raw materials so that she can make a living doing this activity. She dreams of continuing to study and perfecting her craft with the goal of creating her own brand of accessories in the future. She assures us that this is her first step on a long climb over a high peak. Her mother has been her primary support and Yesenia wants to repay her with her love and economic support in exchange for years of sacrifice and dedication.

loans.use: to buy supplies for jewelry.

loans.name: Nyambwana

texts.en: Nyambwana is a recurrent client of Yehu Microfinance. She has a grocery store. She has repaid several loans to date and is asking for this one to buy bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions etc. to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. With a great variety of products to offer her customers, she will earn a larger profit margin, which will help her improve her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Visitación

texts.es: En San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, muy conocido por los trabajos artesanales de las mujeres en tejido vertical, habita Visitación con su familia,  conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos, en las edades de 9 a 19 años.  Luego de que su esposo, aprendiera en la capital de Colombia-Bogotá, el oficio de elaborar pizzas, ella también aprendió de él y posteriormente trabajó dependiente, hasta que logró ubicarse de manera independiente, en el espacio donde hoy prepara pizzas de diferentes sabores, ajustadas al paladar de sus consumidores y las vende. Su meta mas adelante, es tener un amplio local para extender su oferta a más compradores, porque sueña con generar ingresos, que le ayuden a ofrecerles a sus hijos las oportunidades de continuar con sus estudios con mucho éxito.  Su rentabilidad  sobre las ventas actualmente, es no menor del 7%  y desde allí proyecta su inversión. En la actualidad Visitación está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo, grasas y otros insumos, para hacer compras importantes que le permitan obtener precios especiales, por el volumen en que Visitación lo hará. Esto hará que su inversión sea muy exitosa y es justamente lo que se propone Visitación con su credikiva.
texts.en: Visitación lives with her family, consisting of her spouse and her 4 children ages 9 to 19 years old, in San Jacinto a municipality in the county of Bolivar which is well known for its woven crafts. After her husband learned the craft of pizza-making in the capital of Colombia, Bogotá, she learned it from him and later began to work together with him, until she was able to find a location to work independently. Today she makes and sells pizzas of many different flavors in this location.  She adjusts the pizzas to the tastes of her customers. Her larger goal is to have a big shop to reach and make sales to more consumers.  She dreams of earning more profits that would help her to offer her children the opportunity to continue studying and achieving great successes. Her return on investment today is no less than 7% and from this amount she projects her investments. Today Visitación is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use the loan to buy wheat flour, oils and other ingredients and to make important purchases that will allow her to obtain special prices based on volume. This will ensure that her investment is very successful which is exactly why she is proposing to do this with the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, oils and other ingredients.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Please meet 45-year-old Irene from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in substandard housing. 

Irene completed first grade and is married. Her husband is a security guard. She has five children between the ages of 25 and 10. Two of her children are in school, and they all live at home. Irene owns her own table business and has been selling rubber dishes, bowls, plates, cups, etc., for the past four years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase goods.  

On average, she works 10 hours at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit. In the future, she would like to build a shop. 

She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make her tasty treats

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en: Jedidah is the mother of several children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She earns a living by running a food-vending business where she sells maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are high costs and the seasonal nature of her business. Her goal for the future is to establish a wholesale shop. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Berta Inés

texts.es:
Berta es una mujer de campo, a la que se le negó la oportunidad de acceder a la educación debido a la precaria condición económica de su familia. A pesar de miles de obstáculos por los que ha debido atravesar sus fuerzas siguen intactas, con el deseo de seguir luchando para mejorar su calidad de vida. Motivo que la ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito, el cual invertirá en la compra de productos de aseo personal y belleza con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y convertirse en una mujer de negocios.
Su mayor deseo es tener una estabilidad económica y garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Berta is a woman from the countryside who was not given the opportunity to access education because of the precarious economic condition of her family. In spite of the many obstacles that she has had to overcome, her strength is still intact along with her desire to continue improving the quality of her life. Motivated by this impulse, she is seeking a loan that she will invest in the purchase of toiletries and beauty products with the goal of increasing her earnings and to convert herself into a businesswoman. Her greatest desire is to have economic stability and to guarantee a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and beauty products.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is single and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Dorcas is a successful businesswoman. She sells meat pies in Kokoado (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Dorcas uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Dorcas will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of ingredients for making meat pies, which will enable her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorcas plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients for making meat pies

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria, 43 años de edad, casada, madre de 4 hijos. Ella es una humilde comerciante quien se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas y frijoles, ella aprendió a leer y escribir su procedencia humilde no le permitió seguir estudiando pero aun así ha salido adelante con su trabajo.  Comenzo con su negocio a los 33 años de edad pues era madre soltera de tres hijos y necesitaba darle de comer después conoció a su esposo y padre de su último hijo quien la apoya en la venta de frijoles cosidos. Cuando no  está vendiendo se dedica a cuidar ancianitos.  
Ella está requiriendo el crédito para comprar maíz, leña, cal y bolsas plásticas para empacar tortillas. Este financiamiento le permitirá adquirir con mayor facilidad y mejor precio la materia prima que necesita para producir sus tortillas. Uno de sus planes próximos es cambiar el techo de su vivienda para que no se pase el agua durante este invierno y en lo futuro quiere poner una mini pulpería. Pues necesita ingresos para darle estudios a sus hijos y sean unos profesionales con mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She is a humble merchant who works producing and selling tortillas and beans. She learned to read and write, but her humble origins didn't permit her to continue studying, even so, she has gotten ahead through her work. She began her business when she was 33 years old because she was a single mother with three children and she needed to provide food for them. Afterwards, she met her husband and the father of her last child who supports her with her sales of cooked beans. When she is not making sales she works taking care of the elderly. 

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and plastic bags for packing tortillas. This financing will allow her to acquire the primary materials she needs to produce her tortillas more easily, and at a lower price. One of her plans for the near future is to replace the roof of her home so that it does not leak during the winter. In the future she wants to own a mini grocery store. She also needs profits to provide schooling to her children so that they can be professionals with improved opportunities.

loans.use:
to buy corn, firewood, lime and plastic bags to 
pack tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her frozen meat inventory

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama, 40, is married and has four children, who always help her out. Salama has been a merchant for four years. She has a well-stocked food stall, with all of the basic goods, in a well-populated area in town. She says that she began with a small kiosk when she moved to town, and with a lot of sacrifice she grew her business. There is a lot of competition in the area. She also says that she is very proud of her work, because with her efforts she has been able to support and educate her children. Salama asks for a loan to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items, so that she can continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items, to sell at her food sales stall

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Having grown up in difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any form of formal education.  Even so, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells bread in Kokoado (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. As a widow caring for three children, Efua uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family.

Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of bread, which will allow her to increase her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business, to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bread to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients for making her local dishes

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Sonnie is 39 years old and lives in the Paynesville south area, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 18 years. They all live at home, and three of them are attending school. Sonnie, herself, was not fortunate enough to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman, also. For the past three years Sonnie has been selling Vita, pepper, oil, okra, and other cooking ingredients, in the local market. She is facing no great problems in her business right now. She sells every day and spends 12 hours with her business. She started this business with a little capital she received from her husband.

Sonnie is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more goods for her business inventory. She hopes to build her house. She would like to say "thanks," to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia, to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more foods for her business inventory, like pepper, oil and okra

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, es una mujer emprendedora porque a pesar que es madre soltera ella sigue trabajando por sus dos hijos. Comenzó con un negocio de legumbres en las afuera de su casa y asi tener ingresos suficientes para darle lo mejor a sus hijos. 

Trabaja desde hace 4 años atrás en la venta de legumbres, desde las 07:00 am que comprar la legumbre en el mercado central hasta las 18h:00 que trabaja vendiéndolas. Una de sus dificultades en su negocio es que tiene que tener cuidados especiales con su hijo que padece de una discapacidad y eso hace que no este al 100% en su negocio. 

Ella tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio por eso quiere invertir una parte del dinero en las legumbres, y otra parte en la remodelacion del cuarto de su hijo comprando cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  She is an enterprising woman because, in spite of being a single mother, she continues working for her two children.  She started with her vegetable business in the areas surrounding her house so that she would have enough income to give her children the best.  She has been working for four years selling vegetables.  She starts buying the vegetables at the central market at 7:00 a.m, and she works selling them until 6:00 p.m.  One of the difficulties that she has with her business is that she has to give special care to her child who has a disability.  This makes it so that she is not in her business 100%. 

She has a lot of hopes for her business.  Therefore, she wants to invest part of the money in vegetables.  She will use the other part to remodel her son’s room.  She will buy cement, sand, and cement blocks.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and cement, sand, and cement blocks to remodel her son's room.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old, is married to a laborer, and has been blessed with two children. She has been engaged in hog raising for ten years. Aside from hog raising, she also has a half-hectare field of rice.

Lorna plans to buy two piglets and hog feed. Due to a shortage of capital, she decided to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000. She believes that through investing this loan in her business, she could further educate her youngest child and improve her financial stability. Lorna hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy two piglets, and feed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 31 years old and lives in the West Point area, which is the most populated section of Montserrado County. She is single and the mother of two children who are 12 and 6 years old. Both of them attend school. Unfortunately, Rebecca was unable to go to school, but today she works hard selling food items such as rice, oil and vita (a type of juice) in her local market. She works six days a week from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m., and enjoys her business because she likes having contact with her customers. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, oil and vita to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the Kiva lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Payee

texts.en:
Payee is 46 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most-populated market in Montserrado County. She was unable to go to school. She is married, and she has three children, ages 29, 27, and 22 years. She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years she has been selling various foods at the local market -- for example, rice, cola, sugar and oil. She sells six days a week, from 7AM to 6PM. She likes her business, because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She uses a shared taxi every time, to get her goods to her business spot.

Payee is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more inventory for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her food sales business,

loans.name: Luz Dari

texts.es:
Luz Dari de 28 años, decidió montar su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de mercancía de uso personal, belleza y hogar. Desde entonces ha visto como su calidad de vida ha mejorado, garantizándole a su familia mejores oportunidades.
Con el sueño de salir adelante y seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local, Luz requiere de la compra de mercancía con el fin de diversificar sus productos y ofrecerles a sus clientes diferentes alternativas a la hora de realizar sus compras de esta manera, espera  aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Sueña con tener un local para formalizar su negocio y expandirse en municipios aledaños.
texts.en:
28-year-old Luz Dari decided to start her own business selling products for beauty, home, and personal use. Since then, she has seen how her quality of life has improved, guaranteeing better opportunities for her family.

With her dream of getting ahead and continuing to grow within the local market, Luz needs to purchase merchandise with the goal of diversifying her products and offering her customers different alternatives when making their purchases. In this way, she hopes to increase her sales and earnings. She dreams of having a small shop to formalize her business and expand into surrounding towns.

loans.use: to purchase home and beauty products.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Julia, from Liberia. She lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country, which is known for fresh fish because it is located by the ocean.  However, St. Paul is also one of the poorer areas, and housing quality is often very bad.
 
Julia is single and has three children.  Her three children are aged between 6 and 15 years. Her children live at home and go to school. Her spouse works as driver.
 
Julia has a sales table, where she sells bread, sugar, oil, rice and other foods. She has been in business for 10 years and works 10 hours a day.  With this loan, she will buy inventory.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income.  She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband.
