She is proud of her business, because she makes more profit. Her plan is to build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sales table, such as bread, sugar, oil, rice, and other foods

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba is a 47-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is married and has five children who range in age from 25 to 15 years old. Only two are currently attending school and living at home. Kumba was unable to attend school, and today works in St. Paul, which is the oldest market in Liberia and known for fish because of its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb just outside Monrovia. It is one of the poorer areas of the country and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Kumba works at a table where she has sold charcoal for the last 15 years. Her greatest challenge in life is the small income she earns. She is applying for this loan to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers. Her goal is to one day own a house. She thanks you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old Loretta, from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia, which is known for fresh fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.
 
Loretta completed 12th grade and is married.  Her husband is a barber.  She has three children between the ages of 14 and 9. Her three children are in school, and they all live at home.
 
Loretta owns her own sales table, and she has sold cooking ingredients, like pepper, oil, and okra, for the past four years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase similar goods.  On average, she works 10 hours per day at her business.  She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites rainy seasons as her biggest business challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit.  In the future, Loretta would like to build a shop.  She thanks you, in advance, for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients, like pepper, oil, and okra, to resell at her business table

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is 39 years old and lives in the Liberian town of St. Paul, a suburb located outside of Monrovia.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country and is known for fresh fish because it is located by the ocean.  However, it is also one of the poorer areas of the country, and housing quality is often very low. Finda is married and the mother of four children who range in age from 23 to 15 years old. Her spouse works as teacher. Two of her children live at home and still attend school. Finda works at a table in the local market where she sells bread and soft drinks.  She has been in business for five years and works 12 hours a day. She is requesting this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. One of the greatest challenges she faces in life is her low income. She transports her goods to market by taxi and started her business with money from her mother.  She is proud of her work because it allows her to earn an income. Her goal is to someday build a house. She would like to extend her thanks to Kiva lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Christna

texts.en:
Christina is a 44-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is single, and she has three children between 12 and 6 years old. Her children are currently attending school and living at home.  Christina, herself, did not go to school.  She describes herself as a working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia, which is known for fresh fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.

Christina has a sales table, and she has been selling charcoal there, for the past three years.  She works ten hours a day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy charcoal to resell at her table. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business, because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house. Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell at her business table

loans.name: Ntamu

texts.en: Ntamu is a repeat client of Yehu Microfinance. Ntamu has had a cereals store for the past three years. She’s repaid several loans to date, and is asking for this one to buy groceries, such as beverages, baked goods, sugar and tea. This use of the loan will enable her to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. With a great variety of products to offer, she will earn a larger profit margin, which will help her improve her own and her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to diversify her store's inventory, by buying groceries like beverages, baked goods, sugar and tea

loans.name: Darcia Maria

texts.es:
Darcia, es una humilde comerciante, quien habita en Tipitapa municipio de Managua , madre de dos hijos de 26 y 15 años de edad , ella  se dedica a  vender ropa de manera ambulante . Anteriormente trabajaba como domestica limpiando casas y cuidando niños.  Desde hace 10 años se dedica a  vender ropa y chinelas  de manera ambulante, ella  vende sus productos en barrios  y mercados cercano al municipio  donde vive. 
Hoy requiere el crédito para comprar chinelas de hule, ropa interior de mujer, calcetines, topless, blusas, toallas de cocina etc.  Esto le permitirá tener más mercadería para vender y al mismo tiempo más capital para comprar nuevos artículos para vender tales como perfumes y shampo. 
Ella le gustaría tener un tramo en el mercado donde puede colocar su mercadería y asi tener un solo lugar donde vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Darcia is a simple businesswoman who lives in Tapita in the municipality of Managua. She has two children aged 26 and 15. Darcia earns her living selling clothing. She used to be a maid cleaning people's houses and looking after children, but for ten years now she has been selling clothing and sandals in the neighborhoods and markets of the town where she lives.

Now she needs a loan to buy rubber flip flops, women's underwear, socks, sun tops, blouses, kitchen towels etc. She will then have more merchandise to sell and more working capital to buy new items like perfume and shampoo.

Darcia would like to have a permanent place in the market where she can keep her merchandise and sell it from there too.

loans.use: buy rubber flip flops, women's underwear, socks, sun tops, blouses, kitchen towels etc

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en: Dorine owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She earns a living by operating a phone accessories, phone repair and phone chargers business, selling to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is late payments, and her main goal is to expand her business in the future. She has requested a loan for Kshs 30,000 to buy more phone chargers and accessories to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more phone chargers and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fruit, which will enable her to increase her overall sales

loans.name: Milciades Lenin

texts.es: Milciades, de 40 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Managua  , padre de un hijo de 9 años el cual estudia la primaria . El se dedica a reparar televisores, planchas, abanicos, licuadoras y  a la vez tiene un pequeño negocio donde alquila video juegos . Anteriormente se dedicaba  a vender y medicamentos pero sintió la necesidad de poner su propio negocio y dejar de trabajarle a empresas que lo subcontrataban  con la liquidación empezó a hacer mejoras a su casa y a comprar herramientas para reparar aparatos electrónicos. Actualmente tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad además de ofrecer el alquiler de videos juegos. El este requiriendo el crédito para comprar repuestos y accesorios para reparación de tv, equipos de sonido, nintendo. Esto le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes  y al mismo tiempo tener en buenas condiciones los nintendo. Pues en lo futuro le gustaría tener un taller de reparación de aparatos eléctricos en un local más amplio al igual una tienda de video juegos.
texts.en: Milciades who is 40 years old, lives in the city of Managua.  He is the father of a 9-year old son who is in primary school.  He makes his living repairing televisions, irons, fans and blenders.  He also has a small business renting video games.  Previously, Milciades made his living selling medications, but he felt the need to start his own business and stop subcontracting to other companies.  With the clearance sale from his previous business, he started making improvements to his house and purchasing tools to repair electronics.  He has been making his living in this business now for ten years, in addition to renting video games.  Milciades needs the loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for TV, sound equipment and Nintendo repairs.  This will allow him to offer a better service to his customers and at the same time to keep his Nintendos in good condition.  In the future, Milciades would like to have an electric appliance repair workshop in a bigger space as well as a video game store.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for TV, sound equipment and Nintendo repair.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow and lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Fatuma has a food store that she has managed for more than four years. She decided to take a chance so that she could move forward. Fatuma needs a loan in order to buy sugar, noodles, baked goods, and other products that will enable her to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
Noelia a sus 48 años de edad es madre de dos hijos. Con el ánimo de sacar adelante a su familia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos por catálogo, actividad que le permite estar pendiente de su familia y realizar las labores domésticas.
Uno de sus mayores retos ha sido afrontar algunas dificultades económicas, debido a que varios de sus clientes se han quedado sin empleo por lo cual no le han cancelado oportunamente, lo que se traduce en pérdidas para su negocio. 
Con el ánimo de mejorar su condición económica Noelia se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido con el fin de abrir un nuevo nicho de mercado, aumentando sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Noelia is 48 years old and has two children. As she wanted to help her family get ahead, she decided to sell products from a catalog, a job that allows her to look after her family and the household too. One of Noelia's biggest challenges has been to overcome financial difficulties when several of her customers lost their jobs and couldn't pay for their purchases. This led to losses for her business.

Because she is keen to improve her financial situation, Noelia is now seeking a loan to buy more stock (beauty products etc.) and access a niche in the market. In this way she will increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Buy beauty and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. She has operated a food vending business for the past several years, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers are. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to pay school fees, and she will use the remainder to add stock to her food kiosk business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to add stock to her food kiosk business with the remainder.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Ángela de 42 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, toda su vida le ha gustado los negocios. Por más de 10 años se dedicó al oficio de la confección, pero debido al retraso en los pagos entró en quiebra Y cerró su actividad productiva. Hoy después de realizar una estudio de mercado y ver las grandes ventajas que hay en el sector de mantenimiento de máquinas de confección y reparación de electrodomésticos se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin adquirir herramientas y repuestos para iniciar con su actividad comercial. Asegura que su nuevo proyecto le permitirá brindar empleo a dos personas de su comunidad. Sueña con tener una buena aceptación en el mercado, crecer y convertirse en una fuente de empleo para su municipio
texts.en:
42-year old Ángela is an enterprising woman who has always enjoyed running a business. For more than ten years she was a seamstress, but because people were slow to make payments, she became bankrupt and closed her business.

After studying the market and seeing the many advantages of a business maintaining and repairing sewing machines and electric appliances, Ángela is seeking a loan to start such a business. The loan would be used to buy tools and spare parts. She is hopeful that the new business will generate employment for two local people. Her dream is for the business to be well-accepted in the marketplace, then expand, and eventually become a source of employment in her town.

loans.use: Buy tools and spare parts

loans.name: Victor Eliecer

texts.es:
Desde que se benefició con su crédito anterior en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprando en mayor cantidad los insumos con los que operar su negocio de fotocopiaje y transcripciones, Víctor, un joven de 30 años de edad, que habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de dos años en San Jacinto-Municipio de Bolívar, se siente muy satisfecho pues sus ventas se incrementaron y así mismo sus ingresos. 
Cuando inicio su negocio de fotocopiaje y transcripciones, lo hizo en el negocio de su primo, quien lo finalizó y por esto a Víctor se le ocurrió emprender su propia aventura de negocio, aprovechando su experiencia justamente en lo que venia trabajando.  Hoy ofrece otros servicios en su negocio y quiere continuar haciéndolo crecer, por eso acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una fotocopiadora, con este equipo pretende ofrecer un mejor servicio y continuar incrementando sus ventas. Él dice a los financiadores de Kiva, que se siente muy agradecido por los servicios prestados por la Fundación y además puede continuar aumentando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is a young man of 30 who lives with his spouse and their little 2 year old son in San Jacinto, Municipio de Bolívar. He benefitted from his previous loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) to purchase a greater quantity of supplies for the operation of his photocopying and reproduction business. He is very satisfied because his sales have increased and because of this, his income.

When he started his photocopying and reproduction business he did it in his cousin's shop which has closed, so Victor decided to undertake his own business venture, taking advantage of his experience in exactly what he had just been working at. Today he offers other services in his business and want to continue making it grow. For this reason he is turning to a Kiva loan, which he will use to purchase a photocopier. With this equipment he plans to offer improved service and continue to increase his sales. 

He wishes to tell the Kiva financial backers that he is very grateful for the services provided by the Foundation and in addition he can continue improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is a 44-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children, between 28 and 16 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school and live at home. She has completed grade 12 before starting her business.  She describes herself as working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.
 
Louise has had a shop business, which sells lappa (Traditional cloths), for the past 13 years.  She works ten hours at her business a day.  Her greatest challenge in business is the small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Musu is 50 years old, married with four children. Only the 17-year-old child is in school and lives at home. For the past four years she has been operating a small shop where she sells soap, tissue, oil, etc. She says sometimes the buying is slow. Musu says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the little goods she could afford.  She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
Yatta lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Yatta is 28 years old, married with four children between 10 to 3 years old.  They are in school and live at home. For the past six years she has been operating a small shop where she sells rice, pepper, oil, etc. The rainy season is the problem that she faces. Yatta says she started this business by selling for her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 35-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is single and has three children, between 12 and 6 years old. Her three children are currently attending school and live at home.  She completed school before starting her business.  She describes herself as a working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Josephine has a table business, which sells palm oil, rice, etc for the past 7 years.  She works ten hours at her business a day.  Her greatest challenge in business is the small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 56 años de edad, se ha dedicado a la agricultura la mayor parte de su vida y con la ayuda de sus dos hijos mayores de 24 y 21 años trabaja con esmero y dedicación para salir adelante y alcanzar los objetivos propuestos. Antonio enseña a los jóvenes de su comunidad a que aprendan sobre el cultivo y la tierra y generen sus propios ingresos. 

Este gran emprendedor se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos y material agrícola para sacar una mejor cosecha y  comercializarlo a un mejor precio.
Sueña con garantizarle a su hijo menor, la oportunidad de acceder a la escuela y que pueda llegar a convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Antonio is 56 years old and has worked in farming for most of his life.  With the help of his eldest children - who are aged 24 and 21 years old - Antonio works with care and dedication to move forward and achieve his set goals.  Antonio teaches young people in his community as they learn about working the land and generating their own income.

This great entrepreneur is applying for a loan that he will invest in buying farming supplies and materials.  With it he will have a better harvest and be able to sell his products at a better price.

Antonio dreams of guaranteeing his youngest son the opportunity of going to school and becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and material.

loans.name: Maria  De Los Milagros

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Maria quien con su credikiva invirtió en la compra de un computador y también en productos alimenticios o medicina natural, lo que fue vendido a crédito y los recuperó semanalmente en un corto plazo. Su meta es aumentar su nivel de vida y ella está muy satisfecha, pues ya no depende totalmente, de lo que su esposo le suministra a sus hijos. Ella le dice  a los financiadores de Kiva, que está muy agradecida y espera que la ayuden a obtener nuevos  créditos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva con el cual comprará 1 computador y también incrementará las compras de medicina natural, con ello ampliará su estructura de mercado y ofrecerá un mas efectivo servicio de fotocopiaje
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Maria who, with her Kiva loan, invested in a computer and food products and natural medicines.  She sold these products and customers paid in weekly installments.  Maria's goal is to improve her quality of life.  She is very happy as she no longer depends completely on her husband to provide for their children.  Maria would like to tell Kiva lenders that she is very grateful and hopes that they can help her to receive further loans.  She is currently applying for a loan to buy a computer and to increase her purchases of natural medicine.  With this she can increase her market and offer a more effective photocopying service.

loans.use: to buy a computer and to increase her purchases of natural medicines.

loans.name: Argemiro

texts.es: Argemiro a sus 58 años de edad, trabaja día a día arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia en su cultivo de fríjol y tomate, ubicado en un pequeño lote de su propiedad. En los últimos meses, ha presentado dificultades puesto que el invierno ha afectado en gran proporción su cultivo y no ha podido sacar la producción que esperaba, para lo cual necesita de la compra de abonos y riegos que le permitan recuperar su cultivo y la calidad de vida de su familia. Argemiro tiene la esperanza de mejorar su cultivo y brindarle lo necesario para vivir a su familia, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y semillas.
texts.en: At 58 years old Argemiro stills works hard at his bean and tomato plants every day in order to help his family prosper.  His crops are on a small plot of land that he owns.  In recent months Argemiro has had difficulties as the winter has severely affected his crops and he has not had the yield he was hoping for.  Consequently, he needs to buy manure and irrigation tools that will allow him to recover his crops and his family's quality of life.  Argemiro is hopeful that he can improve his crops and provide his family with what they need to live.   To help with the crops, he is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies and seeds.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Gabriela Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela tiene 32 años, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica desde hace muchos años al servicio de reciclaje de botellas y envases en el acopio que se encuentran en su misma casa de donde distribuye a las distintas empresas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Gabriela  va a usar este préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio botellas y envases de plástico y vidrio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar sus ganancias y por ende su capital, la Sra. Gabriela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que muchas personas al igual que ella se dedican al reciclado de materiales, ella va a utilizar los beneficios compra de mas material para su negocio, el deseo de la Sra. Gabriela para su negocio es tener un acopio más grande de reciclaje y poder comprar a minoristas y vender en grandes cantidades a las empresas que se encargan del reciclado de este material.
texts.en: Sra. Gabriela is 32 and has two school-aged children. She has worked for many years recycling bottles and cans in her own home. She distributes to various businesses. This is her first loan with the institution. She will use it to purchase merchandise, bottles and cans made from plastic and glass, for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her earnings and capital. She has to confront the challenge of competition in her business; many people, like herself, also recycle materials. She will use her earnings to buy more material for her business. Gabriela wants to have a larger recycling centre and to be able to sell to retailers and in large quantities to the businesses that recycle this material.

loans.use: to purchase recycling material wholesale.

loans.name: Blanca Inés

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 54 años de edad se dedica al engorde y venta de pollos y huevos desde un pequeño galpón ubicado en el solar de su casa. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres con quienes vivió su infancia y adolescencia en una finca. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de sus siete hijos, decidió iniciar con esta actividad, la cual le ha brindado la posibilidad de garantizarle educación y mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. 
En la actualidad Blanca se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos de engorde, concentrado y adecuación de galpones, ya que sus ventas se han incrementado debido al buen cuidado que les da a sus animales.
Su mayor sueño, es tener su propia finca para expandir su negocio y aumentar la rentabilidad, brindándole a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 54 and raises and sells chickens and eggs. She has a small chicken coop in the garden of her home. She learned this work from her parents; she grew up on a farm. Because she wanted to improve her income and the quality of life of her seven children, she decided to start this business. It has allowed her to guarantee her children's education and improve her family's living conditions. 
Blanca is requesting a loan for the purchase of chickens for fattening and chicken feed, and to fix up the chicken coops. Her sales have increased due to the good care she provides her animals.
Her greatest dream is to have her own farm to expand her business and increase its profitability, offering her family better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chickens for fattening, and to fix the chicken coops.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto mayor de edad casado con tres hijos ya mayores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, es un microempresario el cual posee en su casa de habitación un taller de costura donde se confeccionan pantalones, camisas, así como también ropa de damas, niños,  sus compras las realiza por general en tiendas al contado, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, crédito que lo recupera los quince y treinta de cada mes, a la fecha Luis ha obtenido ya varios créditos con nosotros en los cuales ha demostrado ser responsable, en sus cuotas las cuales las ha cancelado sin ningún inconveniente en tiempo y forma, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo como es la compra de materiales de confeccione. Luis Alberto agradece mucho a los inversionistas Kivas por el apoyo que ellos les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos como es Nicaragua.-
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is married, and has three grown children. He is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega and has a small business in his own home; he has a sewing workshop where he makes pants and shirts. He also makes women's and children's clothing. He generally makes his purchases in stores for cash. He makes his sales for cash and on credit to his customers, some of whom are fixed clients. For purchases made on credit, he charges on the fifteenth and thirtieth of every month. Luis has already taken out several loans with the institution and has proven himself to be responsible with his monthly payments, which he has repaid without any problem. 
He will use this loan for the purchase of sewing materials. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their support of people of low economic resources in places like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials such as fabric, thread, scissors, and buttons.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Olivia is 28 years old, single, and has three children, ages 10, 5, and 2. All are in school and live at home. For the past three years, she has been operating a small table market where she sells bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable, pepper, onions, Vita (juice drink), and many items. She started this business by selling dried fish around in her community with the little goods she could afford. She learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball, pepper, onions, Vita and many items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball, pepper, onions, Vita and many items for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is single with five children between the ages of 2 and 19 years old. They live in Nimba County in Liberia. Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area, bringing lots of trade. It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.

Annie has had a business for the past three years selling palm oil, starting this business with funds from her mother. She works at her business daily for around eight hours. She transports the goods to her business by pickup. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is a shortage of goods in her shop.

Annie has requested a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. In the future, she hopes to own a house. She is proud of her business because she earns money every day to cover her expenses.

Annie wants to thank all of the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Ella es una mujer emprendedora porque comenzó hace años atras con su negocio de venta de joyas, para poderle dar lo mejor a su hijo ya que es madre soltera. Poco a poco con un pequeño capital que tenia comenzó su negocio de venta de joyas. 

En la actualidad tiene mercadería (como aparece en la foto) pero necesita mas para tener mas variedad y así venderle a sus clientes. Una de sus dificultades es que su hijos padece de discapacidad que no le permite trabajar al 100%. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio por eso quiere comprar mas joyas ya que quiere darle lo mejor a su hijo con mas ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  She is an enterprising woman because she started her business of selling jewelry years ago.  She did this in order to be able to help her son because she is a single mother.  With a small amount a capital she had she, little by little, started her business of selling jewelry.

She now has merchandise (as seen in the photo), but she needs more in order to have greater variety to sell to her customers.  One of her difficulties is that her son has a disability that does not allow her to work at 100%.

She has a lot of aspirations for her business.  Therefore, she wants to buy more jewelry because she wants to give the best to her son with more income.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is a widow and has seven children between the ages of 20 and 3. Only two of her children are in school and live at home. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

For the past ten years, Dana has had a table business which sells flour, sugar and rice. She works ten hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is the rainy season. She intends to use the loan to buy more goods. 

Dana started her business with money from her children. She likes her business because it keeps her busy. She hopes to one day buy a car. 
 
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Jose Otoniel

texts.es:
Otoniel a sus 42 años es padre de seis hijos de los cuales cinco son menores de edad.
Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar y hoy es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento y educación de sus hijos. 
Labora arduamente para conseguir el pan diario. Desde hace algunos años se dedica al engorde y cría de cerdos, ya que considera que es un trabajo rentable. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra cerdos con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición económica. Sueña con comprar una vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
Asegura que su mayor motivación es su familia, por la cual vela a fin de que gocen de una vida digna.
texts.en:
At 42 years old, Otoniel is the father of 6 young children.
He's been a farmer for 20 years, activity that he learned as family tradition, today this his only source of income for the support and education of his children.
He works hard to earn the daily bread.  For the last several years he's been producing and raising pigs, he considers this a profitable business.  He is now requesting a loan to invest in buying pigs with the goal to increase his income and improve his economic condition.  He dreams with buying a house and improve the quality of life of his home.  He assures that his main motivation is his family, who he takes care of, so that they enjoy a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos  a sus 59 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmente tiene cultivos de fríjol y arveja en terrenos de propiedad familiar. Cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en el oficio puesto que su familia se ha dedicado a la misma actividad.
Actualmente, el señor Carlos se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas para mejorar su cosecha y aumentar sus ingresos. Sueña con poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calida de vida y mejorar la vivienda en la que reside.
texts.en:
Carlos is 59 years old and works in agriculture. Currently, he cultivates beans and peas on land owned by his family. He has many years of experience in this job, as his family does the same work. 

Now, Carlos is requesting a loan with the goal of investing in the purchase of fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide in order to improve his harvest and increase his earnings. He dreams of being able to offer his family a better quality of live and to improve the house where they live.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a 34-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is a widow and has seven children, all between the ages of 15 and 9 years old.  She describes herself as hardworking.
She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 
Vera has a shop which has sold drinks such as soft drinks, alcoholic beverages, tissue, and water for the past five years. She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is the rainy season. She intends to use the loan to buy more goods to sell. Vera started her business with money from her children. She likes her business because it keeps her busy. She hopes to one day buy a car.  
Vera is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La Sra. Felicidad sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa,  cuenta que le fue con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de ropa de temporada,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras ya  que incremento sus ventas por esta época de frio y incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Felicidad is continuing with the same business, selling clothes, that she had for her previous loan that she used to buy seasonal clothing. On this occasion, she is requesting the loan to buy clothing wholesale such as sweaters and jackets as her sales increase at this cold time of year and her profits increase. She fells happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale, sweaters, and jackets

loans.name: Miguel Geronimo

texts.es:
Miguel Gerónimo de 45 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, es originario de  León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con sus hijos de actividades recreativas como jugar beisbol. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio obligado a trabaja desde temprana edad. 

Gracias  a su espíritu de superación y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de  mercadería como ropa de hombre y mujer pantalones, blusas, camisetas, faldas, short, vestidos, ropa interior, toallas, ropa de cama. El dedica a su actividad unas 9 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante con un bulto de unos 30 kg. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Miguel Gerónimo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
45 year old Miguel Geronimo is single and has 2 children in his care. He is originally from León, a place in the west of the country. He can be characterized as responsible, hardworking, and wanting to overcome problems. In his spare time, he enjoys himself playing games like baseball with his kids. Unfortunately, because he didn't have the economic resources, he was not able to study for a degree and he had to work from a very early age.
Thanks to his spirit of excellence and his desire to succeed, he has a business selling merchandise such as men's and women's clothes: trousers, blouses, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, underwear, towels, nightwear. He works about 9 hours a day and he sells door to door, carrying a 30kg package of clothes. The goal of this loan is to supply his business by buying merchandise so that, in the not too distant future, he can get a better income. Miguel Gerónimo is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scare resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to have business capital to buy and sell merchandise such as men's and women's clothes: trousers, blouses, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, underwear, towels, nightwear.

loans.name: Laureano Bacilio

texts.es: El Sr. Laureano  tiene 51 años, tiene 5 hijos,  vive en la zona de Chinchaya que está ubicada a cuarenta minutos del centro de la ciudad. En esta localidad los Comunarios se dedican a la crianza de vacas lecheras y al sembradío de verduras en el caso de las mujeres y los hombres al lavado de arena y piedra para construcción que sacan del rio. El Sr. Laureano utilizara el préstamo en la compra de equipo para el lavado de arena y piedra, el Sr. Laureano es una  persona alegre y muy trabajadora se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: 51 year old Laureano has 5 children and lives in the Chinchaya area which is located 40 minutes from the center of the city. The villagers in this place work raising milk cows and growing vegetables in the case of the women, and the men wash sand and stone that they take from the river for construction. Laureano will use the loan to buy equipment for washing sand and stone. Laureano is a very cheerful and hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support offered to him.

loans.use: to buy work equipment

loans.name: Celeste * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CELESTE * 26, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis  mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Teresa tiene 42 años y dos hijos de las edades 18 y 20 años,  su actividad es la venta de vajillas y utensilios de cocina,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en populosa feria de la 16 de Julio la Sra. Teresa se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para salir a vender, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Teresa comprara mercadería por mayor vajillas en cajas para surtir su puesto de venta , la Sra. Teresa es una persona responsable y trabajadora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir adelante superándose por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: The enterprise bank Celeste 26 is comprised of 8 members, 6 women and 2 men. The president of the bank is 42 year old Teresa who has 2 children who are 18 and 20 years old. Her business is selling chinaware and cooking utensils. She sells from her stall in the busy market called "16th of July". Teresa gets up in the early hours of the morning to go out and sell her wares. She will use the money from the loan to buy chinaware wholesale in crates to supply her stall. Teresa is a responsible and hardworking person and she is grateful to the institution for the economic support that it has offered her to have a better quality of life and to continue being successful for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale, a variety of chinaware.

loans.name: Arlen Maria

texts.es: La señora Arlen Habitante del municipio de la Concepcion del la comunidad llamado San Juan, junto a su esposo sus planes a futuro es poder trminar de construir su casa y  mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el la apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja por cuenta propia, y ella tiene una pulperia en casa de habitacion, con  este credito incrementara un poco mas su inventario en el negocio ya que sus clientes cada dia le exigen mas productos por lo que compra: Arroz, Aceite, Frijoles, Maiz, Productos Lacteos, Carnes,  Golosinas etc. con esta inversion podra obtener mayores ganacias y podra ayudar a su esposo, Agradce el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en: Arlen is a resident of the town of Concepcion in the community called San Juan. Along with her husband, her plan for the future is to be able to finish building her house and to improve her living conditions. Her husband helps her with the household expenses as he works for himself and she has a grocery store in their house. She will use this loan to increase her inventory a little as her customers are asking her for more products every day. For this reason she will buy: rice, oil, beans, corn, dairy products, meat, candy, etc. With this investment, she will be able to make better profits and help her husband. She is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have offered her.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Karen Joyce

texts.en:
This is Karen Joyce, a 20-year-old resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. Single and living with her parents, she helps them in managing their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Karen Joyce operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers, so there is a need for such services, especially for students who need to do research and write papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Karen Joyce is requesting a Php 50,000 loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Grace hopes that her business will continue to grow, and dreams of having a complete and happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a 57 year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has three children, aged 23, 18 and 17 years old respectively.  She engages in food vending. She sells snack foods such as rice cakes and she also caters home  meals for additional income.  She has been into food vending for more than 10 years now. 

Alfreda requested a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to buy more supplies including soft drinks, flour, sugar, meat and vegetables. In the future, Alfreda would like to expand her business,  to improve their livelihood status and, at the same time, provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: to buy more supplies including soft drinks, flour, sugar, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married. Marcelina is 50 years old, residing in Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marcelina owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products such as vegetables, snack items, etc. in order to earn a living.

She also manages a farm planting and harvesting bananas to sell.  Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 5,500 in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  In the future, Marcelina wants to make business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 43 year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest child is 20 while the youngest is 12.  She engages in food vending. She sells snack foods such as cassava cake and she also makes ice candy and sells it to the nearby school. She has been selling snack foods  for almost 10 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy more ingredients including cassava, sugar and coconut. In the future, Aida would like to expand her business, to provide her family with good food and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients including cassava. sugar and coconut.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 42-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is a married and has five children, between ages 6 and 23. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia.

Marie has had a shop which sells toothpaste, toothbrushes, tea, milk, etc. for the past 9 years. She works 13 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is less goods in her shop. She intends to use the loan to buy more inventory. She started her business with money from her children. She likes her business because it keeps her busy. She hopes to one day to build a house.

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier de 52 años de edad, casado con cuatro hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a  sus hijos.

Gracia a su espíritu de superación y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos como leche, cuajada, borona, queso, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, y dedica a su negocio unas 9 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de lácteos  para  que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Francisco Javier agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Francisco Javier is 52 years old. He is married with four children in his care. He is from the Sauce area, which is located in the north of the country. He is known for being a hardworking and responsible person, who is eager to do well in life. Unfortunately he was not able to study at third level and was obliged to work from a young age. For this reason he continues his daily struggle to be able to provide his children with a better future. 

Thanks to his ambitious nature and his desire to get ahead, he carries out an economic activity, which is the sale of dairy products, such as milk, curds, fresh cheese and cheese. He runs this business from his house. He works 9 hours a day. He enjoys his work a lot. His objective for this loan is to invest it in working capital and to stock his business which involves the buying and selling of dairy products. His aim is that in the not too distant future he will be able to earn a better income. Francisco Javier appreciates the help given by the Kiva investors to people with few resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may have the means to getting a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for the purchase and sale of dairy products, such as milk, curds, fresh cheese and cheese

loans.name: Almalden

texts.en:
From Talibon, Bohol, Almalden is a 34-year-old married mother of a six-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a welder.

Almalden runs a small store from which she sells various items like canned goods, soap, noodles, cooking oil and soft drinks. She has been in operation for almost five years.

Almalden is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan through CEVI which she will use to buy more stock such as beverages, condiments, soap and dry goods so as to avoid future shortages. She would like to expand her business successfully and save for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
From Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Tomas is 36 years old, married and has three children. To make a living he owns and operates a general store.

Tomas joined GDMPC in 2009. Recently, he applied for a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to buy canned goods, bottled products, noodles and spices. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy extra stock for his store.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 45-year-old-married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has ten children, the oldest being 25 while the youngest is nine. Her husband is a fisherman.

For almost seven years now Angelita has sold tuba (a type of coconut wine) as well as soft drinks like Pepsi to make additional money for her family.

Angelita is applying for a loan of 12,000 PHP through CEVI to buy more tuba wine and soft drinks to serve her customers. She hopes that in the future she will be successful enough not only to provide her family with good food but to save for her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy more tuba wine and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Madame Yacine une dame de la soixantaine, fait parti des premiers clients de l’IMCEC sis au centre du Sénégal, où elle a bénéficié de deux crédits payés convenablement. Elle fait de la vente de produits divers : tissus, ensembles pour enfants, chaussures… Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans le commerce et a été toujours active dans sa vie depuis le jeune âge .Grâce aux revenus de l’activité, elle participe activement à la gestion de la maison. Elle a déjà eu à bénéficier de 2 crédits au niveau de l’IMCEC.
Son souci à elle vu son âge, est de mettre ses enfants dans de meilleures conditions de vie.
texts.en: Mrs. Yacine is in her sixties. She is one of the first clients of IMCEC based in the central of Senegal. She obtained two loans in the past, both properly repaid. She sells miscellaneous items: fabric, clothing sets for children, shoes etc. She has over 20 years of experience as a vendor and has been earning a living since her youth. Thanks to the revenues from her business, she actively contributes to the household expenses. She already received two loans from IMCEC. Her concern, given her age, is to ensure a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric, clothing sets for children, shoes etc for resale.

loans.name: Clemente Aristides

texts.es: El señor Clemente, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, el lucha dia a dia para poder mejorar sus condiciones de Vida y sobre todo terminar de construir su casa que es su mayor sueño, su esposa le ayuda  con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja como domestica en una casa privada y el labora para una empresa privada, con este credito comprara los siguientes Materiales: Arena, Cemento, Ceramica, Bondex etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado con este financiamiento que le  han otorgado
texts.en:
Clemente lives with his wife and children in the Ticuantepe municipality.  He struggles day to day in order to be able to improve their living conditions.  Above all, he struggles to finish building their house, which is his greatest dream.  His wife helps him with the household expenses.  She works as a domestic employee in a private home, and he works for a private company.

He will use the loan to buy the following materials:  sand, cement, tiles, and tile mortar, etc.  He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have given him with the loan they have granted him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is a 57-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children.The oldest child is 35, while the youngest is 16. She runs a retail store. She sells various items, such as biscuits, sugar, eggs, coffee, cooking oil, canned goods and soaps. She has been operating the store for more than 10 years. Annabelle requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional goods to sell, such as beverages, toiletries, soft drinks, noodles and dry goods, to fill her store to avoid stock shortage. In the future, Anabelle would like to expand her business to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell, such as beverages, toiletries, soft drinks, noodles and dry goods

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is not the first or only tower in his hometown of El Paso, but he plans to make Big 5 Towing different and better than his competitors.

Being innovative with his company, Antonio completes a traditional tow job -- removing cars that exceed their paid parking time, are not properly parked, or are parked in a private area. However, Antonio doesn’t stop at the traditional. 

Big 5 Towing will supply fuel to clients who run out while on the road, change tires when needed, and complete other minor services on cars. He also plans to help cars that may be stuck in mud, water or anywhere else, and offer services to those too intoxicated to drive home.

With a plan in mind, Antonio was referred to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan by his friend. Once he applied and was approved, the 55-year-old was able to purchase a tow truck and begin his business. As the sole employee and owner of his business, Antonio has plans to expand and hire an employee as soon as he can.

loans.use: to purchase a tow truck.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Tangub City, Philippines. 

To make a living, Divina sells hanging rice (rice cooked in a pouch made of coconut palm leaves), viands and snacks in the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients. She hopes to provide better living conditions to her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Please meet Dorothy from Liberia. She lives and works in Nimba County. Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people pass through the area on business, bringing lots of trade. It is also the second-most populated area in Liberia. 

Dorothy completed 12 grades and is married. Her husband is a security guard. She has two children between the ages of 20 and 10, one of whom is in school. They all live at home.

On average, she works 10 hours a day at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by bus. She cites high price of gasoline as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is that she makes more profits. In the future, she would like to own a house.

Dorothy has owned her shop selling cold water and soft drinks for the past 20 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase soft drinks and gasoline to run her generator.

She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, and gasoline to run her generator.

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en:
This is Ernesa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products and ingredients for her food stall. The loan also helped in the education of her children. She has been in her business for seven years already. She and her husband are continuously working to provide for their everyday needs.

Ernesa would like to apply for a 16,000 Philippine peso loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ernesa dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients, such as rice, beef, pork, chicken and condiments, and utensils, such as spoons, chopping boards, knives, pans and casseroles, needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is from Malibangcao, Clarin. She is 34 years old. Rosemarie is married and has four children. To make a living, she manages her farm planting and harvesting corn to sell. She also has a vegetable garden to grow vegetables for sale.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando, a 44-year-old father of two, is from Aguada, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental where he cultivates rice for sale. While awaiting the harvest, he also earns income from his motor transport services in the local community.

Recently, Rolando requested s loan of PHP 40,000.00 from GDMPC micro credit to repair his motor in order to provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated for house renovations.

loans.use: repair his motor for better service

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is 66 years old and she is happily married to Nobero. God has blessed them with children who are now living with their own families. Life, indeed, is hard. But, by the grace of God, they are able to survive and live well, as they help each other.

Lolita owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community. The stores are just connected to, or just inside, their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, five pesos' worth of cooking oil or an egg and other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price than she will sell it by the piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help to her to add more products to her store.

Lolita desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping to have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 58, from Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Dominador, a vendor and the father to their four children. With her husband she manages the household while running her business.

Myrna rents gowns and barong tagalog (embroidered formal men’s shirts) used on special occasions such as weddings and other formal gatherings. She also sells business-related accessories. Her customers come from her neighborhood and the local community. She works hard to earn money for their everyday expenses, making a minimum of 5000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through CCT to be used to buy additional wedding gowns and barong tagalog.

Myrna hopes her business grows in coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education.

All CCT community clients, of which Myrna is a member, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy additional wedding gowns and barong tagalog.

loans.name: Emily Milenka

texts.es: La  Sra. Milenka tiene 20 años, ella se dedica a tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres de pollera, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Kalajahuira, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Milenka va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta ya que hace mucho frio, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la  Sra. Milenka enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus chompas.
texts.en: Milenka is 20 years old. She works knitting wool sweaters and wraps from alpaca wool for women who wear traditional skirts. She has her workshop and residence in the Kalajahuira area. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Milenka is going to use this loan to buy alpaca wool wholesale to knit her sweaters and wraps since she sells alot this time of year because it is very cold. She also delivers orders to different markets in the city of El Alto. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her working capital. Milenka faces challenges in her business such as stocking her merchandise and she is going to use the profits to keep buying her materials wholesale to knit her sweaters.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool wholesale.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Ma. Theresa would like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies, such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Theresa dreams of having a good life for her children and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Delgertsetseg

texts.en:
Delgertsetseg, 35, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Until recently her husband worked in Korea for many years as an employee for a private contractor. She has worked as a computer saleswoman for the past seven years, and her superiors praise her work ethic. She is a very hardworking individual who strives to realize a better future.

When Delgertsetseg’s husband came back to Mongolia, they bought an apartment with walls and a balcony in bad shape. The windows and walls are thin and flimsy, and in wintertime lots of frost forms around the windows.

Delgertsetseg is applying for a 7,000,000 MNT loan through Credit Mongol to buy cement, vacuum-insulated windows, fiberglass, foam and hardwood floors. With these materials she and her husband can make much-needed repairs to their apartment. Once they do, the apartment will be far more comfortable and warm, and their heating bills will go down.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate their apartment.

loans.name: Nancy Santos

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 2 hijos de 28 y 22 años de edad, el menor de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su marido es albañil.

Doña Nancy es una mujer muy luchadora que  al ver que su esposo no gana mucho y en ocasiones se queda sin trabajo, desde hace un año y medio y con la ayuda del primer crédito puso en su casa un negocio de venta de bebidas, ella vende aguas, sodas, cervezas, energizantes  y otras bebidas, así como también ciertos bocaditos y cosas de picar, trabaja todos los días aunque los días que mas venta tiene son los fines de semana. Su hijo y su marido le ayudan cuando tienen tiempo.

Este crédito es para comprar aguas, sodas, cervezas y bocadillos. Lleva un año y medio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganar algo sacar adelante su hogar. 

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio día a día.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal crafts that are known nationally and internationally. It is where the famous paja toquilla hats are made..

This is where Nancy lives. She is 53 years old, married and from this relationship has 2 children, aged 28 and 22, The youngest still lives with her. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Nancy is a fighter. When she saw her husband wasn't earning much and that sometimes he had no work, a year and a half ago, with the help pf her first loan. she opened a business in her house selling drinks. She sells water, beer, energy drinks, and more, as well as snacks. She works every day, although the days she sells the most are the weekends. Her son and her husband help her when they have time.

This loan is to buy water, soda, beer and snacks. She has been in the communal bank for a year and a half and she likes it because she started her bank with her first loan and it allows her to get her household ahead.  

Her dream is to improve her business day to day.

loans.use: to buy water, soda, beer and snacks.

loans.name: Maria Aleen

texts.en:
Avelina is 46 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Barangay 3 of Tangub City in Misamis Occidental Province. She has run a small grocery shop for over five years and earns 7,000 PHP a month.

Avelina joined GDMPC in 2012 and is now applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and sticky rice. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her shop.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a 53-year-old widowed mother of three children. For years, she has made a living by running a general store in Segatic Diot, Clarin, selling a variety of food and home use products. She earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2004, Trinidad joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 11,500 PHP to purchase canned goods and bottled products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and bottled products for sale

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 69 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esa relación tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, uno  de ellos aun viven con ella y un nieto que tiene 15 años que es como su hijo y estudia en colegio. 

Doña Rosa para obtener sus propios recursos y así sacar adelante a sus hijos y más después que murió su marido se dedica al comercio, ella tienen un negocio de compra y venta de pescado, cuatro veces por semana se desplaza hasta las playas de la ciudad de Manta para comprar el mejor producto, para luego limpiarlos y enviarlos a Quito, ciudad en la cual vive un hijo que es el encargado de recibir y vender el producto en ese lugar, lleva en este negocio ya por más de 15 años con el cual ha podido salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal  desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante  a sus hijos. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, know for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal crafts known nationally and internationally. It is where the famous paja toquilla hats come from. 

This is where Rosa is from. She is 69. Several years ago, her husband died and she was widowed. From her marriage she has 7 grown children. One of them still lives wither her, as well as a 15 year old grandson who is like her son and goes to high school. 

In order to earn her own income, and get her children ahead, especially after her husband died, Rosa works as a merchant. she buys and sells fish. Four times a week she goes to the beaches of manta to buy the best products to later clean them and send them to Quito, where a son of hers lives who receives them and sells them there. She has had this business for more than 15 years and with it has been able to get ahead.

She is going to invest this loan in buying fish. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to get her children ahead. 

Her dream is to buy a car to transport her product.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun, an inhabitant of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, is a 48-year-old widowed mother of six children. Currently, four children are working at a construction site, while the remaining two are studying in a local state school. To deal with the family’s hardship as a single mother, Soun grows rice as her only source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages.

Soun is a second-time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The previous loan that she has repaid has supported her business in time. Now, she is applying for a new loan of 3,000,000 riels (KHR) in order to plow her farmland and buy potash for her rice. She hopes that she can earn more income to buy pigs to raise for extra profit.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and buy potash for her rice

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 50 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. She is married with five children. Gloria has been in the business of selling clothing in order to make a living for nine years. She earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. Gloria has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase more clothes to sell. In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María tiene34 años de edad, es madre de dos hijas. Desde hace más de 11 años se dedica a la elaboración de: enchiladas, tostadas de plátanos y de yuca, nuégados y chilate. Estos productos los comercializa en el mercado en horario de 1:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m. también vende café y chocolate. Esta actividad la aprendió de su mama quien le ha enseñado el proceso y la elaboración de estos productos. 
Ella tiene historial crediticio muy bueno en Fundación Campo el crédito que cancelo fue financiado por  KIVA y lo cancelo con categoría A.

Compra la materia prima para la elaboración de los comestibles en el mercado central de la ciudad, que se encuentra ubicado a medio kilómetro de donde ella reside los artículos que compra son: repollos, maíz, yuca, guineo verde, aceite. Entre otros  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 Repollos, 2 quintales de maíz, 8 canastos de yuca, 200 guineos verdes, 5 galones de aceite, entre otros productos más y para invertir en la instalación del piso y repello de su casa.  

Al comprar estos insumos para la elaboración de todos los comestibles incrementaran las ventas y de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias y tendrá más solvencia económica al costear los gastos de la casa y también podrá ayudar a sus hijas con el estudio 

 
Los planes a futuro que tiene la señora, es seguir con la construcción de la vivienda ya que actualmente no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para terminar el proyectó de la construcción.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and the mother of two daughters. For over 11 years, she has worked selling foods that she makes such as enchiladas, fried plantains and yucca, nuégados [sweet made from flour, nuts and honey] and chilate [beverage made from roasted corn, chili and cocoa often flavored with anise, pepper, ginger and cinnamon]. María sells these products, as well as coffee and hot chocolate in a local market from 1 p.m. to 6 p.m. She learned to cook these foods from her mother.

María has a very good credit history with the communal bank Fundación Campo. She repaid her previous loan financed by Kiva in the category A repayment rating.

With the new loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo, María will purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells in the city's central market, located 500 meters from where she lives. She will buy 10 cabbages, 200 pounds of corn, eight baskets of yucca, 200 green bananas, five gallons of oil, and other ingredients as well as to install a new floor and fix some cracks in her house.
