Purchasing these will help María increase her sales, to improve her profits. This will help improve her finances and allow her to pay her household expenses and her daughters' education.

In the future, María plans to continue the construction of her home because she doesn't currently have the resources to finish doing so.

loans.use: to buy 10 cabbages, 200 pounds of corn, eight baskets of yucca, 200 green bananas, five gallons of oil, and other ingredients as well as to install a new floor and fix some cracks in her house.

loans.name: Reum's Group

texts.en: Reum, a mother of four children (three schoolchildren and one little kid), is 35 years old and a farmer who does rice cropping on two hectares as her main source of income. She also makes brown sugar from sugar palm juice. Her current business returns about 22,700 riels (KHR) per day. This is not the first loan for Reum with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan in order to smooth her farmland. She hopes this loan will support her business in time, so that she can improve her living conditions at a good pace.

loans.use: to smooth her farmland

loans.name: Nancy Judith

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad e independientes y los dos menores de edad aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio. Su marido es chofer. Ella es licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación.
 
Doña Nancy trabaja de  maestra en una escuela de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio, vende semijoyas de Romanel y  de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días en todas sus actividades, sus productos los vende los últimos días de la semana aunque también les vende a sus compañeras de la escuela, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva en este negocio por más de 14 años y estos productos los compra en una distribuidora en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar semijoyas de Romanel como: cadenas, pulseras, collares y productos de Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 14 años y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. 

Sus metas son seguir trabajando y ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Monserrate meets every other week in the canton Montecristi, an area known for its rich precolonial culture. It's artisanal goods are very well-known both nationally and internationally. Montecristi is home to the famous straw Panama hats. 

This is where Nancy, 58 years old, lives. She is married and the mother of four children. Two of her kids are older and independent, while the two youngest still live with her and are in high school. Nancy's husband works in transportation. Nancy has a degree in Education; she works as a teacher in a local school and also works selling Romanel jewelry and Yanbal beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories, which she buys from a distributor in Manta. She works every day since she teaches during the week then sells her products primarily on the weekends, though she also sells them to some of her coworkers at school. Nancy allows customers to buy items on credit and she collects payments each weekend. She has been working in this business for over 14 years. 

Nancy is requesting this loan in order to buy more jewelry such as chains, bracelets, necklaces and Yanbal products. She has been involved with the Communal Bank group for 14 years and really enjoys the benefits it provides. Nancy's goals are to continue working and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, chains, and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: A hardworking farmer from Pursat Province, Kror Kor district, Thy is 32 years old and a rice grower in the local area. Besides this agricultural business, she is also a vendor who buys and sells chickens and frogs. The current businesses, which she has had for 10 years, have returned her about 14,100 KHR per day. Thy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles. She has fully repaid her past loan and it has relieved her family of their burden and improved her livelihood. Now she is applying for 3,000,000 KHR to buy an additional two hectares of farmland for growing more cash crops. She hopes that she can grow more cash crops and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy two hectares of farmland for growing more cash crops

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 62-year-old widow and mother of one child in Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  For 21 years she has made a living through the operation of a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products.  Aside from her store she also managed a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale and family consumption. 

She is now requesting a loan of 15,500 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosario Verónica

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 9 años que están estudiando  el mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Rosario es una muy buena ama de casa que además de estar pendiente del cuidado de su hogar también se dedica al comercio,  ella vende ropa por catálogos, zapatos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, cobra cada 8 días ya que deja a crédito su mercadería, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta profesión la cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos como ropa, bisutería, zapatos y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 14 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Monserrate meets every other week in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture. It's artisanal goods are well-known both nationally and internationally. Montecristi is home to the famous straw Panama hat. 

Rosario, 38 years old, lives here with her husband and two children ages 14 and 9. Her oldest is currently studying in a local high school and her youngest is studying in an elementary school. Rosario's husband works in transportation. Rosario, along with taking care of the household responsibilities, runs a business in which she sells clothing through catalogs, as well as shoes, and Yanbal beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories. She sells these items door to door, collecting payments every week since she allows her customers to pay on credit. Rosario has been working in this business for over 15 years. It has allowed her to help her children get ahead.

With this loan, she will buy more merchandise such as clothing, jewelry, shoes, and Yanbal products. 

Rosario has been involved with the communal bank for 14 years. She likes it because of the help that the loans offer her. Her dream is to one day own a big bazaar.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry, shoes and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Maura Esperanza

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Maura, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido trabaja en el Municipio de Montecristi. 

Doña Maura tiene problemas de visión pero es una mujer muy luchadora que a pesar de su problema trata de ganar algo por su cuenta, ella se dedica al comercio para lo cual  tiene un local en su casa donde vende aguas, sodas, cervezas  y otras bebidas, trabaja todos los días sola y en ocasiones le ayuda su hija que vive cerca, lleva más de 15 años con su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo que lo utiliza para comprar sus medicinas y también para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar. 

Este crédito es para comprar aguas, sodas, cervezas y colas. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado a pesar de su problema de visión. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank Maria Monserrate meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known at a national and international level. It is the location of the famous hats of toquilla straw.

Señora Maura lives here. She is 66 years old. She is married and has seven adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband works in the town of Montecristi.

Doña Maura has vision problems, but she is a very hard-working woman who, in spite of her problem, tries to earn something on her own account. She works in commerce, for which she has a shop in her house where she sells water, sodas, beer, and other beverages. She works alone every day, and sometimes her daughter who lives nearby helps her. She has had her business for more than 15 years. It allows her to earn something that she can use to buy her medicines and also to help her husband with the expenses that the household generates.

This loan is to buy water, sodas, beer, and colas. She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning, and she likes it because they have always helped her in spite of her vision problem.

Her dream is to move forward.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, beer, and cola to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 32-year-old married entrepreneur from Sangay Daku, Ozamis City.  She has 5 children and makes a living from her transport service business.  She also had manages their own farm, harvesting coconut for sale.  Recently, she borrowed 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to finance the labor costs of weeding maintenance of the coco farm.  She hopes that with this business, they could provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to finance the costs of weeding maintenance of the coco farm.

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en: Samet, a rural villager from Pursat Province, is 61 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with five children, two of whom are still in school. To provide daily food for her kids, she earns a living via rice cropping on two hectares of land while her husband catches fish for resale. The business that she has had for 12 years has returned her about 19,700 KHR per day. Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for some time, Samet is a six-cycle client who has repaid her past loans already. The loans made a positive impact by enabling her to provide decent food for her kids and maintain her living. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland in order to be ready for upcoming rainy season rice cultivation. She hopes that her business will grow at a good pace and return to her a good output.

loans.use: To plow her farmland

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Khun is a 51-year-old married mother from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province.  She has six children, two of whom are still in school.  Khun is a rice grower on a half hectare of farmland she has had for 10 years.  Her main source of income is used to support the daily food consumption, her kids’ education, and other necessary expenses.

Khun, the second-time borrower with VisionFund, forms a group of four to apply for a new loan.  The original loan, that she has fully repaid, has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood.  The total loan amount of her group is 4,000,000 KHR.  As the leader, Khun will spend her loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy good rice seed, potash, and insecticide for her farmland.  She highly hopes that she can make triple the income from her current business so as she can sustain her living condition as well as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a good rice seed, potash, and insecticide.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 58-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines.  She is a widow and mother to her children.  She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luzviminda operates a retail business selling different vegetables.  She sells it in the vendors in the market.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.  To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy sacks of onions, garlic, carrots, potatoes, and cabbage.

Luzviminda dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family will always be in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, carrots, potatoes and cabbage.

loans.name: Lynorn

texts.en: Lynorn is a single, 31-year-old citizen from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province.  From three hectares of rice cropping, he is able to earn up to 17,100 KHR per day.  He has managed this business for 10 years.  This is the second loan for Lynorn with VisionFund.  He has utilized his past loan wisely to purchase a household appliance and maintain a good living condition for his family.  He has repaid it in full.  For this new cycle, he is seeking 3,000,000 KHR in order to smooth his farmland and replant his fragrant rice cultivation.  He hopes that he can earn more profit and succeed in his business.

loans.use: to smooth his farmland.

loans.name: Galo Alfonso

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive el Señor Enrique, tiene 57 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposa es una gran ama de casa.

Don Enrique para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de artesanías, él tiene un taller en su casa en el cual con la ayuda de su mujer y sus hijos elabora carteras, muebles y otros artículos para el hogar de mimbre que es un material muy utilizado para elaborar sus obras las mismas que son muy apreciadas en otras ciudades como Quito y Guayaquil, ciudades a las que viaja para vender sus productos una vez a la semana, el lleva más de 20 años en este negocio actividad que aprendió de su padre y es la misma que le sirve para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar mimbre para elaborar sus obras. Lleva más de 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas en su propio transporte.
texts.en:
The village bank Maria Monserrate meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and crafts that are recognized nationally and internationally. They are famous for their straw hats. 

This is where Enrique lives. He is 57, married and has 3 grown children, two of whom still live at home. His wife works in the home. Enrique is an artisan, working out of a workshop in his home where his wife and children help him to make purses, furniture and other household articles made out of wicker. He mostly uses that material to make his products which are appreciated in cities like Quito and Guayaquil, where he travels to sell his products once a week. He has been in this business for more than 20 years, having learned from his father, and it is what helps him to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy wicker to make his products. He has been in the village bank for over 6 years and likes it because of the help he receives. His dream is to buy a car so that he can make his sales using his own transportation.

loans.use: to buy wicker

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en: Age 30 and a villager from Pursat Province, Somaly is a mother of one little kid and one of the breadwinners in the family. To cover the daily cost of living, she does rice cropping and runs a small stall to sell grocery items. The business that she has had for six years has returned her about 16,300 KHR per day. This is not the first micro-loan for Somaly with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan, which has sustained her living better than before. Now, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan in order to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes this purchase will replenish her business on time and keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This is Michelle, 36, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a vendor, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Michelle operates a retail business. She offers different products such as towels and bags. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy backpacks, shoulder bags, clutch bags, bath towels, hand towels, face towels, and scarves needed in her business.

Michelle hopes that her business will grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for backpacks, shoulder bags, clutch bags, bath towels, hand towels, face towels, and scarves to sell

loans.name: Narun

texts.en: Narun, a young mother of two schoolchildren, is 28 years old and an inhabitant of Pursat Province. She earns a living by rice growing and Khmer noodle selling to support the entire household. This business has earned her about 12,700 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Narun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She succeeded in using her past loan, which she has repaid completely, to support her business and set aside some portion to buy necessary household materials. Currently, a shortage of working capital to buy buffalo to support her farmland is the main challenge for her. Therefore, she has decided to take another loan in order to overcome her challenges. She hopes that this purchase will support her business on time so as she can earn more income for her kids’ sake.

loans.use: to buy buffalo to support her farmland

loans.name: Francisca Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo de 18 años que está estudiando en la universidad. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Doña Francisca al igual que su marido se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, gafas y sombreros de paja toquilla que son muy apreciados sobre todo por los turistas que visitan el lugar, su forma de venta es recorriendo las calles y los fines de semana se desplaza a otras ciudades como: Pedernales, Salinas, Canoa, etc. lugares donde llegan muchos turistas. Sus productos compra en Guayaquil y también a artesanos del lugar, son más de 15 años dedicada a esto y es su forma de ganarse la vida honradamente y darle la mejor educación a su hijo.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, gafas y sombreros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 14 años y le gusta por los beneficios que la institución ofrece. 

Su sueño es que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Maria Monserrate meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known at a national and international level. It is the location of the famous hats of toquilla straw.

Señora Francisca lives here. She is 46 years old. She is married and has a son who is 18 and is studying at the university. Her husband is a businessman.

Doña Francisca, like her husband, works in commerce. She sells clothing of all types, glasses, and hats of toquilla straw, which are greatly valued, espacially by the tourists who visit the place. Her form of sales is walking through the streets, and on weekends she visits other cities such as Pedernales, Salinas, Canoa, etc., places where many tourists come. She buys her products in Guayaquil and also from craftspeople in her area. She has done this for more than 15 years, and it is her way of earning an honest living and giving the best education to her son.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing, glasses, and hats. She has been in the communal bank for more than 14 years, and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offers.

Her dream is to have her son finish his studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing, glasses, and hats

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: A widowed mother of four children living in Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Yorn is 38 years old and a vendor who sells sticky rice sweet dumplings, a Vietnamese dessert consisting of balls made from mung bean paste wrapped in a shell made of glutinous rice flour. This is a single business that she has had for 18 years. Yorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles. She has fully repaid her past loan and has used it wisely to support her business. Now, she is seeking a new loan to buy ingredient including fragrant rice, coconut, and sesame to make more desserts for resale. She hopes that she can make more profit from her current business so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients including fragrant rice, coconut, and sesame to make more desserts to sell

loans.name: Nancy Marisol

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijas de 16, 14, 8 y 5  años de edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio y las menores en escuela. Su marido es chofer.

Doña Nancy con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto poder solventar sus gastos y ayudar en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja de tres a cuatros  días a la semana en sus recorridos ya que su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha  las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos y aprovecha que sus hijos más pequeños están en la escuela, ella lleva 7 años en este negocio que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y que gracias a sus ganancias sus hijos pueden seguir estudiando. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y uniformes que es lo mas se vende actualmente. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 7 años y le gusta porque con el crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The communal bank Maria Monserrate meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known at a national and international level. It is the location of the famous Panama hats.

Señora Nancy lives in this place. She is 36 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have four daughters, ages 16, 14, 8, and 5. The two older ones are in secondary school, and the younger ones are in primary school. Her husband is a driver.

Doña Nancy, with the goal of having her own income and with it being able to pay her expenses and help in the household, sells clothing of all types. She works from three to four days a week in her rounds, since her form of sales is door to door. She takes advantage of the morning hours, since in these hours it is easier for her to complete her routes and take advantage of the fact that her younger children are in school. She has had this business for 7 years. She began it with the first loan that she received from the bank, and thanks to her earnings, her children can continue going to school.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing and uniforms, which is what she is selling the most of now. She has been in the communal bank for seven years, and she likes it because she began her business with the loan.

Her dream is to have a big shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing and uniforms to sell

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: From Pursat Province, Sary is 51 years old and married. She has eight children, four of whom are still dependent as they are in school. A two-and-a-half-hectare plot of rice is the single source of her family’s income. She is able to earn about 12,700 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a seven-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loans, she feels confident that she can upgrade her lifestyle in good conditions with hygienic living practices and sufficient food. Now she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pigs to raise for extra income. Additionally, she will use a portion of it to support her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Now she is applying for a 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: G.s. Laurel Galan Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Laurel Galán está conformado por cuatro mujeres, madres solteras. Ellas son originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país, y se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajada, queso.  Este grupo se caracteriza por ser mujeres trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, por lo cual lucha día a día para salir adelantes con sus pequeños hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante  Edith del Socorro es la coordinadora del grupo  y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica   a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite detergente, jugos, gaseosas, galletas, pan,  leche, huevos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo solidario Laurel Galán agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The village bank Laurel Galan is made up of four women, single mothers. They are from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country and known for production of dairy products like milk and cheese. This women in this group are hard working, responsible, and have a desire for personal improvement, which is what they fight for every day - moving forward with their small children and giving them a better future. 

Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead, Edith del Socorro is the coordinator of the group. She runs a small store located in her home. She works 12 hours a day, offering up her products. The goal of this loan is to invest in work capital and stock her store with food products to sell in small quantities, like rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergent, juices, sodas, cookies, bread, milk, and eggs. This will give her more income in the near future. 

The group Laurel Galan is thankful for the help the Kiva lenders give to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use:
to invest in business capital and stock her store with products like rice, beans, sugar,
oil, detergent, juices, sodas, cookies, bread, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district, Yem is married and has four children. She struggles to earn a good income for her family through rice cultivation; this is the business that she has had for ages and by which she is able to earn up to 13,500 KHR per day. This is the third micro-loan for Yem’s group, which consists of two female members; they are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. The successful past loans have provided prompt support for Yem's business as well as her living condition. She has fully repaid her past loans. Now, she is the leader of her group. She will spend her loan portion to add to her savings in order to buy a hand tractor to support her farm. She hopes that this tractor will support her field and reduce the fee that she used to pay to others.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for her farm

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: A breadwinner in a family consisting of five children, San is a 54-year-old farmer who grows rice on a one-hectare plot. She is able to earn up to 14,200 KHR per day from the current business, which she has run since she was 20 years old. San, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past five cycles, has completely repaid her past loan. That loan supported her crop farming. Now she has formed a group to apply for a new loan with other two borrowers. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family and a part of it to support her farm. She hopes to own a decent latrine so that she can provide good sanitation for her family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
This is Nelly. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of peanuts to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. She still sells peanuts. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelly hopes to be successful in her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en: In her late 30s and a local citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sophat is a farmer who strives for a living via rice cropping in order to support the two out of her four kids who are still in school. She has owned this business with the support of her husband for 10 years and is able to earn about 27,000 KHR per day. Sophat, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles, has fully repaid her past loan with success to improve her lifestyle. Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. Sophat will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash, and to pay for plowing fees and reaping fees. She hopes that this loan will enable her to support her business on time to expand her business on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash, and to pay for plowing fees and reaping fees

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: A breadwinner in a family consisting of five children - one of whom is in school, Sarin is a villager from the Banteay Meanchey province in Cambodia. She manages a rice farming business as her main source of income as well as working for others for a fee to supplement her profit. This is the only business that she has engaged in for three years. Sarin is not a first-cycled client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The two past loan cycles ,which she has taken and completely repaid back, has kept up a good pace of improving her living better than before. Now, she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. Sarin will spend her loan portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy potash for her cash-crop. She does believe that this prompt support loan will help her get back to a good crop output, so she can set aside some money in order to buy a decent motorbike for her family.

loans.use: to pay plowing fee and to buy potash

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jeodelyn

texts.en:
This is Jeodelyn, 30, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edgar, an electrician and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jeodelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jeodelyn hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya, 58, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Winefredo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ligaya operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan to help her continue the operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ligaya dreams of growing her business and hopes to live happily and peacefully.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 56. She is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sergio, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells fish. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elena hopes that that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a 59-year-old woman who is married with eight children. She lives in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she used to harvest her own coconuts for sale. She borrowed an amount of 20,000.00 PHP (Philippines pesos) from GDMPC micro credit to finance the coconut post-harvest labor costs and to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to cultivate the farm to generate additional income that would help them in the future.

loans.use: To finance coconut post-harvest labor costs and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham province where her residential area is, Sima is 43 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are students in a local school. Since Kampong Cham is an area where cassava is one of the famous products, and the farmer can generate more income from this cash-crop, Sima also grows this crop on her 1 hectare of farmland. To supplement her income, she plants soybeans on a 1.5-hectare area. 

For two years that she has been occupied in this business, she has been able to earn about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. Sima has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two times including this loan. After the successful loan, which she has completely repaid, she feels confident that she can upgrade her living conditions at a good pace. Moreover, she can sustain her business progressively. 

Now, she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR. She will spend her loan portion to pay for labor costs for those who help her to grow cassava and to use some portion of it to support her soybean farming. She hopes that she can gain a high income and make a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Mom is married and blessed with four children.  Nowadays, three of her kids are still under her dependency. She manages two hectares of rice growing as the main source of income while her husband works for others for a fee. The 20 years involvement in the current business, she is able to earn around 22,000 KHR per day. This is the third time that Mom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan, which she has repaid with success, has supported her business on time and has returned her a decent profit to sustain her living as well as to keep her kids in school. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her farmland. Therefore, she seeks a new loan to buy rice potash, rice seed, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs who help her to plow her farmland. She hopes that she can gain high crop yields better than before and sell with high prices to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice potash, rice seed, and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Paula Cleotilde

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esa relación tiene 3 hijas mayores de edad, dos  de ellas  están casadas y viven allí con sus familias. 

Doña Paula es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por si misma para salir adelante, se dedica a la  venta de ropa de todo tipo para lo cual siempre busca lo que este de temporada para que tengan más salida, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta pero también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar uniformes y ropa interior para niños que es lo que más vende actualmente. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal María Monserrate (Maria Monserrate Communal Bank) meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are recognized nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

This is where 65-year-old Paula lives. Her husband passed away several years ago and left her a widow. But she has 3 grown daughters from this relationship, two of whom are married and live there with their families.

Paula is a very tenacious woman who likes to do things for herself to get ahead. She works selling all types of clothing, so she is always searching for what is in season in order to have more turnover. Her type of sales is door-to-door but she also sells from her house, where her customers come when she has new merchandise. She works every day. She extends credit to her customers and collects on a weekly basis. She has been engaged in this occupation for more than 3 years and things have gone very well for her.

This loan is to be used to purchase uniforms and underclothing for children, which is what she currently sells most. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she is pleased because she began her business with one of the loans.

Her dream is to have fixed premises for selling her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and underclothing for children.

loans.name: María Del Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 77 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido solo trabaja en ocasiones.

Doña María con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto  poder salir adelante  ya que su marido solo trabaja  por días se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella sale a vender casi todos los días ya sea en las  mañanas o en las tardes y no tienen horario fijo,  deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, ella lleva 8 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo para el bien de su hogar.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo y  uniformes que es lo más se vende actualmente, por la época de entrada a clases. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por  la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "María Monserrate" communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi, a canton known for its rich, pre-colonial history and its artisan crafts which are known both at national and international levels.  It is also from here that the famous straw hats originate.

María lives here in Montecristi. She is 77 years old, married and has six children with her husband, all of whom are now independent adults.  María's husband only works from time to time.

With her husband working so rarely and in order to earn a little money on her own and to get ahead, María sells all types of clothing.  She goes out almost every day, either in the morning or afternoon but she does not have a fixed timetable.  Customers can pay on credit in weekly installments.  María has been doing this work for eight years as it allows her to earn a little to support the household.

María is going to use this loan to buy all types of clothes and school uniforms, which is what is selling best at the moment, with classes having just re-started after the holidays.  María has been with the communal bank sing the very beginning and she likes the help that is provided though loans.

María's dreams are to stay healthy and to move ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and uniforms.

loans.name: Josefina Patricia

texts.es: Gracias a su crédikiva anterior, Josefina compró mercancias variadas, como aceite, arroz, plátano, papel higienico, con lo que surtió su negocio y por esa razón sus ventas se incrementaron. Josefina dice a los finaciadores de Kiva : "Gracias por su colaboración y ayuda, Dios los Bendiga". En la actualidad Josefina está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual compará mercancia variada, como víveres, y abarrotes. Su inversión prevee tener éxito, porque estos productos son los que mas vende en su negocio y ello impacta sus ingresos positivamente.
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, Josefina was able to purchase varied merchandise for her general store, such as cooking oil, rice, plantains, and toilet paper. With these goods she was able to stock her business and her sales increased as a result. Josefina says to Kiva lenders: "Thanks for your collaboration and help, God bless you." 

Currently, Josefina is applying for another Kiva loan, with which she will buy additional items to stock her store. She believes that this investment will be successful, because she will buy more of the products that sell the best, positively impacting her income.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: A vendor residing in Kampong Cham province, Kunthea is 30 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are still in school. To strive for their daily food consumption, Kunthea sells grocery items while her husband runs a motor taxi for extra income.  She has been occupied with this business for 10 years, earning about 21,400 KHR per day. Kunthea has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her past two loans and has fully repaid her loans already. The past loan has enabled her to expand her business in a good scale, to renovate her house, and to buy additional farmland. Now, she is seeking 1,500,000 KHR in order to buy a plot of farmland to build a decent house for her family, to buy more grocery items for resale, and to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that she can gain high income from her business so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy land, to buy more grocery items to sell and to build a latrine

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
From Moung Ruessei district in Battambang province, Cambodia, Norn, age 43, has been residing with her family and operating a farming business on around two hectares of farmland, where she grows rice and other seasonal crops to sell. She has been managing the business for more than 10 years, currently making a decent income to nourish and educate their children.

Norn has never been with any state bank before, and this will be her first loan cycle with HKL and Kiva. Norn intends to use the loan amounting to KHR 3,000,000 to buy materials for building a proper bathroom for her family's use, including a latrine. Norn is very happy that the loan will enable her to build a healthy family and secure the well-being of her family in the right manner.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a proper bathroom.

loans.name: Eucaris

texts.es: Eucaris de 43 años de edad se dedica ala venta de licores y refrescos. Desde hace un poco menos de 5 años, necesitando aumentar sus ingresos, recurrió a su hermana que le recomendó empezar este negocio, para orientarla con su experiencia. Así fue como en el año 2008, dio inicio a esta actividad, vendiendo gaseosas, cervezas y licores, los cuales ofrece 24 horas,  especialmente al final de la semana y días festivos, en los cuales  se incrementan sus ventas. Evans compra en un punto comercial cercano y su meta es lograr abrir un punto frio, con el fin de mejorar cada vez más sus condiciones de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cervezas y gaseosas en mayor volumen, par abastecerse en los fines de semana venideros que traen consigo muchos festivos y también porque se acercan los descansos vacacionales del semestre, temporada donde se incrementa el consumo de estos productos y por consiguiente sus ingresos..
texts.en: Eucaris is 43 years old and makes a living selling both alcoholic and soft drinks.  A little under five years ago, Eucaris needed to increase her income and her sister recommended that she start this business to guide her with her experience.  So, in 2008, Eucaris started the business, selling fizzy drinks, beer and liquor.  The shop is open 24 hours every day, particularly toward the end of the week and when there are festivals, times when sales increase.  Eucaris buys from a local distributor and her aim is to have a fridge in order to improve her living conditions.  Eucaris is applying for a Kiva loan - her first with the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" - which she will use to buy larger quantities of beers and fizzy drinks.  She will then be able to stock up for the coming weekends when there will be many festivals.  The semester holidays are also approaching and at this time consumption of these products goes up and so does Eucaris' income.

loans.use: to buy beers and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: La Sra. Dionicia sigue con la misma actividad de la Venta de leche,  cuenta que le fue con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de motor para el vehículo de su esposo,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de forraje para su ganado  ya que por esta época de frio escasea este alimento y ella quiere alimentar bien a su ganado ya que quiere incrementar su producción de leche, y por ende incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionicia continues with her previous business, selling milk, and she tells us that she has used up her pervious loan on the purchase of a motor for her husband's vehicle. 

On this occasion, she is asking for a loan in order to buy fodder for her livestock, because it is the cold season now and there is scarce food available for them. Dionicia wants to feed her livestock well, because this will help improve their production of milk. This, in turn, will help her to improve her earnings. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her livestock

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Angelica ella es conviviente,tiene 32 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos  y venta de jugos,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad,la socia dedea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche,azucar,fruta entre otros para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropa ,venta de cosmeticos, guía de turismo,crianza de animales,artesania,preparacion de bocaditos.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower, Maria Angelica, belongs to the communal bank "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope). This group is located in the district of Cusco. 

Maria Angelica lives with her husband, is 32 years old, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily acitivites between the sale of breakfast and the sale of juice. She has been working in this capacity for many years, and has been doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day. She sells her products itinerantly in the center of the city, and wishes to continue working this way in order to support her family. Maria Angelica is asking for this loan in order to buy milk, sugar, fruit, and other items for her business. 

The other members of this lending group work selling clothing and cosmetics, as tour guides, raising animals, making handicrafts, and preparing sandwiches. The members who could not be present for the group photo shown, asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting during which it was taken, due to business obligations. 

Maria Angelica is very grateful for all the people who from part of her dream, and she promises to comply with the repayment of her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, and fruit, among other items, for her business

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo de 53 años de edad, es un hombre humilde y trabajador, su familia es su mayor motivación y la razón que lo impulsa cada día a trabajar con esmero y dedicación. Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la comercialización de aliños en tiendas y supermercados de su localidad. De esta manera Adolfo se ha ganado la vida y ha generado los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
En la actualidad ha recurrido a la solicitud de un crédito con el fin de comprar surtido al por mayor, aumentando las ventas y mejorando su condición económica.
Sueña con brindarle a sus dos hijos acceso a la educación superior, ya que considera que es el mejor regale que puede entregarles.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 53 years old.  He is a humble and hard-working man and is motivated by his family and goes out to work with care and dedication every day for them.  For more than five years, Adolfo has made a living selling adornments in stores and supermarkets in his local area.  Adolfo has earned a living with this work and generated enough income to support his household.

Adolfo is currently applying for a loan in order to buy stock in bulk.  He can then increase his sales and improve his financial situation. 

Adolfo's dream is to pay for his children's further education as he believes that this would be the greatest gift he could give them.

loans.use: to buy adornments.

loans.name: Mabel Evelin

texts.es: La Sra. Mabel tiene 26 años, su actividad es la de venta de variedad de regalos para distintos acontecimientos su tienda se encuentra en una zona estratégica donde se encuentran salones de fiestas y tiene mucha demanda de regalos,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mabel va a usar este préstamo  para compra de mercadería y papel de regalos para su envoltura,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Mabel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria ya que por la zona varias son las que venden regalos  va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Mabel is 26 years old, and works selling various gifts for different occasions. Her store is located in a strategic zone where there are many party salons and high demand for gifts. 

This loan is Mabel's first with this institution, and she plans to use it to buy merchandise and wrapping paper. The reason she is requesting this loan is because she is in short supply of working capital. Mabel faces many challenges with her business on a daily basis, including high competition, and she hopes to use this loan to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto de 46 años, habita en el municipio de Malambo y es padre de  tres jóvenes en las edades de 16 a 19 años. Allí en su domicilio,  tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones, iniciado desde el año 1998, cuando su abuela le enseñó y él adicionalmente realizó un curso técnico, para perfeccionar su arte. Edilberto gradualmente fue apasionándose por su negocio, en el que hoy en día realiza todas las operaciones de la confecciona. Su negocio tiene un potencial de crecimiento que quisiera explorar, porque su sueño es tener una infraestructura técnica con más de 15 máquinas produciendo, para continuar aumentando su calidad de vida y la de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina plana, que mejorará sus tiempos productivo, encausando su ascenso hacia el logro de su sueño de prosperidad y esto es hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 46 years old, lives in the municipality of Malambo. He is a father of three children, ages 16 - 19. In his home he has a small sewing shop, which he started in 1998. His grandmother first taught him how to sew, and he later completed a technical course in order to perfect his art. Edilberto gradually increased his passion for his business, and today dedicates himself completely to his craft. His business has significant potential to grow, and his dream is to increase his infrastructure and reach 15 sewing machines, in order to continue to improve the quality of life of his family. 

Currently, he is applying for this loan from Kiva, his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in order to buy a new machine. This will improve his productivity, and help him towards his dream of prosperity. This would make his Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Adela Zamudio - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ADELA ZAMUDIO – 26 está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Ana tiene 46 años, dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Tembladerani ,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Ana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
The lending group "ADELA ZAMUDIO - 26" is composed of 8 members - seven women and one man. The President of this lending group, Ana, is 46 years old, has two school-aged children, and works selling primary care products from her store located in the Tembladerani neighborhood. 

This is her first loan with this institution, which she will use to stock her business with groceries, sweets, and sodas. She needs this loan because right now there is high demand for her products and she will be able to improve her sales by stocking more goods. Ana faces many challenges with her business, especially high competition, which she will confront with this loan by growing and strengthening her business, day by day. Her dream is to continue selling these goods in order to improve her income, and thereby provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Mercedes Edgar

texts.es:
El Señor Mercedes, Durante 19 años se ha dedicado a laborar en el área de kardista  y labora en un centro de salud, es casado con dos persona a su cargo, a quien le brinda el apoyo necesario de acuerdo a su situación económica.

  actualmente está presentando una urgencia de mejorar la pared y el techo de su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; Bloques, Cemento, hierro, perlin y clavos, para realizar dicha obra de mejorar la pared que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes, has worked as a medical administrator for 19 years and works in a health centre. He is married and provides for two people who he supports as best as his financial situation allows him.

Right now he is presented with an urgent need to improve his home's wall and ceiling. Therefore, he decided to visit ceprodel  to request finance to buy the construction materials such as: concrete blocks, cement, iron, purline and nails so he can carry out the work on the wall that badly needs it and in this way improve his living conditions and equality of life.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, concrete, iron, purlin and nails

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo vive en casa en anticretico en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz; soltero, no tiene hijos, tiene por actividad la venta de artefactos eléctricos,  actividad con la cual Pablo se mantiene y puede cubrir sus mínimas necesidades.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, poder surtir su mercadería y de esta manera no perder a sus clientes y además mejorar sus ingresos. Pablo comprará planchas eléctricas, cafeteras eléctricas, licuadoras, y otros al por mayor para disminuir sus costos.

El sueño de Pablo es poder tener una tienda donde ofrecer al por mayor sus productos ya que ahora los vende desde su casa.
texts.en:
Pablo lives in a house in the Miraflores area in the city of La Paz. He is single, does not have any children, and works selling electronics. With this work, Pablo is able to support himself and cover all of his basic needs. 

The loan that Pablo is currently asking for is to augment his working capital, so that he can stock his business with more merchandise. This way, he will not lose clients, and will also be able to improve his income. Pablo plans to buy electric irons, coffee makers, blenders, and other small appliances wholesale in order to decrease his costs. 

Pablo's dream is to be able to have a store where he offers all of his products, as he currently sells these goods from his house.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell to his clients

loans.name: Elington Antonio

texts.es:
Elington es originario de la linda ciudad de Matagalpa, la perla del septentrión ubicada en la parte noreste de Nicaragua, Elington es un joven de 27 años de edad su estado civil es soltero no tiene hijos, se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos valores morales.

Actualmente es trabajador de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace más de dos años  desempeñándose como responsable de cartera y cobro, sus ingresos obtenido en esta empresa lo destina para gasto de sus estudios ya que está cursando la universidad y para ayuda de su padres.

Solicita un financiamiento para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que por razón de trabajado le corresponde movilizarse a diferentes sectores y comunidad y la moto es el medio más idóneo para realizar.

Elington agradece el apoyo que le puedan brindar por kiva ya que de esta manera va comprar su moto el cual va ser de mucha importancia.
texts.en:
Elington is from the beautiful city of Matagalpa, the pearl of the north, situated in the northeast of Nicaragua. Elington is 27 years old and is single with no children. He is known as a person who holds good moral values.

At the moment he is working for a water mains and sewage system company. For the last two years, he has been in charge of client portfolios and finance. He uses his earnings to pay for his studies, as he is studying at university, and to help his parents.

He is requesting finance to buy a motorcycle, as it would help him in his work to get to different areas and a motorbike is the most suitable mode of transport for this.

Elington is thankful for the support that he gets from Kiva as through this he is going to be able to buy his motorbike which will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Vugukuri Group

texts.fr:
Odette fait partie du groupe  Vugukuri  et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 35  ans et est mariée à Audifax, un agriculteur.  Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de  7 à  15 ans, tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique  (poisson , de l’huile de palme, des cacahouètes,...)  depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de cacahouètes (200kg) à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Odette is part of the Vugukuri group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 35 years old and is married to Audifax, a farmer. Together they have four children, aged 7-15 years, all studying.

She has been managing a retail shop (fish, palm oil, peanuts,...) for the past 10 years.

She is on her thirteenth credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she obtains, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of peanuts (200 kg) for resale, to increase her earnings.

In future years, she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children pursue their studies.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of peanuts (200 kg) for resale, to increase her earnings.

loans.name: G.s Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Fe y Esperanza está conformado por cuatro personas, tres mujeres y un hombre madres y padres responsables con 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Este grupo se caracteriza por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. A pesar que no pudieron cursar sus estudios básicos, por falta de recursos económicos lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos. 
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante, Florentina es la coordinadora del grupo y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que brindan productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles, jugos, detergente, pan, jugos, huevos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo solidario  fe y esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Fe y Esperanza [Faith and Hope] comprises four people – three women and one man –, all responsible parents with 10 children in their care. They are from the Sauce area, which is located in the north of the country.  This group is known for its hardworking and responsible members, who are eager to do well in life. Despite not being able to complete basic studies due to a lack of economic resources, the members continue their daily struggle to provide a better future for their young children.

Thanks to her energy and desire to get ahead, Florentina is the group’s coordinator. She carries out the economic activity of a “pulpería”, which is located in her house. A “pulpería” is a small store that sells food and other items, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, juices, washing detergent and eggs, in small quantities. She works in the business 12 hours a day selling her goods. 

Her objective for the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her retail business with goods. She hopes that in the not too distant future she will be able to obtain better income. The communal bank Fe y Esperanza is grateful for the help given by the Kiva investors to people who have few economic resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have the means to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her retail business with food and other items, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, juices, washing detergent and eggs

loans.name: Mildred

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mildred, quien con su anterior credikiva logró aumentar el volumen de sus compras de insumos y vender mas almuerzos. Mildred, siente que tiene mas solvencia económica en su vida; tambien manifiesta que está a la espera de recibir su vivienda y esto la hace muy felíz. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores: "Gracias por su interés en ayudarnos a nosotros las personas que queremos salir adelante con nuestros negocios. "   tambien estoy saliendo adelante con otros nuevos negocios comerciales. En la actualidad Mildred, está aplicando au credikiva con el que comprará víveres cárnicos etc, con los cuales aumentará su capital de trabajo y hacer de su credikiva una buena inversión, porque lo que masestá  vendiendo, son los almuerzos y de alli se deriva este esfuerzo.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Mildred, who with her previous loan succeeded in increasing the volume of her ingredient purchases and was able to sell more lunches. Mildred feels that now she is more economically solvent. She is also close to acquiring her own home, which also makes her very happy. She sends the following message to her financers: "Thank you for your interest in helping us, we are people who want to get ahead with our businesses." Currently, Mildred is working on a few new businesses, and with this new loan will buy meat products in order to use in the lunches she prepares. With the working capital provided from the loan, she will be able to invest in her businesses, and continue to get ahead through hard work.

loans.use: to buy meat products

loans.name: Alba Leticia

texts.es:
Alba de 52 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y de grandes aspiraciones. Desde hace más de 20 años aprendió el arte de la culinaria gracias a sus antiguos trabajos. En la actualidad tiene un pequeño local en donde se dedica a la venta de comidas en conjunto con una de sus hijas. 
Con el fin de continuar con el desarrollo de la actividad, Alba se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, un greca, un microondas, utensilios de cocina y productos de la canasta familiar, lo que le permitirá aumentar las ventas y generar mayores recursos que se traducirán en una mejor calidad de vida para su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Alba is 52 years old. She is known as being an entrepreneurial woman with big aspirations. Over 20 years ago, she learnt the art of cooking thanks to her previous jobs. Now she has a small business where she sells food along with one of her daughters.

With the aim of continuing to develop this, Alba is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying a fast food cart, a hot drinks dispenser, a microwave, kitchen utensils and everyday food products. This will allow her to increase sales and generate more resources that will translate into a better quality of life for her immediate family.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart, a hot drinks dispenser, a microwave, kitchen utensils and everyday food products.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es casado y tiene un hijo un varón que colabora a su familia en sus actividades, viven en casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Challapampa de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja de chofer, con movilidad propia en una de las líneas de buses de la ciudad    y la esposa también ayuda en el trabajo, es comerciante ambulante.  Ellos trabajan todos los días de la semana, ambos  colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de llantas para su movilidad ya que es su única fuente de ingreso, la ruta y el recorrido están llenos de tierra y polvo.
El sueño de Luis es poder contar con nueva movilidad propia que le facilite a mejorar sus ingresos y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Luis is married and has a son who helps to earn money for the family. They live in their own house made out of adobe with a cement floor, which has a living room, bedroom, kitchen and bathroom. The house is located in the Challapampa zone in the city of La Paz. 

Currently, Luis works as a chofer, with his own bus on one of the city's bus lines. His wife also works, and she sells various products itinerantly. Both work every day of the week, and collaborate to pay for utilities, food, and clothing. 

This loan is needed to buy new tires for the bus, since the route that Luis works is full of dirt and dust. Luis' dream is to be able to purchase a new bus, which would help him to improve his income and thereby his quality of life. This is the first time he is asking for a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy bus tires

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio es originario de la bella ciudad de Matagalpa conocida como la perla del septentrión ubicada en la parte noreste de Nicaragua, estado civil de Ignacio es casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, este señor se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador y con buenos valores morales. 

Su oficio es valvulero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado el trabajo consiste en reparar todas las llaves de pase del sistema de acueducto.

solicita un financiado a kiva y ceprodel para gastos familiares específicamente en la celebración de los quince años de su hija ya que es una manera de estimular o premiar a su hija.

 Ala misma vez agradece a kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que de esta manera podrá realizar un sueño de su hija y podrá compartir con su familia y amistades.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a native of the beautiful city of Matagalpa, which is known as “the pearl of the north”. It is located in the northeast of Nicaragua. Ignacio is married and has two children who are school-aged. He says he is known for being hardworking and having good moral values.

Ignacio works as a valve technician in an aqueduct and sewer system company. He is responsible for repairing all of the main valves of the aqueduct system.

He is requesting a loan through Kiva and CEPRODEL to pay for a celebration with family and friends for his daughter’s fifteenth birthday, as a way of encouraging and rewarding her.

Ignacio says he is very grateful to Kiva, because with Kiva’s support he will be able to make his daughter’s dream a reality and share it with his family and friends.
