loans.use: to pay for a celebration with family and friends for his daughter’s fifteenth birthday.

loans.name: Diana Jannette

texts.es:
Diana tiene 34 años y es madre soltera de cuatro hijos menores de edad. Por su precaria condición económica y las responsabilidades que recaen sobre ella, esta mujer trabaja incansablemente para llevarle a su familia alimento. Actualmente labora en un cultivo de flores, pero los ingresos no son suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y garantizarles educación a sus hijos. Razón por la cual Diana desea iniciar con la venta de comida y mejorar su condición económica. Para materializar su proyecto de negocio se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y un carro de comida rápida.
Sueña con tener una estabilidad económica y olvidarse de los sufrimientos y necesidades que ha tenido que afrontar.
texts.en:
Diana is 34 years old and she is a single mother of 4 young children.  Because of her precarious economic situation and the responsibilities that come with being a mother, she works tirelessly to provide food and support her family.  She now works in growing and selling flowers, but the income is not sufficient to provide for the basic needs of her household or to pay for an education for her children.  For this reason, Diana decided to begin selling food in order to improve her economic situation.  In order to start this project, she is seeking a loan so that she can buy food products and a fast food cart.

Her dream is to have economic stability and to forget the challenges and obstacles that she has had to face.

loans.use: to buy various food products and a fast food cart.

loans.name: Camilo De Jesús

texts.es:
Camilo de 53 años de edad, es un humilde campesino del municipio de la Ceja Antioquia, Colombia. Dedicado a la agricultura como medio de sostenimiento para su familia. Hace más de 4 años decidió radicarse en la zona urbana de su localidad, por lo cual abrió una legumbrería con el fin de generar ingresos. 
Cada ocho días compra a sus amigos campesinos la cosecha y la comercializa en la plaza de mercado. 
Asegura que uno de sus mayores retos es  la competencia por lo cual trata de innovar en su calidad de servicio y buenos precios. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de en su hogar.
texts.en:
Camilo is 53 years old. He is a humble countryman from the area of Ceja Antioquia, Columbia. He supports his family through working in agriculture. 4 years ago, he decided to settle in an urban zone of his area. He decided to open a vegetable shop there to make more income. 

Every week he buys food from his country friends' harvests and sells it in the market square. He comments that one of his main challenges is competition. Therefore, he tries to be innovative in providing good customer service and good prices. He is currently requesting a loan which he will invest in stock with the aim of improving his household's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Julian Alexis

texts.es:
Julian es un joven de 21 años de edad, al que le apasiona el mundo de los negocios. Al terminar de su bachillerato decidió crear su propio negocio gracias a la ayuda de sus padres. Hoy cuenta con una tienda de sentimientos, la cual afirma ha tenido una buena acogida en su municipio, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y un computador con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos y garantizarles a sus clientes una mejor prestación del servicio. 
Sueña con ingresar a la universidad e iniciar sus estudios en administración pero es conciente que para ello debe laborar fuertemente y reunir el dinero necesario para el pago de los semestres.
texts.en:
Julian is 21 years old and is passionate about the world of business. When he finished high school, he decided to start his own business with the help of his parents. Today he has a gift store, which he says has been well received in his municipality. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his store, including stuffed animals, stationary sets and chocolates, as well as a computer. His objective is to increase the variety of his inventory and offer his customers a better service.

Julian dreams of entering the university and beginning studies in business administration, but he is aware that for this he must work hard and save the money for his tuition.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his gift store, including stuffed animals, stationary sets and chocolates, as well as a computer.

loans.name: Booku Juboo Kahone Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Booku Juboo regroupe 5 personnes qui s’activent dans le commerce de divers produits. Elles ont comme responsable, la dame Penda, qui vend de l’encens et des perles, activité qu’il a démarré il ya de cela 10 ans. La dame Penda fait aussi un peu d’élevage de poulets de chair qu’il place dans le quartier et les environs.
Elles en sont à leur 3ème crédit à l’IMCEC et veulent un renouvellement de 750000F CFA pour améliorer leur activité.
Penda participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Elle a comme souhait d’acquérir un grand poulailler et d’augmenter le nombre de production.
texts.en:
The BooKu Juboo credit loan group includes five people who actively trade various products.

The group responsible is lady Penda who has been selling incense and beads for over ten years. Lady Penda also breeds a few broiler chickens she sells in the neighborhood and surrounding areas.

They are on their third credit loan with IMCEC and want a renewal of 750,000 FCFA to improve their business activities.

Penda participates in household daily expenditures. She wishes to acquire a large chicken coop and increase her production.

loans.use: buy incense and pearls and also breed broiler chickens

loans.name: Nubia Estela

texts.es: Nubia es madre de un hijo de 12 años de edad, hace varios años inició laborando como ayudante en una tienda de su localidad, pero debido a la mala administración del propietario entró en quiebra, así que Nubia le propuso que se la alquilara. De esta manera Nubia se convirtió en toda una mujer de negocios. Asegura que las ventas resurgieron y el negocio comenzó  en crecimiento. En la actualidad se siente satisfecha por lo resultados obtenidos, razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito para invertir en la compra de surtido garantizándole a sus clientes un mejor servicios y lograr fidelizarlos. Sueña con tener un gran mercado autoservicio y convertir su negocio en el número uno de su localidad.
texts.en:
Nubia is the mother of a son who is 12 years old.  For many years she had worked as an assistant in a store in her neighborhood, but because of poor management by the owner, the business went bankrupt. Nubia now has the opportunity to rent the store.

This is how Nubia has become a business woman.  She is confident that sales will return and that the business will begin to grow.  In fact, she is satisfied by the results she has already seen.  She is now motivated to seek a loan so that she can buy staple food products so that she can offer her customers better service and gain their loyalty. Her dream is to have successful mini-market and to become the number one business in her region.

loans.use: to buy basic food items.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huampani Group

texts.es: Isidora tiene 64 años soltera es socia del grupo “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE HUAMPANI”  más de un año. Hace varios años implemento una tienda de golosinas, kekes, pudines, en su vivienda a la vez se presta servicios de lavado de ropa. Aunque no tiene hijos a su cargo. Isidora trabaja para sentirse útil y generar sus propios ingresos que le ayudan para asumir gastos que necesita. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y un mostrador para exhibir su mercadería. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Isidora es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Isidora is 64 years old and she has been part of the "Las Triunfadoras de Huampani" group for over a year.  For many years she has run a store in her home where she sells candies, cakes and puddings.  She also washes clothes and provides laundry services for her customers.  Although she doesn't have children to care for, Isidora works so that she feels useful and to earn money for any expenses that she has.  

She will use this loan to buy candies and a display counter to showcase her merchandise.  Her goal is to grow her business and to be able to make home improvements.  The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loans they provide.  Isidora is the second person from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy candies and a counter to display her products.

loans.name: Morelia

texts.es:
Morelia tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos de nueve y cinco años. En la actualidad labora como docente pero manifiesta que el salario es poco para los gastos que tiene como familia. Razón que la ha impulsado a crear su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, el cual abrirá en horas de la tarde cuando termine su faena en la institución educativa donde labora. Asegura que nuevos ingresos mejorarán sustancialmente la calidad de vida de sus hijas.
Sueña con seguir laborando como docente, ya que su trabajo es su más grande pasión. Espera convertirse en una fuente de empleo para las personas más vulnerables de su localidad.
texts.en:
Morelia is 37 years old. She is a mother to two children aged nine and five years old. She is currently working as a teacher but her salary isn't enough to cover her household costs.  For this reason, she has started her own business selling everyday food items. 

She will open it in the afternoons when she finishes her shift at the school. She comments that the new income will substancially improve her daughters' quality of life. She hopes to continue working as a teacher as this is her great passion. She hopes to be able to turn her venture into a source of employment for more vulnerable people in her area.

loans.use: to buy everyday food items

loans.name: Santos Luis

texts.es:
El  Señor Santos de 54 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica la compra de y venta de tierra, arena, grava y todo tipo de material de construcción.
Don Santos tiene bastante clientela establecida en donde solo le llaman para hacerle sus pedidos y el sale a entregarlos.
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para compra de material de construcción como cemento, ladrillo, grava, arena, etc. para su negocio y a la vez terminar de construir ya que está ampliando su casa de habitación, tiene una parte del material y requiere compra otros.
Don Santos su sueño es ampliar su negocio y montar una pulpería en su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo  del 2013.
texts.en:
Santos is 54 years old and lives with his wife and their children in their home in San Lorenzo, which is located in the southern part of Honduras.  He buys and sells dirt, sand, gravel, and all types of construction materials.  Santos has a large, established customer base and his customers call him and tell him their needs, and he brings them the required items.

Santos is seeking a loan so that he can buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, gravel, sand, etc. for his business and also in order to complete the construction that is currently in progress on his home.  He has part of the materials he needs but still needs to buy others.

Santos's dream is to grow his business and to put a small grocery store in his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, gravel, sand, etc. for his home and his business.

loans.name: Jesukpego 21 Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO 21 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et sont liées par un lien parental. La représentante du groupe, nommée Christiane S. Valery (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 59 ans. Christiane S. Valery a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Christiane S. Valery est divorcée avec  trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à sa charge. Christiane S. Valery vit avec ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont assurées par Christiane S. Valery. Pour ce faire, Christiane S. Valery vend de la nourriture (riz, etc.) et des sucettes dans sa région depuis deux ans. Christiane S. Valery s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Christiane S. Valery s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 21 pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jesukpego 21 is a group of three people, whose members are friends and are linked by kinship ties. The group representative, Christiane S. Valery (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 59 years old.

Christiane S. Valery went to school at primary level. She is divorced with three children, all having attended school and one of whom is still dependent on her. She lives with her children, and takes care of all household expenses.

To do this, Christiane S. Valery has been selling food (rice, etc..) and lollipops in the region for the past two years. She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

In order to strengthen her business and meet customer demand Christiane S. Valery, along with other members of the Jesukpego 21 group, is applying for a first credit loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy rice, vegetable oil, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kpemahuton 2 Group

texts.fr: KPEMAHUTON 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, nommée Yénoukoumè (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)est âgée de 55 ans. Yénoukoumè n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Yénoukoumè est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Assoclé. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Yénoukoumè vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de ménages. Pour ce faire, Yénoukoumè vend des lubrifiants (gasoil et de l'huile à moteur) à son domicile depuis trente ans. Yénoukoumè s'approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Yénoukoumè s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe KPEMAHUTON 2 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Kpemahuton 2 is a group of three people, whose members are friends and take part together in tontines (savings groups). The representative for the group is Yénoukoumè (the one raising her hand in the photo), and she is 55 years old.

Yénoukoumè did not attend school. She married a carpenter named Assoclé. The couple has three children, some of whom are in school and all are their dependents. Yénoukoumè lives with her ​​husband and children, and the couple shares household expenditures.

To manage this, Yénoukoumè has been selling lubricants (diesel fuel and motor oil) from her home for the past thirty years. She resupplies in Nigeria. 

To strengthen her business and meet customer demand, Yénoukoumè and the other members of the Kpemahuton 2 group are seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé. Previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy diesel fuel

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 52 años de edad. Es un hombre apasionado por lo vehículos, pasión que lo llevó a convertirse en un gran mecánico en su localidad.
Hoy es reconocido en el sector debido a la calidad en el servicio. Con más de de 36 años de experiencia se ha convertido en el número uno.
Gracias a sus padres, logró montar su propio taller, el cual se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos. Asegura que su mayor motivación es su esposa e hija de 22 años de edad, la cual espera ingresar a la universidad para iniciar su proceso de formación universitaria.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de herramientas de mano con el fin de remplazar las que se encuentran en mal estado.
texts.en:
Hugo is 52 years old. He is passionate about transport vehicles. It is because of this passion that he has become an excellent mechanic.

Today he is known in his field due to the quality of service he provides. With over 36 years’ experience, he has become number one in his locality.

Thanks to his parents he opened his own workshop. This workshop is how he earns his income. He comments that his greatest motivation is his wife and daughter (who is 22 years old). He hopes that she will go to university to start her university education.

He is requesting this loan which he will invest in the purchase of hand tools to replace old tools that are in bad condition.

loans.use: To buy work tools to improve services

loans.name: Médéssè François

texts.fr: Médéssè François est marié à Justine. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple à un autre enfant en sa charge. Médéssè François vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Médéssè François n’a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la mécanique. Pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Médéssè François vend dans son atelier des pièces de rechange et des lubrifiants. Médéssè François exerce ce métier depuis seize ans ce qui lui permet subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Médéssè François sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit précédemment obtenus a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Médéssè Francis is married to Justine. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and all are their dependents. In addition to their children, the couple has another child under their care. Médéssè François lives with his wife and children. The couple manages jointly the various family expenses.

Médéssè Francis did not attend school, but learned mechanics. To better meet the needs of his customers, he sells  spare parts and lubricants in his workshop. He has been doing this for sixteen years, which allows him to provide for his family.

In order to meet customer demand, Médéssè François is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the second time. The previous credit loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: Buy spare parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Las Bendecidas Group

texts.es: Luz,  tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, vive en una colonia de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Tiene 9 años de dedicarse a la venta de baleadas (tortillas de harina rellenas con frijoles, huevo, queso y otros). Esta actividad la realiza por las tardes en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras en forma grupal para comprar la materia prima como harina, frijoles, queso, manteca y crema para la venta de baleadas. El grupo al que pertenece se llama Las Bendecidas, formado por tres integrantes, en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta luz, en medio doña Paula y a la derecha esta Karla. Las tres viven en la misma colonia, se dedican a su propio negocio de venta de achinería, comidas y baleadas. Cada una esta solicitando 5,000 lempiras haciendo un total grupal de 15,000 Lempiras. sus planes son mejorar el negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz is 43 years old. she is married and lives in a neighborhood of San Pedro Sula with her husband and two children. For 9 years she has worked selling baleadas (flour tortillas filled with beans, eggs, cheese and more). She does this activity afternoons in her home. She has decided to ask for a loan of 5,000 lempiras with the group to buy raw materials such as flour, beans, cheese, lard and cream, in order to sell baleadas. The group she belings to is called Las Bendecidas [The Blessed]. There are three members. In the photo they can be identified thusly: on the left is Luz, in the middle is Paula and on the right is Karla. The three of them live in the same neighborhood and work in their own businesses selling various items, food and baleadas. they are each asking for 5,000 lempiras, for a group total of 15,000 lempiras. Their plans are to improve their businesses and their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, cheese, eggs, lard, etc. to make baleadas.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel vive en casa propia con su esposa ya que sus hijos son independientes, vive en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz y tiene por actividad la venta de arena.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar un terreno para sus hijos, ya que durante este tiempo ahorró junto con su esposa y recién le ofrecieron un terreno a un precio económico y no quiere perder esta oportunidad.


El sueño de Gabriel es que cuando deje de trabajar sus hijos estén viviendo cómodamente y que su esposa tenga una tiendita de barrio en su casa con lo cual puedan mantenerse durante su vejez.

Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la primera con Kiva
texts.en:
Gabriel lives in his own home with his wife. His children are on their own. He lives in the area of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. His activity is selling sand.

The loan he is asking for is to buy a plot of land for his children. He has saved up with his wife and recently he was offered a plot at a good price and he doesn't want to miss this opportunity. 

Gabriel's dream is that when he stops working, his children can live comfortably and his wife can have a little neighborhood store in their house to support herself in old age. 

This is the fourth time that he has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to leave as inheritance for his children.

loans.name: Manantial * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento MANANTIAL * 26 está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Celestina  tiene 56 años, y seis hijos, en la foto es la que esta sentada a la izquierda, pa persona mayor, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  en la zona de Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de algunos cuartos en su vivienda su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere brindar comodidad a su familia ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan su espacio,  La Sra. celestina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona que venden los mismos productos que ella, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener a la larga una tienda surtida, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en: The MANANTIAL * 26 communal bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men. The president of the bank is Celestina. She is 56 years old. and has six children. In the photo, she is seated on the left. She is an older person who works selling candies and snacks in her sales locale in the Villa Dolores area of the city of El Alto. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. She is going to use this loan to buy construction material to build some rooms in her house. The reason she is asking for this loan is that she wants her family to be comfortable, since her children are growing and they need their space. Celestina faces challenges in her business such as the competition, since there are several stores in the area that sell the same products that she does. She wants to keep selling for her business and in the long term have a well stocked store. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has given to her and the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Pov is in her late 40s and has three children. To overcome her financial burden, she does cassava cultivation on a half hectare area as her main income and plants rice on one hectare for supplementary income. The farming business that she has been with for 20 years earns her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Pov’s group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); Pov is in the same cycle as her joint member. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Pov will buy herbicide for her cassava farm and potash for her farmland. She has high hopes that she can grow her cassava fruitfully so that she can upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for her cassava farm, and potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
A young married mother of two kids living in Kampong Cham province, Kunthea is a farmer who grows rice on a half hectare area as the main source of income. Her husband also assists in earning a decent income via working at construction sites. This is the first microloan for Kunthea’s group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Her group, consisting of two female members, is seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Kumthea will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more profit to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Soknai

texts.en:
A 33-year-old mother of two children who are still in school, Soknai is a villager who sells fish in the local area of Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal Province. She has been involved with this business since she was 27 years old and is able to earn up to 36,800 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), who has fully repaid her past loans with success. 

The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to buy a decent motorbike for commuting as well as to support her business. Moreover, she can keep her kids in school. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy a cow for raising. She hopes that she can raise her cow well so she can sell it at a high price and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy a cow for raising.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
In her early 40s and a mother of one kid, Thavy is a rice grower residing in the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province. Besides helping on the farmland, her husband runs a motor-taxi for extra income during his free time. 

The farming business, which has occupied Thavy for three years, has returned her about 30,600 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Thavy, as she has taken loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) three times already and has fully repaid them. She feels confident that she can improve her living conditions and keep her kids in school because of these loans. 

Now, she is taking another loan in order to buy potash and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can produce a high crop yield from her cash-crop growing business so she can build a good house for her kids.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Marry's Group

texts.en:
Marry, a member of a two-person borrower group, is a 29-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and two children. Her husband is an auto mechanic by profession and his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

Marry wants to educate her children in good schools so that they can have a bright future. Currently, she can’t send them to good schools due to the financial constraints, because of which she is very worried about their future. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is a very skilled woman and she wants to open a beauty parlor in her house to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She would purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, creams, facial scrubs, makeup kits, etc. and would also purchase some chairs for her salon. She is very hopeful about this loan as she could start her business from this loan. She would spend the profits on the education of her children and to pay back her loan installments. In the picture, Marry is raising her hand

loans.use: To start a beauty salon business.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is a member of a three-person borrower group. Her husband is working as a carpenter in a factory. She has two kids, and due to his low monthly income she is having a very difficult time. 

Sofia is a well educated woman. She wants to help her husband in generating income by opening an academy where she could teach students for a nominal fee. In this way she would also utilize her teaching skills, and secondly she would be able to increase the monthly income which could solve many of her problems. 

From the Kiva loan she would buy some chairs, tables and some necessary furniture for the students. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders. In the picture, Sofia is raising her hand.

loans.use: To open up an educational academy.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 47, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She has three children and they help one another in managing their household while operating the business. At this time, Susan is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Susan operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evening when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Susan also has a direct selling business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, as well as frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susan hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mehboob

texts.en: A loan of 20,000 PKR would help Mehboob to get a new sewing machine for her daughter so that she could help her in her work. Mehboob has been doing this tailoring work for 15 years and she has excellent tailoring skills. Now, with the aid of her daughter, she would be able to make more dresses, resulting in an increase in her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her daughter.

loans.name: Elizer

texts.en: Elizer of Layawan, Oroquieta City, is 57 years old and married with an only child. To make a living, he owns and operates a motorcycle service for the local community. He has been doing this for years. Recently, he borrowed an amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires for his motorcycle. He plans to purchase another motorcycle to be used for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Gul

texts.en:
Gul is a 37-year-old diligent and hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and three daughters. Her husband is a government employee and all of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses. They are living in a rented house and Gul desires to have their own house, as they have to pay very high house rent every month. 

Gul has been helping her husband by selling clothing for three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy new varieties of clothing and expand her business. With the profit amount she wants to pay the educational expenses of her children and save some money for the future. She is very hopeful that the loan would be a productive one for them.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of colorful clothing for selling purposes.

loans.name: Mahudjro 24 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO 24 est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Patinvo Bertin (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgé de 57 ans. Patinvo Bertin a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Patinvo Bertin est marié à Josephine. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Patinvo Bertin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Patinvo Bertin et sa femme assurent ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Patinvo Bertin exerce comme activité la transformation des noix de palme en l'huile végétale et vend également les noix palmistes depuis une trentaine d'années. Patinvo Bertin s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Patinvo Bertin sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 24, un  premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mahudjro 24 group is made up of three people who belong to the same tontine group. The leader of the group who is called Patinvo Bertin (the one with his hand raised in the photo) is 57 years old. Patinvo Bertin went to school up to the end of the primary level. He is married to Josephine. They have five children, some of which attend school and two of which are dependent on them. Patinvo Bertin lives with his wife and his children. He and his wife share the family expenses. In order to have the means to do this Patinvo Bertin runs a business of transformation of palm nuts into vegetable oil and he also sells palm kernels. He has been running his business for about thirty years. Patinvo Bertin buys his stock at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy his clientele and to increase his turnover and his income, Patinvo Bertin and the other members of the Mahudjro 24 group, request a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Mahudjro 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO 4 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Fifamè ( celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 39 ans. Fifamè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Fifamè est divorcée avec deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Fifamè vit avec ses enfants. Fifamè assure toute seule les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Fifamè vend divers articles, du gari( farine fait à base de manioc), de l'huile végétale et des lubrifiants(gasoil) depuis une vingtaine d’année. Fifamè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Fifamè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 4, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Mahudjro 4 group is made up of three friends who live in the same neighbourhood. The leader of the group who is called Fifame (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is 39 years old. Fifame did not go to school. She is divorced with two children who both attend school. Fifame lives with her children. Fifame supports her family all by herself. In order to manage this, she has been selling various articles, gari (flour made from manioc base), vegetable oil and lubricants (diesel oil) for about twenty years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and her income, Fifame and the other members of the Mahudjro 4 group, request a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan was repaid correctly.

loans.use: To buy gari and deisel oil.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is married and has two children.  He is 54 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Philippines.

Oscar operates a service-based business.  To earn a living, he provides transportation services to local community members.  He is requesting  a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires.

In the future, Oscar hopes that he will double his business income and that his children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Norma Teresa

texts.es: Norma solía transitar por las calles con grandes paquetes de papel de baño para venderlo a los transeúntes o personas en las casas por donde pasaba. Hace un año decidió cambiar su negocio, dejó de transitar las calles y empezó a vender productos variados en su misma casa. Norma ahora vende ropas, zapatos, cremas, accesorios, y una variedad de productos de uso personal. Norma está solicitando un préstamo de $10,600 pesos para comprar una vitrina para exhibir mejor sus mercancías más pequeñas, algunas zapatillas, blusas, entre otras cosas más para la venta en su negocio. Su plan para el futuro es agrandar su negocio hasta tener una gran tienda de variedades y mejor comodidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma used to travel the streets, selling large packages of toilet paper to passers-by and people who live in the area. A year ago, she decided to change businesses by selling merchandise from her house rather than as a street vendor. Norma now sells clothing, shoes, creams, accessories, and personal care items. 

Norma has applied for a loan of $10,600 pesos to buy a display case to better show her smallest items, some sandals, blouses, and other merchandise for sale. Her plan is to grow her business into a large general merchandise store that is more comfortable for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a display case, sandals, blouses, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a 42-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children. Her eldest child is 18 and her youngest is 9.

Bernadeth operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods including shampoo, soy sauce, eggs, soap, and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy a variety of goods to stock her store. This will allow her to meet the increasing demands of her customers.  

In the future, Bernadeth would like to expand her business in order to be better able to support her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to stock her store

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is 66 years old, a widow and lives with her eight children in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She used to sell fish in the local community to earn a living. She borrowed an amount of 4,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a variety of fish to sell. She saved a portion from her profit for their future reserved fund.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo desde hace 15 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Juan lives in his own house with his wife and their three children.  He has been growing corn and sorghum for 15 years.  This is the way he earns a living and is able to bring home the daily bread.  He does his business activity of farming year after year.  It is the only way he knows of earning a living.  He is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible man.  In spite of his living conditions, which are very humble, he does not tire of working and giving his family the best.

He has decided to request a loan to buy the main agricultural supplies:  fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, etc.   He will also improve the land where he plants, which is shown in the photo.  He hopes to have favorable results because he does not have another source of income.  He trusts in God that he will manage to get an abundant harvest, which will allow him to continue bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Gazala is a 38-year-old, hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and five children. Her husband is doing a job in a hospital and running his own mobile phone shop as well. This shows that he is really a hardworking person. He is the only person earning in the family. 

Gazala has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase some new mobile phones for his shop. He would purchase mobiles of high demand like Apple, Samsung, Nokia, etc. and then sell them at a profitable amount. Gazala is very hopeful for this loan and is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new mobile phone sets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y fríjol con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive con su familia en casa propia. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
The client's main source of income is farming. He grows corn and beans; his profit from the harvest lets him pay some of his household expenses. He lives with his family in their own house. He wants to buy needed planting supplies, such as manure, fertilizer, and seed, and to maintain his land, which is shown in the photo. 

He lacks the necessary funding and has decided to apply for a loan, as this is the only way he can continue planting his crops. Like all farmers, he has placed his confidence in agriculture because he has no other income source and he wishes to succeed by producing the best crops they can. He hopes to have an abundant harvest that will allow him to provide for his family each day and to pay this loan.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and seed and to maintain his land.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy RTW products and merchandise items. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Grace dreams of giving her son a good life and a future. She hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
This is Gleceria, 35, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eduard, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gleceria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells fish. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 40,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Gleceria dreams that her store will become a grocery store and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is a food vendor from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has  ten grown-up children. Asuncion has been in the food vending business for more than 12 years now. 

Asuncion is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like sugar, peanuts, glutinous rice, salt, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Asuncion has hopes of making her business a success and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like sugar, peanuts, glutinous rice, salt, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Jemina Lidia

texts.es:
Jemina tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee paisajes hermosos y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y amables. Jemina es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo y a pesar de sus pocos recursos económicos logro estudiar la carrera de Educación, y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; Jemina cree que esta saliendo adelante porque le gusta mucho su carrera y sobre todo porque le encanta enseñar.

Jemina está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá solventar los gastos de su maestría y elaborar sus materiales para la enseñanza a sus alumnos, de esta manera ella podrá cursar su maestría sin problemas y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y formar una familia”.
texts.en:
Jemina is 35 and lives in the city of Pucallpa, known for its welcoming climate, beautiful landscape, and, most of all, for its happy and friendly residents. Jemina wants to get ahead and, with great effort and little money, has managed to obtain a teaching degree. Her income helps her parents pay the household expenses. Jemina believes she has been successful because she loves her profession and, above all, is delighted to be teaching. 

Jemina is very grateful to Kiva lenders, whose support will allow her to pay the costs of her master program and to create teaching materials. She will be able to finish her master program and to increase her income, which will let her keep striving to achieve her greatest dream: becoming a great professional and starting a family.

loans.use: to pay for a master program.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a  variety store business. She sells items like coffee, canned goods, noodles, soaps and soft drinks. She has been operating a variety store for three years. 

Carmela requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods like seasonings, beverages, soft drinks and other dry goods to attract more customers. In the future, Carmela would like to expand her business to support her family and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to re-sell

loans.name: Dossou Gérard

texts.fr: Dossou Gérard, âgé de 37 ans est marié à Mariette. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Dossou Gérard vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Dossou Gérard n’a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. Dossou Gérard vend également des appareils électroménagers dans sa région. Dossou Gérard s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. Dossou Gérard exerce ce métier depuis dix sept ans, ce qui lui permet subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Dossou Gérard sollicite pour la cinquième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Dossou Gerard who is 37 years old, is married to Mariette. They have three children some of which attend school at their expense. Dossou Gerard lives with his wife and his children. He shares the family expenses with his wife. Dossou Gerard did not go to school, but learned to be a hairdresser. He also sells household electrical goods in his region. Dossou Gerard buys his stock at markets in Benin and in Nigeria. He has been in this business which enables him to provide for his family for seven years. In order to satisfy his customers' demand, Dossou Gerard requests a fifth loan from Alidé. All the previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To buy wheelchairs, lawn mowers, and to repair his workshop.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y  maicillo, tiene 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas,  sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad,  ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos,  etc.  Ana  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana, 35, lives with her life partner and three children in her own house. She makes a living cultivating corn and sorghum. She has been working in agriculture for ten years and it has given her a lot of experience that allows her to obtain better harvests. 

She sells her crops around the community. She already has a large clientele that prefers her quality, good prices, and above all her good service. She needs to invest, which is why she is requesting a loan to help her buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, compost, etc.

Ana has good payment references from people she knows, and she is very responsible. She is sure she can pay off her debt within the established time period and at the same time she trusts that it will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, compost, etc.

loans.name: Elba Jalec

texts.es: Doña Elba de 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz, sorgo  y el jocote con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  doña alba  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas y foliares, y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en: Elba, 40, lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She has been farming for several years and mainly plants corn, sorghum, and jocote. She is able to meet household expenses from crop sales and help from her husband. Elba has applied for a loan to buy manure, pesticide, weed killer, and liquid fertilizer to continue harvesting, which will increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticide, weed killer, liquid fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita is 46 years old and from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with six children, ages 8 to 17. Yolita has been engaged in weaving mats and helping with the family fishing business for 15 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, weight leads and floaters.

The loan will make their fishing business easier and more productive with the availability of the needed inputs. 

The income generated from this business will take care of the family's food consumption, school fees and household bills. 

In the future, Yolita hopes to successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, weight leads and floaters.

loans.name: Greivin

texts.es: Greivin, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar almacigo, insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Greivin, an enterprising man, is 23 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children.  Currently, he has asked for a loan with the desire to buy seedlings and supplies, like fertilizer and fumigators.  He wishes to provide care to the coffee plants with the purpose of keeping them in good condition during their growth in order to get a high quality product.  

The only constraint this gentleman has is the lack of money for continuing to grow.  Since he depends on this work to get ahead in life he has asked for a loan, and this is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He does not have other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Alvaro está muy agradecido con Kiva por apoyarlo económicamente con un crédito en el progreso de su negocio, el cual ha crecido en un 20% y por eso pide que lo sigan apoyando. Y es que su credikiva le sirvió para incrementar sus compras de aretes, camisetas, sombreros calzado y otras mercancías, con las que logró impactar a su clientela y vender más. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará productos artesanales como mochilas y tejidos diferentes de los que vende actualmente, con los cuales planea incrementar mucho más sus ventas, sus utilidades y por consiguiente genera más ingresos, pues tiene una clientela fija y sus productos son hermosos de buena calidad y precios justos.
texts.en:
Alvaro thanks Kiva for its financial support, which allowed his business to grow by 20%, and asks that the lenders continue to help him. With his Kiva loan, he increased his purchases of earrings, shirts, hats, shoes and other merchandise, allowing him to impress his customers and sell more.

He is now applying for a loan to buy handmade items such as backpacks and fabrics other than those he currently stocks, which will significantly increase sales, income, and profits. He has regular customers and offers beautiful, quality merchandise at fair prices.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Nerizza

texts.en:
This is Nerizza. She previously accessed a 42,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase grocery items and products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Nerizza would like to apply for a 44,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items she displays in her store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a higher profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to increased profits with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nerizza dreams that her business will be successful and hopes to provide her children with a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as toiletries and beverages, needed for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes that her family will have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda, of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, is a 34-year-old single mom with two children. To earn a living, she offers manicure and pedicure services in the community. She has been doing this for years, and she is now requesting an amount of 4,000 Philippines pesos from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a new set of manicure and pedicure accessories. She hopes to have a parlor of her own to be used for her business for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a new set of manicure and pedicure accessories.

loans.name: Mizpah

texts.en: Mizpah is from Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. She owns and manages their farm, harvesting coconut and bananas for sale. Recently, she's became a member of GDMPC, and she gained access to microfinance. She then borrowed an amount of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase fertilizer for the coconuts and finance the costs of maintenance labor. She plans to cultivate the farm in order to generate additional income for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the coconuts and finance the costs of maintenance labor.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Carmen, quien con su anterior credikiva compró un congelador y víveres que dieron crecimiento a su negocio. Su negocio se encuentra más surtido, vende más, gana más y tiene más clientes y una mejor presentación. Como inició venta de refrescos la empresa proveedora de ellos,  le regaló una nevera y ahora se incrementó su venta, pues el surtido es mayor. Ella dice textualmente el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores. “Señores fondeadores, doy gracias por apoyarme en mi negocio y espero me continúen apoyando para estar agradecida toda la vida: “  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina  de refrigeración, para tener exhibido los productos lácteos, que tambien comprará. Esta inversión  tendrá éxito porque surtirá mas y en mejores condiciones, ya que actualmente la que tiene no está funcionando bien y por eso necesita un buen almacenamiento para que sus productos roten con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Carmen, who with her previous Kiva loan bought a freezer and food supplies that made her business grow. Her business is better stocked, sells more, earns more and has more customers and better appearance. Since she began selling soft drinks, the soft drink provider gave her a fridge and now she has increased her sales since she has a larger stock. 

She sends the following message to her lenders: "Dear Funders: thanks you for supporting my business and I hope you continue to support me so that I can be thankful throughout all my life." She is currently applying to a new Kiva loan with which she will buy a refrigerated shop window so that she can have all of her dairy products - which she will also buy with the loan - on display.

This investment will be successful because she will stock more products in better condition, since her current shop window is not working well. She needs a good refrigerated storage unit so that her products rotate more frequently.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated shop window and dairy products

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband owns a garment shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of clothes for his business, so that he can increase his income.

However, due to the expense he finds it difficult. Therefore Rahat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase clothing for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental is a widow with an only child. For a living, she used to sell fish in the community for years. As a member of GDMPC, she then borrowed an amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional variety of fish for resale. She planned to own a store in the market to sell fish comfortably. She saved a portion of her income for the future of her child.

loans.use: to purchase additional variety of fish for resale.

loans.name: Carrie

texts.en: Carrie is a 26-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children, ages 2 and 4 respectively. She runs a variety store. She sells goods like eggs, soaps, canned goods and biscuits. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional variety of stocks like soaps, beverages, condiments and biscuits. In the future, Carrie would like to expand her business to be able to provide her family with nutritious foods, to be able to pay the weekly dues and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell.

loans.name: Tsetsegbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Tsetsegbayar, 41 years old, lives with her mother, brother and sister-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment. She has been working as a barber at a barber shop for twelve years. Her brother has been welding for a living by posting advertisements in websites and newspapers. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. The apartment they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair including installing vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors, and insulating walls with fiberglass and foam. So she is requesting a loan of 3300000 MNT to purchase the above-mentioned items in order to renovate her apartment. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place even in harsh wintertime. The apartment will no longer lose its heat and will preserve energy. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and foam

loans.name: Jackqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline de 42 años de edad es la propietaria de una miscelánea ubicada en su domicilio, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 25 años. Ella en sus 10 años de experiencia, ha logrado tener el reconocimiento de su negocio, pues ha trabajado desde muy joven en la actividad comercial. Sus surtidos son los mejores del sector, pues permanecen con un stock de perfumes cosméticos que agradan a su clientela y muy bien organizados. Su cónyuge es un albañil de oficio y sus hijas se encuentran casadas, esto hace que sus esfuerzos se dirijan en una gran proporción al negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en un local contiguo de su vivienda, donde vende a crédito a clientes, que son principalmente habitantes del sector.  Su meta es continuar ampliándolo y mejorar cada vez más su servicio para fácilmente hacer arreglos locativos en su vivienda y generar mucho confort. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará productos de belleza, perfumes ropa para damas y calzado, para aumentar sus inventarios y en consecuencia sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jaqueline, 42, is the owner of a general store located in her home, where she lives with her spouse and their two children, ages 22 and 25. In her ten years of experience, she has has achieved business recognition. She has worked in sales since she was very young. Her assortment is the best in the sector, since she always has a stock of cosmetic perfumes that her clients like, and they are very well-organized. 

Her spouse is a bricklayer by trade and their daughters are married. This means a large proportion of her effort is directed into the business, which is located in an establishment adjacent to her home. She sells on credit to clients who are principally the sector's inhabitants.

Her goal is to continue expanding her business and improve her service more and more in order to easily fix up her home and generate greater comfort. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy beauty products, perfume, women's clothing and footwear, in order to increase her inventory and consequently her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, perfume, women's clothing and footwear

loans.name: Sabelita

texts.en:
Sabelita, 53, is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother and is married to Antonio, a pastor. She manages her household while operating her retail store business. She works hard to continually earn money for her family's everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Sabelita operates a buy-and-sell business. She buys different products and supplies from wholesalers and repacks and resells them for a little profit. She sells toys, accessories, and other similar products. Customers are attracted to her products because of the low prices and the variety of products that she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She makes at least 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sabelita hopes that her business will expand to a bigger stall.  She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase toys and accessories needed for her business

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en: Imelda is 42 years old. She is married and has eight children. They live together in Magcamiguing, Calamba. Imelda has a shop that sells fruits and snacks. She has had this business for 18 years earning a monthly income of 2,000 PHP. Imelda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase school supplies for her children. Imelda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 11 years. Imelda is the leader of the three-member group although they have different responsibilities.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, thus generating more income. The loan also helped in the education of her children. She and her husband work hard to continuously provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She also has a tricycle for additional income. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams to have a grocery store and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Titchie

texts.en: Titchie is married with an only child and sells groceries in the community of Lower Langub, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has been doing this for years to earn for a living. Last year she became a member of GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods and bottled products for resale. She plans to expand her store and hopes to have more income for the better future of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and bottled products for resale.

loans.name: Luciano Marcial

texts.es:
El cliente Luciano, vive en La Libertad. El es un hombre emprendedor ya que comenzó con su negocio de servicio de taxi desde hace ya mucho tiempo para poderle dar lo mejor a su familia. Poco a poco recorrido las calles de Libertad consigue cubrir los gastos de su familia. 

Trabaja todos los días en un promedio de 10 horas al día. Esta casado y tiene 4 hijos menores que aun estudian en una escuela fiscal. El necesita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos, porque ha pesar de sus ingresos no tiene mucho financiamiento para poder ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luciano lives in La Libertad.  He is an enterprising man.  He started his taxi service business a long time ago in order to be able to give his family the best.  Traveling the streets of La Libertad, little by little, he gets enough to cover his family’s expenses.  He works an average of ten hours a day every day.  He is married and has four minor children, and they still attend a public school.

He needs the loan to buy school supplies for his children.  In spite of his income, he does not have a lot of money to be able to help his children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Martires

texts.es:
La Señora Mártires, de 42 años de edad vive  en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios   años a la venta de productos alimenticios y abarrotería en general. 
Doña  Mártires  su negocio está ubicado en  su casa, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de  mas productos como manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, carne, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis y refrescos en todas sus presentaciones.
Doña  Mártires  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar mas su inventario y poder tener todo los productos que sus clientes le demandan y así salir adelante con todos sus compromisos y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña  Mártires  su sueño es graduar a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo  del 2013.
texts.en:
Mártires, 42, lives in a home located in a village of San Lorenzo, a valley in the southern area of Honduras. She has made a living for several years selling food products and groceries in general.

Mártires' business is located in her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, meat, sausage, tomato paste, spaghetti and soft drinks of all varieties.

Mártires, with the support of this loan, hopes to increase her inventory and be able to have all the products her clients demand and that way she can get ahead with all of her commitments and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Mártires' dream is to get her children to graduate. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, meat, sausages, tomato paste, spaghetti, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Geovanie

texts.en:
Geovanie of Ospital, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, is a married man with one child. 

To make for a living, he operates a video karaoke machine in his community for five peso per song. He's been in this business for years and earns enough income to support his family's basic needs. He is purchasing another video karaoke machine in order to expand his business. He is requesting a 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit in order to execute his plan. 

He hopes to purchase more machines in order to generate more income to provide a better future for his child.

loans.use: to purchase another video karaoke machine

loans.name: Juan Isidro

texts.es:
San Rafael del norte un municipio que está ubicado en la parte norte del departamento de Jinotega, identificado  por su área boscosa y muchas especies de orquídeas, con un terreno apto para café y hortalizas. 

En una comunidad aledaña conocida como la sotana, Vive el señor Juan Isidro, con su esposa y sus dos hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, él de profesión agricultor, en el área de café es conocido  como una persona honesta y trabajadora con más de 15 años de experiencia.

Su propiedad tiene un área de 9 manzanas de extensión todas aptas para cultivo de café siendo una área boscosa 

Recientemente visitó las oficinas de ceprodel y está solicitando un crédito para compra de abono, fungicidas, foliares y gastos en mano de obra, para darle mantenimiento a su café donde piensa salir beneficiado.

 El impacto y beneficios que tendrá  él y su familia son de una forma positiva ya que trabajan  su finca a través de este rubro cada año,  mejorando su nivel de vida y condiciones económicas con los ingresos obtenidos en cada cosecha realizada.
texts.en:
San Rafael del Norte is a city located in the northern part of the Jinotega department, known for its wooded areas and many species of orchids, with a soil ideal for coffee and vegetable production.

Juan Isidro lives with his wife and two children in a neighboring community called La Sonata.  He must support and provide an education for them.  He is a farmer and raises coffee, and is known for being an honest and hardworking person with more than 15 years experience.

He has nine hectares of land, all fit for coffee production, being that it's a wooded area.

He recently came to the CEPRODEL offices and is asking for a loan to buy compost, fungicides, plants, and pay for labor in order to maintain his coffee crop.  He expects to benefit.

He and his family will receive a positive benefit because they work their land every year, improving their quality of life and financial condition with each harvest.

loans.use: to pay for labor and supplies.

loans.name: Huaihuen Group

texts.es: En el Banco Comunal Huaihuen encontramos distintos rubros como lo son artesanía, pescadores, congelados, mermeladas y la horticultura que es el negocio de María, se encuentra al costado derecho de la foto con un pañuelo rosado es blanca y de pelo ondeado, María también vende mermeladas y frambuesas, y en su invernadero comenzó hace un año su negocio de venta de verduras, de esta manera pueda aportar para su hogar. El problema que ha tenido es el clima ya que como con lugares en lo que frecuenta llover no ha podido cultivar mucho. Ocupará el crédito que se le otorgará en poder comprar madera, insumos y hualato, que sirve para mover la tierra. Ella espera que le vaya muy bien, ya que solo piensa en vender frambuesas y mermeladas, y si el clima está bien, podrá vender sus verduras.
